story:
Our farm is well established and is already producing some very tasty chillies. We have used these in our own recipes to produce a small range of amazing products such as our staple Apple Chilli Jelly and Chilli Infused Rapeseed Oil.

So far we have been creating these products in pots in the kitchen at Phil's Cafe, so production is somewhat limited. This is why we have started the campaign, we need to raise the funds to purchase a sauce making machine so that we can increase production and expand our product range.
We are very excited about our new products which we want to launch, such as, Chilli Chocolate, Pickled Cayenne, Infused Olive Oil, and Phil's Hot Sauce.  

As well as this we would like to overhaul our branding, we have created our own labels for our jars but once we scale up production we want to ensure our products look as good as they taste.

To achieve all of this would mean we could really unlock the potential of our budding business and all of our hard work and dedication will have been worth it. 

What We Need & What You Get

With your help we can make this happen by:

- Purchasing a sauce making machine. We already have a large kitchen available for use but we can't make the sauce in large quantities, the machine would mean we can scale up production and be much more efficient.

- Improving our branding. We would like to have new labels designed for the products that better represent the high quality taste and really stand out in the crowd.


As a thank you for supporting us we have a variety of exciting perks on offer including some exclusive jams and jellys made with our very own chilli cross breeds, some brand new products, as well as our existing products. We will be adding some more amazing perks throughout the campaign.

Each funder will also become a member of our exclusive Chilli Farm Club and will be invited to any launch parties we may have, be the first to know of any new products, and periodically receive discount codes for our online shop. 

The Impact

We strongly believe that Gloucestershire Chilli Farm will become a firm favourite with chilli lovers across the land. We have been steadily working towards this goal and we are proud of what we have acheived so far but with your support, and our passion and hard work, we can turn up the heat and take our business to the next level.

The sauce making machine and quality branding will enable us to reach these new heights. Should we exceed our goal (we like to think big!) we would love to purchase a chilli van so that we could actually deliver our products on a large scale.


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't help financially at this time there are other ways to support us:

- Spread the word, let your chilli loving friends and family know about us

- Follow us on Facebook

- Sign up to our newsletter for updates, product launches and special offers

Thank you for reading our story and we look forward to sharing our progress and success with you

story:
COME EXPERIENCE AWE INSPIRING COCKTAILS & SMALL PLATES IN DOWNTOWN PITTSBURGH

Help us to complete construction of Bridges & Bourbon, and then join us this Spring to experience our innovative and visually striking cocktails and small plates you helped to create!

Imagine a restaurant where the cuisine has been designed to both satisfy and inspire. Where the food & beverage has been created with the knowledge that it’s not just taste that shapes how we experience our sustenance. Where each dish is like a work of art painstakingly crafted before being presented to you. Envision the lavender vapor that surrounds you as you take the first sip of your cocktail and the ruby sphere that crumbles under the weight of your fork to coat your plate with its contents. This is the experience that Bridges & Bourbon seeks to bring to the City of Pittsburgh.

 

WHO WE ARE

Bridges & Bourbon will offer mouthwatering and visually striking, modernist cuisine. This style of cuisine has historically been obtainable only to a very select few and a dinner for two can easily cost guests a week’s paycheck, but at Bridges & Bourbon we believe that this style of cuisine should be more approachable and available to all. By offering cocktails and small plates instead of lengthy and expensive tasting menus, Bridges & Bourbon is a place that guests will have a memorable experience whether they are just stopping in for a nightcap or they are sharing small plates with a group of friends for a birthday dinner.

Delicious and visually striking cocktails & small plates are not all the restaurant is about, though. With the earth’s rapidly changing climate, Bridges & Bourbon believes that every dining establishment should be aware of their environmental impact. Following this belief, Bridges & Bourbon seeks to be a trendsetter in the City of Pittsburgh by becoming the city’s first certified carbon-neutral restaurant.  

Bridges & Bourbon will open in Spring 2019 with ambitions of inspiring both guests and other businesses to look at food and the impact it makes differently!

 

THE TEAM

Bridges & Bourbon is the joint endeavor of a team that possesses the combined experience of over 70 years overseeing some of the top restaurants in Pittsburgh and the nation.

 

David Racicot – Executive Chef

Star Chef David Racicot (previously of notion, Lautrec, Acqueous, Takö & Poulet Bleu) is the visionary behind Bridges & Bourbon’s culinary program. Chef Racicot is a James Beard semi-finalist for Best Chef in America and the youngest chef to have received both 4 stars from Gayot and 5 Diamonds from AAA in the same year. His knowledge, skill and artistry have made him one of the greatest culinary assets of the City of Pittsburgh and the country as a whole.

 

David Keating – House Sommelier & Mixologist

Bridges & Bourbon’s beverage program is led by David Keating. During his career David has led beverage programs at many of the nation’s top restaurants & bars, including designing programs for Gerber Bars, Starwood Hotels, and B R Guest Restaurants. With Bridges & Bourbon, David sets his sights higher, aiming to design a beverage program that is truly awe inspiring.

 

Scott Shaffer – General Manager

Scott Shaffer has extensive experience in the hospitality industry, including time with Hyatt Hotels, Bravo Restaurant Group, Park Grill in Chicago, and Lidia’s Pittsburgh. His years in the restaurant industry have provided him with vast knowledge of restaurant dynamics, promotions, and special event planning and include oversight from a restaurant’s inception to more than a decade of success.

 

Benjamin McCarney – Marketing Manager

Benjamin McCarney has vast experience managing upscale bar and lounge concepts with Gerber Group and Marriott Hotels.  His years of experience in running popular late-night venues has given him the ability to anticipate the needs & desires of the unique clientele that frequent such venues. Benny’s insight into this customer base provides him with the ability to forecast the market trends for late-night establishments.

 

INSIDE BRIDGES & BOURBON

Bridges & Bourbon will be located at 930 Penn Ave in Pittsburgh’s Cultural District. While only minor changes have been made to the exterior of the building, the interior has undergone a major renovation since Bridges & Bourbon began construction.

The interior of the restaurant was designed in a classic contemporary style. The restaurant will be elegant and sophisticated with shades of navy, white marble, and gold. A highlight of the design is the 11’ high liquor library with one of Pittsburgh’s largest bourbon collections. The restaurant will truly be one of the most beautiful in the city.

 

OUR CAMPAIGN

(AND WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU!)

Construction of Bridges & Bourbon began during the summer of 2018. Unforeseen construction challenges have extended our expected timeline. These unanticipated delays have led to the restaurant accruing overhead expenses that were not part of our originally anticipated budgetary needs. The $30,000 we are seeking in this campaign will help cover a portion of the additional overhead we will experience as we make our final push to the grand opening! While this funding is only a small percentage of our overall startup costs, by helping to fund our campaign you will be integral to successfully bringing Bridges & Bourbon to the City of Pittsburgh this Spring!

Those who contribute will become part of the Bridges & Bourbon family. To show our appreciation, every contributor will be honored on our Wall of Supporters located in the vestibule at the restaurant’s entry. You’ll also be placed on our VIP list and receive a Bridges & Bourbon VIP Card that entitles you to reduced wait times for a table on our waitlist, early invites to future special events, and to be kept up-to-date on the restaurant’s construction status.

While every supporter is appreciated, the restaurant has designed some intriguing rewards for different contribution levels including Bridges & Bourbon branded merchandise, Bridges & Bourbon Blood Orange Bitters, gift cards for food & beverage, and invites to a pre-opening supporter only cocktail party. Contribute at higher levels to receive a Bridges & Bourbon Friends & Family Card that entitles you to 10% off all future visits to the restaurant, or an invitation to a pre-opening supporter only tasting dinner, to have a cocktail on our initial menu named after you, to rent out the restaurant for an evening for you and your 50 closest friends, or even have Star Chef David Racicot come to your house to cook you dinner!

Some of these rewards are limited, and the rewards offered will be updated periodically, so please make sure to check up on the status of our campaign regularly, and remember individuals are always welcome to earn multiple rewards through additional contributions! In addition, depending on when you are reading this, we may still be seeking to bring on another equity partner. If you are interested in additional information about this opportunity, please contact the Bridges & Bourbon Management Team at info@bridgesandbourbon.com.

And remember, even if you find that a financial contribution is not right for you, you can still support us by telling your friends and family about our campaign and by sharing our campaign on your social media accounts!

 

THANK YOU

Thank you in advance for your support. Please like us on Facebook, follow us on Instagram & Twitter, and free to reach out to us at any time with questions, thoughts or suggestions. We look forward to seeing you at Bridges & Bourbon this spring!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Tim Trefts and we are Crombacher Brewery USA. 

We are raising money to start the first craft beer visitor's center located in Reno/Tahoe. We will promote and advocate for local craft breweries of the area by pouring only local beer at 2 locations and as many of the events in our area as we can. We will then give back 100% of profits to the local community. Reno/Tahoe is just the first step in what we want to do. Our goal is to expand this model to other cities across the United States and help all communities we can.

What We Need & What You Get

We are raising $150,000 to build our beer bar, beer trailer, and operational expenses to get started.

Our model is a membership platform that will also allow the same perks on a monthly membership basis. This is your chance to help us get started and get you in early. We have many options to donate:

  • $25 and you get a t-shirt
  • $50 and you get a t-shirt and a hat
  • $500 gets you a lifetime of 1 FREE beer per month!
  • $1500 gets you a lifetime of 1 FREE beer per week!
  • $2500 gets you a lifetime of 1 FREE beer per day!

The Impact

Your contribution will be the first step to all of us making a BIG impact in our local community. We will be selling beer and donating 100% of profits back to the community! 

CBUSA's craft beer visitor's center will pick 3-4 charities per quarter of the year. When you buy a beer you will get a "coin." You will get to pick which charity we are representing that you would like to donate to, by putting your "coin" in the "growler" of your choice. At the end of the quarter, each "growler" will be counted and percent of coins in each "growler" will represent the percent of profit donated to each charity.

Challenges

Our biggest challenges for this to work are:

  • Building our beer kiosk and trailer.
  • Obtaining our 501(c)3 status so all of our wonderful donations can be written off and a bonus for you!
  • Finding the right space in the airport.
  • Making tenant improvements to our spaces.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help! We appreciate you just sharing our page on your social media page so that your friends and family can see what we are up to. Help us spread the word!

story:
Short Summary

I am a cookie artist, devoted mother and Autism Ally. My youngest son experiences high functioning Autism and securing employment has been difficult so I have decided to launch  a business. Cookies on Demand will create connections between neighbors one cookie at at time and offer employment opportunities for folks on the spectrum.

What makes this work experience program different than others? This program is designed to offer the opportunity to develop skills in inventory control, project management, customer service skills, marketing and more. This opportunity is an opportunity to develop marketable skills while bringing smiles to our neighbors one cookie delivery at a time.

Who knew cookies could change the world?

What We Need & What You Get

We need $3500 to begin our adventure and will use this money to launch a website, purchase supplies, rent a kitchen, and create an app. If we are unable to meet our goal we have prioritized our needs and will rent a kitchen, purchase supplies, pay for liability insurance, LLC application and create an app. Our hard work and commitment will get us the rest of the way. 

And you will get cookies! Beginning February 2018 local deliveries can be expected within an hour of ordering and shipments will ship within 24 hours. Fresh cookies delivered to your home! Wait there's more! All local deliveries will include a free cookie to share with your neighbor. 

The Impact

The impact of this project will be felt for generations. Our cookies will connect neighbors that were once strangers and offer employment opportunities that will create self sufficiency instead of dependance. 

Risks & Challenges

With each new adventure there are risks and challenges and my promise to each and every one of you is I will meet each one of these with enthusiasm and tenacity. I have an incredible support system that is willing to assist me as I meet the inherent risks in launching a new business and face the challenges with owning a small business. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Perhaps, funding isn't an option for you right now, that's ok. Support our project by sharing our campaign. Indiegogo provides all of the tools you need to share.

Please email us cookiesondemandor@gmail.com for answers to your questions or just to say hi.

story:
“What I say is, a town isn’t a town without a bookstore. It may call itself a town, but unless it’s got a bookstore, it knows it’s not foolin’ a soul.”  ― Neil Gaiman, American Gods

 

Once upon a time in a land not too far from Chicago lived a town called Batavia. This town had almost everything a town needed. It was only missing one thing...

 

 

The people of Batavia rejoiced and then the most unexpected thing happened…the books started pouring in.

Friends, neighbors, family, and strangers all started donating their books to us. Within one month of deciding to open a store, we had thousands and thousands of books in our inventory.

Within two months we had over 700 followers on our Facebook page. We were picking up momentum and had a home engulfed by towers of books. We knew we had to do something. We hadn’t planned on renting a storefront until the spring of 2018 but we knew that Batavia was ready to support us now. That was when we decided to have a pop-up book market through Batavia Main Street during their Second Friday event.

We sorted and priced everything we could in the time that we had to prepare for our debut. Our friends and family came to help; filling their cars with crates of books and tables. We opened at 6 pm and the rush didn’t stop till the event ended at 9 pm.

We sold half of the books we brought. We spoke to everyone who stopped by and the excitement and thrill in their eyes spoke a million more words. Batavia wants this bookshop.

After countless hours of meetings and discussions, we have created a vision that would make this town proud. A second-hand bookshop where the community can come together to discuss literature, enjoy a cup of coffee, and find their next adventure within the pages of our books.

 

The Proprietors

 

James Stickling - The Heart and Soul of the Book Shop

James has spent the better part of his adult life managing a shipping department for a plastics company. He was the life source of that division, managing everything from customer relations to vendor relations as well as quality control of every order that left that building. His experience in that world has led him to understand how to keep his clients content and handle any situation thrown at him.

His passion? Literature. Writing. Books. Sharing books with friends and family. Discussing literature with fellow readers. Learning anything and everything from the pages of some of the greatest books of all time.

Lizzy Evensen - The Lifeline of the Book Shop

Lizzy helped run her father’s copier company for over 13 years. A small, family owned and operated business who knew that the only way to survive is to treat their clients like family. She wore many hats throughout her days with her father and learned every aspect of running a small business.

Her passion? Marketing. Events. Networking. She is a writer as well, who has her own side business writing reviews and press releases for music PR firms, called Press Play Media. She is in love with Batavia; volunteering her time with the Fireworks Committee and Batavia Mainstreet, when she can. She is also a board member of the Fox Valley Patriotic Organization and is extremely active in her community.

 

What we need help with.

 

We signed a lease for the perfect storefront on Batavia's beautiful River Street on December 1st. All that is left on the 'To Do' list is to build it out so we can fit as many books as possible for you to enjoy! Your donations will help pay for the supplies needed to build shelving and create the space needed to convert this former art gallery into a bookshop/coffee house. Most of the labor will be done by ourselves or friends and family but everything will need to be customized to fit in the space.

  • Shelving
  • Store counter
  • Tables & Chairs
  • Coffee System
  • Register

We will continue to have book sales throughout the winter months to help make money to build out our shop. We plan to open the first week of March 2018. If you choose to help us make our dream a reality, we will be forever grateful! All backers will not only be rewarded with the items listed on here, but they will know that they helped build their town's very own bookstore...The Book Shop.

Our friends and family came to help; filling their cars with crates of books and tables. We opened at 6 pm and the rush didn’t stop till the event ended at 9 pm.We sold half of the books we brought. We spoke to everyone who stopped by and the excitement and thrill in their eyes spoke a million more words. Batavia wants this bookshop.After countless hours of meetings and discussions, we have created a vision that would make this town proud. A second-hand bookshop where the community can come together to discuss literature, enjoy a cup of coffee, and find their next adventure within the pages of our books. The Proprietors James Stickling - The Heart and Soul of the Book ShopJames has spent the better part of his adult life managing a shipping department for a plastics company. He was the life source of that division, managing everything from customer relations to vendor relations as well as quality control of every order that left that building. His experience in that world has led him to understand how to keep his clients content and handle any situation thrown at him.His passion? Literature. Writing. Books. Sharing books with friends and family. Discussing literature with fellow readers. Learning anything and everything from the pages of some of the greatest books of all time.Lizzy Evensen - The Lifeline of the Book ShopLizzy helped run her father’s copier company for over 13 years. A small, family owned and operated business who knew that the only way to survive is to treat their clients like family. She wore many hats throughout her days with her father and learned every aspect of running a small business.Her passion? Marketing. Events. Networking. She is a writer as well, who has her own side business writing reviews and press releases for music PR firms, called Press Play Media. She is in love with Batavia; volunteering her time with the Fireworks Committee and Batavia Mainstreet, when she can. She is also a board member of the Fox Valley Patriotic Organization and is extremely active in her community. What we need help with. We signed a lease for the perfect storefront on Batavia's beautiful River Street on December 1st. All that is left on the 'To Do' list is to build it out so we can fit as many books as possible for you to enjoy! Your donations will help pay for the supplies needed to build shelving and create the space needed to convert this former art gallery into a bookshop/coffee house. Most of the labor will be done by ourselves or friends and family but everything will need to be customized to fit in the space.
Shelving
Store counter
Tables & Chairs
Coffee System
Register
We will continue to have book sales throughout the winter months to help make money to build out our shop. We plan to open the first week of March 2018. If you choose to help us make our dream a reality, we will be forever grateful! All backers will not only be rewarded with the items listed on here, but they will know that they helped build their town's very own bookstore...The Book Shop.

story:
What is a Social Enterprise?

A market-based, income-generating enterprise that aims to solve a social and/or environmental problem through its business activities. Social Enterprises focus on a triple bottom line: people, planet and profit.

What is The Pitch?

The Great Social Enterprise Pitch is an idea incubator and business plan competition for concepts that use a business model and revenues to have a positive social or environmental impact. This year, 11 social enterprise ideas will be selected from a pool of applicants. Right now, these ideas are public for everyone to support through crowdfunding. Then, five finalists will be chosen to participate in the Live Pitch on October 6. Winners will receive a prize package including over $70k in cash and pro-bono services. 

Impact

In its first 3 years, this program has seen outstanding results, including:

  • A 70% Launch Rate for participating social enterprises
  • 64 new jobs created
  • 5,710 total lives impacted 
  • over $240,000 in direct funding/services received prize money, crowdfunding, in-kind/free services
  • $470,000 in additional capital raised after program completion

How You Can Help

The costs associated with facilitating The Great Social Enterprise Pitch are substantial.  Sponsors and foundation funders cover a portion of the expenses, but not everything.  

We need your support to cover the remaining expenses and ensure that this program can continue to offer a platform for social enterprises to launch and grow in Lancaster.  We want to see more business in our community operate with a triple-bottom-line--People, Planet, and Profit.  Thank you for your help in making this happen!

story:
Short Summary

Hello! We are Lee, Brittany, Jill & Julie!
We are the faces of Kids Unplugged. 

 

 

As Maine natives, we grew up playing outdoors all day.  Now, as parents ourselves, we are witnessing kids doing that less and less and being on their devices MORE & MORE! 

We opened a family play gym that focuses on unplugged activities for families who recognize that this is a problem and are seeking ways to get their kids TO WANT to get off their devices and JUST PLAY.   While we started with classes such as gymnastics, ninja warrior,  and open gym free play we quickly realized that we needed an art corner and a theatre and pretend play area. Our loyal customers have watched us grow to over 1300 families over the past 3 years!

And as we’ve watched our customer’s children grow, we’ve also realized that Kids Unplugged needs to evolve along with them!

We have kiddos that are quite frankly, aging out of “Kids Unplugged" brand. They need more space, more equipment and a place that suits their growing interests and need for exposure to alternative physical movement beyond classic sports.

We want to expand Kids Unplugged

 to become: The Unplugged Jungle.

                                                Where Families come to Unplug & Reboot.

 

 

YOUR HELP WILL...
FOR THE FULL DREAM: 

Cover additional rent for expanding our square footage for 4 months: $6,000

Double the daycare: $12,000

Purchase additional gymnastics / tumbling equipment: $7,000

Purchase laser tag system: $17,500

Erect an aerial silks grid: $6,100

Cover salary of an additional 1/2 time staff member for one year: $15,650

Total: $64,250

 

or...A GREAT NEXT STEP:

Cover additional rent for expanding our square footage for 2 months: $3,000

Add another room to daycare: $3,000

Purchase 3 new tumbling equipment: $3,500

Purchase smaller laser tag system: $7,500

Erect an aerial silks grid: $6,100

Cover salary of an additional 1/2 time staff member for 6 months: $7,650

Total: $30,750

 

WHAT YOU GET!

Here are the perks you can get when you support our expansion!

$10 Splatz Sticker 

$12 Class voucher

$25 Splat, hat

$50 Splat, Hat, tumbler

$100 Tumbler, T shirt

$200 $100 Nautilus gift card, child care at KU

$250 Tumbler, T shirt, camp chair, shout out

$1,500 Year Unlimited PLAY!- Give the Gift of Play- 1 person

$2500 Year Unlimited PLAY!- 2 people

 

 

MEET the TEAM who will MAKE THIS HAPPEN!

 

 

Lee Parent - Founder / Owner

I grew up in mid-coast Maine on the rocky coast of the Atlantic. I was raised under the pine trees, in the lilacs and around acres and acres of hills, farms and thick forests. Being a child of the 80's, we were kicked out of the house in the morning and were expected to come back from playing in the afternoon. This unbridled play, this forced boredom, turned us into imagination wizards. We HAD to use our imaginations to keep us entertained. For me, that became my most prize possesson and skill; my imagination and resourcefulness. 

Lee Parent is the founder / owner of Kids Unplugged LLC. As a Maine native, Lee has a passion for unbridled outdoor play and living life authentically. She was a Graphic Designer / Art Director for over 20 years working for a range of corporate companies, entertainment industry to start-up entrepreneurs. She currently lives in Maine with her 2 children and runs Kids Unplugged with the same unbridled passion she had for playing in the woods as a kid.

 

Brittany Tarbox - Director of Operations, CFO

Brittany Tarbox is a Belfast, Maine native. She has 3 children, has coached field hockey for over 17 years and has been teaching as an Ed Tech 3 in the local school system for over 15 years. She has played a vital role in the part of the creation of Kids Unplugged since the early days of gymnastics classes till now! She has a passion for teaching & coaching kids and creating an environment that fosters confidence, stability and flexibility. Brittany is a powerhouse whose love of helping kids and her community make her an incredible asset to our team. She is the leading force to getting things done around here! 

Jill Friel - Daycare Director 

Jill Friel is originally from Massachusetts, and moved here ironically the year that Kids Unplugged opened. As a veteran daycare / pre-school teacher for over 15 years, Jill has also been with Kids Unplugged since the early days of inception! She has a passion for creating programming and environments for the business that creates creative flow, organization and smooth communication between parents / teachers and the kids. She has 4 children, is a beloved teacher here with our fully licensed daycare and keeps our feet firmly on the ground! 

Julie Brown - Gym Director / Gymnastics Instructor

Julie Brown is our gym director / leader and gymnastics coach. Julie grew up in the Belfast gymnastics program and never really left the sport! She and Lee actually competed together years ago and are so excited to combine forces again! She has coached gymnastics for 33 years in everything from ymcas to community centers to large private gyms around the country. She is so excited to be back home in Belfast to join Lee at Kids Unplugged! Julie has been here for almost 2 years now and is growing our program in volumes!  Julie’s contagious bright personality lights up every room and all the faces here at Kids Unplugged. We are so lucky to have her experience and incredible attitude lead our way! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We are so excited that you have taken the time to read about our business!! We are passionate about what we do and thrilled to be able to share it with you all. We understand that you are not always able to contribute, but we surely appreciate you sharing our campaign with your network of amazing people as well! 

"Even the smallest act of caring for another person is like a drop of water, it will make ripples throughout the entire pond." ~Bryan Matteo

story:
#MarketBlack Challenge

Keep it 100. Give Back!!!

The Black Marketing Initiative is

"Changing the face of Business"...in Houston

(Click Link in Picture)

The Black Marketing Initiative was inspired by surveying small businesses just like yours. The response in the Houston Business Community was overwhelming. The problem: to survive during and after COVID, their businesses needed to reach clients ONLINE. However, more than half of respondents could not afford marketing services, and many did not know what content marketing even was.

The solution: The Black Marketing Initiative and the #MarketBlack movement! The Black Marketing Initiative (BMI) was invented by necessity. #MarketBlack exists to improve Black Business success rates through education, mentorship, networking, research and giveaways in Marketing and Business. Some goals of The Black Marketing Initiative include:

  1. Win Real, Immediate, Concrete Improvements in Black Businesses.
  2. Give Black Business Owners a Sense of Their Own Power. 
  3. Alter the Relations of Power by diversifying Business Networks.
  4. Engage the public by providing Black business statistics collected from our Houston Black Business Census.
  
 
The Black Marketing Initiative and its (4) goals are a way to ensure sustainability and success for the future of small business. However, The Black Marketing Initiative recognizes that many small businesses have immediate threats to their survival.  According to UC Santa Barbara and the National Bureau of Economic Research, 40% of Black Businesses are expected to fail now and after COVID, and there was a 41% decline in Black ownership between February and April 2020. In order to begin the fight against Black Business closure, we have already put our own money up to bring real and immediate change to two small businesses through the #MarketBlack Small Business Giveaway.
 
   

 

The #MarketBlack Small Business Giveaway is an avenue to address the immediate needs of our small businesses.  By giving now--during our launch year--you will ensure 25 businesses have a full opportunity to pivot during and after COVID.  And, once we get started, #MarketBlack "can't stop, won't stop".  Our 3rd-year goal is to accommodate and effectively execute the initiative for 100 businesses per year, and make the program and emergency grants an ongoing resource for small businesses. 

In order to make it happen this year, #MarketBlack Challenge is looking for a minimum of 100 people to #PutYourMoneyUp. All support is welcome. Keep it real with small businesses.  Give $100 to support Black business, and be in the 100+ influencers "Changing the Face of Business". For more information visit BlackMarketingInitiative.com.

story:
Paw House Denver soon opening in spring 2021!

Follow us on Instagram and Facebook:

http://www.instagram.com/Pawhousedenver

http://www.facebook.com/Pawhousedenver

 

We are raising $325.000 to make Paw House come to life with your help.

  • We have 14 years of hotel management experience internationally. 
  • Everything will be outdoors except for the bar and Wok in a Box where you can order your food and drinks and take a seat around the dog park and watch your furry friend play while you have a nice dinner,
  • Covid friendly: Socially distanced,  wear masks unless eating. Everything will be sanitized frequently and dog poop is being picked up by dog trainers. 
  • Dog trainers will be making sure that everyone is friendly including the humans. 
  • We promise that we are going to bring quality Asian food at Wok in a Box at Paw House.
  • Quality drinks with smiling service. Even with our masks on ;)
  • Themed nights:

      - Friday Night Latin Night

     - Saturday Funk & Soul Music

     - Sunday Live Music Bands

 

If you donate you will receive the following perks: ​

Complimentary drink: $10

Complimentary welcome drink of your own choice. 1 per person.

Total value: $15

 

Glow In The Dark Dog Ball:

Fund $20

Customized Paw House glow-in-the-dark ball for your furry friend.

Total value: $25

 

Paw house member perk:

Fund $25

  • 1x Paw house t-shirt (choice of size)

Total value: $25

 

Paw House Bronze perks: 

Fund $50

  • 1x Paw house t-shirt (choice of size)
  • Goodie bag for you and your furry friend

Total value: $75

 

Paw House silver perks:

Fund $200

  • 2x Paw house t-shirts (choice of size)
  • Goodie bag for you and your furry friend
  • Complimentary 1-year membership for your dogs (max 2 dogs). (value $250)

Total value: $325

 

Paw House gold perks: 

Fund $500

  • 2x Paw house t-shirts (choice of size)
  • Goodie bag for you and your furry friend
  • Complimentary 2-year membership for your dogs (max 2 dogs). (value $500)

Total value: $600

 

Paw House platinum perks:

Fund $1.000

  • 2x Paw house t-shirts (choice of size)
  • Goodie bag for you and your furry friend
  • Complimentary lifetime membership for your dogs (max 2 dogs). (value $1250)
  • 1 complimentary drink a week when you visit Paw House (1 year from the first time you visit Paw house)

Total value: $1500

 

What We Need The Money for:

  • We need $300.000 to lease land in Denver, build a custom-made container with a full-service bar, and Wok in a Box Asian kitchen. We are going to transform the land into a playground area for dogs. There are going to be slides, tunnels, teeter-totters, benches, and shade. Around the dog park, we are going to have tables and seats where you can have some food, drinks, music, and a great time guaranteed. You also don't have to worry about your dog's safety because there will be dog trainers around cleaning their messes and most importantly making sure all dogs and humans are having fun at Paw House Denver.
  • The goal is to raise $300.000 and if we raise more we can build structure around Paw House to hold the cold breeze away and keep it comfortable for humans and dogs. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word that Paw House is coming to Denver and help us raise $300.000 to make our vision come to life. 
  • We also accept sponsorships from businesses for some advertisements at Paw House.
  • A promise from us that you will have a great time at Paw House Denver every time you visit!

story:
We are reaching out to you, the Cafe Racer community, the arts community and the Greater Seattle community, to join us in keeping the beloved Cafe Racer music venue, art bar, and home of Iconic Seattle, alive!

Our Story...

In 2017 after returning from a year abroad, we learned Café Racer was closing. Though we had no money, we were determined to bring Café Racer back. Together with Café Racer founder Kurt Geissel, and local recording studio owner Dennis Tevlin, we were able to reopen Café Racer on a shoestring. It was truly a miracle.

In March of 2018 we reopened Café Racer with a mere $3,000 in the bank. There was no room for errors or emergencies. Though we lacked finances what we had in abundance, was faith and hope.

As the care-takers of Café Racer we understood and understand it’s importance. We understand the importance of small music venues. We understand the importance of the arts. We understand the importance of open access to a living memorial. We understand the importance of having community gathering spaces. We understand the importance of supporting local breweries and distilleries.  We understand the importance of safe spaces. We understand the importance of great food at affordable prices. We understand that Café Racer provides this and so much more to so many.

In the beginning of reopening Café Racer we saw and felt so much support. Hope, faith and your patronage kept Café Racer going. However in April of 2019 we had the slowest month to date. With minimal funds in reserve we began to fall behind. This slip, though stressful felt manageable. We were able continue to pay staff, vendors and work out payment arrangements for the rest. We believed in the more financially robust winter months we would be able to catch up.

However, in a cruel twist of fate, before winter even arrived, we were faced with the trauma of Mr Ramsey having a traumatic fall.

This is when we came face to face with the reality that though we had saved Seattle’s Café Racer, we had done this grossly underfunded. We had no room for error and definitely no buffer for emergencies.

What we have realized is, that just like Jeff’s healing, Café Racer needs the love and support of the community to get to a place of health, sustainability, and long term success.

Café Racer is on life support and will shut down without your help. We understand that we cannot keep Café Racer alive and thriving on faith and ourselves alone, this is going to take a village.

What we need is Your support, Partners, a MasterMind Group, and $100,000.

We understand that $100,000 may seem like an overwhelming number, but we know that each dollar counts towards keeping Café Racer alive. Please participate at whatever level you feel called. When we first opened we had many people reaching out to support us. Now is the time to join us and to be part of preserving Café Racer.

With the $100,000 we will be paying back rent, back taxes, making necessary repairs and upgrades as well as keeping a reserve for low months and emergencies.

$20~this level of participation is open to all

with this level  you can proudly display your support of Café Racer with an exclusive, I support Café Racer sticker.

$50~this level of participation is open to all

with this level you can proudly display your support of Café Racer with an exclusive, I support Café Racer sticker and mug.

$100~this level of participation is open to all

with this level you can proudly display your support of Café Racer with an exclusive, I support Café Racer sticker, mug and t-shirt.

$1,000~this level of participation is open to 50 supporters

with this level you can proudly display your support of Café Racer with an exclusive, I support Café Racer sticker, mug and t-shirt, as well as attendance to a VIP thank you party at Café Racer. This VIP party includes Café Racer catered food, beer and wine while listening to local bands.

$2,500~this level of participation is open to 20 supporters

with this level you can proudly display your support of Café Racer with an exclusive, I support Café Racer sticker, mug and t-shirt, as well as attendance at a VIP thank you party at Café Racer. This VIP party includes Café Racer catered food, beer and wine while listening to local bands. This level also includes a special sit-down dinner and hosted bar, prepared and served by the Café Racer family in gratitude of your participation.

$5,000~this level of participation is open to 10 supporters

With this level you can proudly display your support of Café Racer with an exclusive, I support Café Racer sticker, mug and t-shirt, as well as attendance at a VIP thank you party at Café Racer. This VIP party includes Café Racer catered food, beer and wine while listening to local bands. This level also includes a special sit-down dinner and hosted bar, prepared and served by the Café Racer family in gratitude of your participation. Also at this level, participants will be able to join 3 years of quarterly MasterMind meetings for Café Racer. These meetings are where the ‘meat & potatoes’ of the business happen. You will be able to add your voice to decision making, learn about the finances and future of Café Racer. You will truly be helping steer Café Racer into its future.

$10,000~this level of participation is open to 5 supporters

With this level you will purchase a share of Cafe Racer. You will be part of a very smaller ownership group and have all the privileges this affords and a share of the profit when we reach those goals! You can proudly display your support of Café Racer with an exclusive, I support Café Racer sticker, mug and t-shirt, as well as attendance at a VIP thank you party at Café Racer. This VIP party includes Café Racer catered food, beer and wine while listening to local bands. This level also includes a special sit-down dinner and hosted bar, prepared and served by the Café Racer family in gratitude of your participation. Also at this level, participants will be able to join quarterly Master Mind meetings for Café Racer. These meetings are where the ‘meat & potatoes’ of the business happen. You will be able to add your voice to decision making, learn about the finances and future of Café Racer. You will truly be helping steer Café Racer into it’s future.

Thank you for taking the time to watch the video and read the details of this campaign. Please donate anything you can today and share this with your friends and family!

Much Love and Gratitude from all of us at Cafe Racer!

Cindy & Jeff
story_txt: We are reaching out to you, the Cafe Racer community, the arts community and the Greater Seattle community, to join us in keeping the beloved Cafe Racer music venue, art bar, and home of Iconic Seattle, alive!Our Story...In 2017 after returning from a year abroad, we learned Café Racer was closing. Though we had no money, we were determined to bring Café Racer back. Together with Café Racer founder Kurt Geissel, and local recording studio owner Dennis Tevlin, we were able to reopen Café Racer on a shoestring. It was truly a miracle.In March of 2018 we reopened Café Racer with a mere $3,000 in the bank. There was no room for errors or emergencies. Though we lacked finances what we had in abundance, was faith and hope.As the care-takers of Café Racer we understood and understand it’s importance. We understand the importance of small music venues. We understand the importance of the arts. We understand the importance of open access to a living memorial. We understand the importance of having community gathering spaces. We understand the importance of supporting local breweries and distilleries.  We understand the importance of safe spaces. We understand the importance of great food at affordable prices. story:
Hello,

My name is Krystal. I am an entrepreneur who is more than excited to open a new location. With your assistance and support The Purpose Bar will have all of the necessary features it needs to make it a unique experience for every client. I am raising money for the renovations needed inside and outside of the business. The Purpose Bar will be used for multi-purpose space needs such as photo-shoots, celebrations, pop-up shops etc. $5,000 will pay for paint, priming, floors, furniture and outside fixings. Your contribution will impact an entire community and will be put towards and amazing purpose; a clean, newly renovated space to enjoy sharing creativity, knowledge and gifts. 

Many thanks,

 

Krystal

story:
Everyone with a motorcycle will need to work on their bike at some point. Many of them want to do the work themselves, but don't have the space for it. Some can't afford or make room for the large lifts or other specialty equipment needed for some tasks.

The motorcycling community is also full of unique, creative individuals who are left wanting for cool, relaxing, and fun places to hang out that have an atmosphere and vibe that actually caters to the moto-enthusiast first and foremost.

That's where Union Motorcycle Company comes in, at the junction of these two roads. Union Moto is out to create an innovative community garage, café, and lounge space. It will be inviting and unique, offering up an unmatched experience where motorcyclists (and the moto-curious) can congregate, work on their bikes, learn from one another, and have a good time. We will have a café and storefront open to all, where hot and cold drinks (and some snacks) will be available, as well as merch from Union and our partners and a curated selection of retail products.

Membership to the community garage and the members' lounge is what it's really all about, though. We'll offer three tiers of membership (Apprentice, Journeyman, and Master), as well as day passes, with greater benefits unlocked with each tier. Members will have access to our garage, secure storage, members-only lounge, discounts, swag, and other perks. The garage will be fully stocked with workstations complete with tools, lifts and stands, tire changing equipment, disposal facilities for fluids and tires, and more. It will give DIY riders, customizers, and builders access to workspaces and equipment they would not otherwise have, in a cost-effective manner that will appeal to their practical side (for instance, someone could be a Union Moto member at the "Journeyman" level for $50/month for three years by the time they've paid out the cost of a single premium hydraulic lift at upwards of $1800). The lounge, in keeping with the DIY attitude of the place, will feature a brew-it-yourself coffee bar with complementary coffee (and other drinks and refreshments) for members.

For members who seek education; to learn new skills and build the confidence to tackle harder jobs, the lounge will be home to an ever-growing library of resource material. When available, there will also be staff to provide consultations, assistance, and labor (at a fee) for customers. There will also be other members across all skill levels to talk to and learn from, so we can build an inspirational environment where the motorcycling community can grow and thrive.

The goal is to cultivate an atmosphere unlike anything else, to reflect the DIY ethos of motorcycling at its finest, and welcome any and all riders of anything with two wheels and a motor.

story:
Who we are,

We are a locally sourced cafe and marketplace. We will be providing business opportunity for artists looking to expand their platform.  We want to provide a comfortable community, where you can come enjoy our cafe and browse our local artists.

We will do our best to work with neighboring farmers to provide local and organic ingredients for all our baked goods, and food.

How we get there.

With you all your amazing and generous help we hope to achieve our goal of $15000.

Your contribution with the purchase of kitchen equipment such as an oven, fridge, freezer, espresso maker.

Our cafe tables and display tables will proudly display the name of the contributor to truly invoke a sense of community.

 

Why we're passionate.

A quick intro, We are a Pastry Chef and a local Artist who really love what we do. 

We have been working in our industries for years, trying to make it for ourselves. We now finally have a wonderful opportunity to do that. 

We want to share what we love doing with a community of our peers. We want to provide a great place for others like us to share their talents and hard work in a new coffeehouse setting.

Your contribution will help us with this process.

 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate anything you can do to help us. 

We have a variety of contribution options that have great perks.

However we know that monetary help isn't everything. We would love if you could take a moment and share our idea with someone. 

Get on your social media, call up that friend you haven't seen in 10 years and tell them about our amazing coffeehouse and marketplace.  

The Nook, will be a place to gather, to eat, to share, to feel a community.  

Go on and share that with everyone.

story:
Who We Are

We are Nicole and Brooke: a wife and wife team who believe strongly in the big power of a little button. We're based out of Grass Valley, CA and have a 2 year old son and a newborn baby girl. 

What We Need

This campaign is to raise funds to help us achieve our goal of expanding our business. We've put everything we had into it when we started and we've already outgrown ourselves, limiting what we can do and orders we can take. We need help to purchase more equipment for larger jobs. Since we're a two person team right now, we're at full capacity. 

With your help, we'll be able to:

  • Purchase more equipment for more product diversity and larger jobs. 
  • Any additional funds we raise will go into marketing and upgrading our website to make it easier for you to build and order custom buttons. 

We want to thank you for your support by giving you some awesome goodies! Make sure to check out the different options. If you'd like to help, but don't want the perks, there's an option for that. You can also let us know if you'd like us to donate your perks to a local non-profit that helps LGBT+ youth in our county instead. They'll be able to use the gift certificates to purchase items to help them raise money for their programs. 

The Impact

Our main goal is to be able to provide fundraising opportunities for organizations by providing them with low-cost buttons to use to promote awareness or sell. We also would like to help other small shop owners by providing them with a low-cost way to make a profit.  To do this we need a little help with funds to be able to renovate our workspace and get equipment that will streamline our process. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share far and wide!

story:
Hello!

I’m Sara Brown, the visionary (and occasional dishwasher) behind Rutabagas. I’m a born-and-bred Lincoln girl, so I have a whole lot of pride for this community of ours.

A few years ago, I transitioned from a traditional omnivore diet to a diet based primarily on plants. I quickly realized there was an urgent need in Lincoln for vegan food options – both convenience-based options (pre-made grab & go dishes) and sit-down restaurant experiences.

I’ve always had a passion for cooking and nourishing others. Last summer, I combined that love with the business skills I’ve developed over the years and launched the first phase of Rutabagas.

That first phase included lots of recipe testing. We solicited tons of feedback from friends, family and customers to make sure each dish was up to snuff. We provided individual and family-style meals for pick-up and delivery, and we “popped up” all over town with our soon-to-be-world-famous nachos. In one short year, we developed an extensive, diverse menu and grew a massive following of passionate supporters. We’re on FIRE!

 

We’re beyond excited to launch the second phase.

Since the start, the secret ingredient to Rutabagas' success has been you. We’re raising $10,000 over the next 30 days to get us even closer to opening the doors to the first-ever Rutabagas restaurant. These funds will pay for high-quality, durable kitchen equipment, furniture and fixtures. (Think of this as your chance to fund the oven used to make your very favorite chocolate chip cookies!)

Your investment will impact our community (and the world) in so many ways:

  • Our goal is to source as much food from local farmers and producers as possible to stimulate the local economy.
  • We’ll create tons of jobs for Lincoln’s diverse, vibrant workforce.
  • One of our top priorities is becoming a zero-waste company as soon as possible. We want to ensure we’re impacting our planet as minimally as possible.
  • We use 0 animal products in our dishes, which lessens our carbon footprint in countless ways, including less water usage, no methane gas production and more.
  • We’ve cultivated an inclusive environment where meat-eaters, plant-eaters and crayon-eaters alike can fill their bellies and their souls together. However you eat, you’ll love how Rutabagas makes you feel physically and spiritually.

 

If you can’t help out financially, we totally understand. There are many other ways you can help! Two of the most important ways:

  • Spread the word about this campaign by sharing it through your social media channels. Snap it, ‘gram it, tweet it – pick your poison and share, share, share!
  • Come visit us once our doors are finally open! We can’t wait to fill your belly and your heart.

From the bottom of our plant-munching hearts, thank you to the all the 'bagas beaus and babes for your support!

story:
About

The goal of The Eisenhower is to redefine the vacation rental experience.  I was sick of the cookie-cutter approach that many owners are employing when they put a rental on the market. This approach is boring and forgets one of the primary reasons WHY people utilize platforms like Airbnb and VRBO...uniqueness of the space. The Eisenhower is different. It combines a love of the local art and culture that is so prominent in Scottsdale with the status of a modern boutique hotel. To make The Eisenhower a reality I brought on a talented and published local designer, an amazing general contractor, multiple local artists, and a proven marketing team to help me complete this project. 

Amazing location ... right in the heart of Old Town Scottsdale

Tony of https://www.anthonywdesign.com/ is the talented designer behind The Eisenhower

Bill @dadsocks is bringing the Scottsdale art culture to the living room of The Eisenhower

Local artist Lily Reeves https://www.lilyreeves.com and "Distortion Rainbow" in the master bedroom

Scottsdale's Eisenhower, a two-bedroom/one bath condo, is located within the apartment structure, "Americana." Built-in 1958, the Americana is one of 14 Garden Style Apartment complexes situated in the shadow of the Valley Ho Hotel.  Garden Apartments gained in popularity in the '50s, and '60s because they were quick to build and well suited to the climate of Southern California and Arizona. Garden Apartments also catered to a growing percentage of young Americans whose appreciation for indoor/outdoor living began to take hold.

The Eisenhower is located within the historically significant, Garden-Style Apartment complex, The Americana

Enjoying the amenities of The Americana complex

The Americana and the 13 other complexes are considered the predecessors to the modern boutique hotels we currently enjoy in America. The unique location of The Eisenhower, within the Garden Apartments Historic District, provided an opportunity to hold true to the classic mid-century design of the space, but bring in relevant features of modern Scottsdale. The Eisenhower will feature the amenities and trappings of a stylish boutique hotel and in a location that allows all our guests to feel immersed in the vibrant culture of Scottsdale. A city that we love very much.

Bringing the Scottsdale art-vibe into a space where guests can enjoy the local culture within an intimate setting.

Future guest admiring the work-in-progress.

Our goal is to have The Eisenhower be the first of many new vacation rentals. More specifically, vacation rentals that bring back the essence of why someone would want to visit...the uniqueness of the space and the connection to the local culture. 

Thought-provoking design focused on inspiring our guests.

We have a goal of opening The Eisenhower by October 2019, which is why we need your help. To complete The Eisenhower's remodel and bring in the furnishings a guest would expect of a historically significant boutique rental space, I need $9,000. We will use these funds to finish remodeling efforts in the bedrooms, the bathroom, and the kitchen. We will furnish the space in a way that is fiscally responsible and focused on function, intentionality & balance. We aren't trying to create something trendy, we are trying to create something special.

Bathroom in-progress

Hallway and Office Nook

Risks and challenges

Several key risks remain with the project:

  1. Final remodeling phases (Bathroom, Kitchen, Bedrooms)
  2. Furniture
  3. Interior decorating
  4. Final design features
  5. Marketing campaign 

The funds that you graciously contribute will go toward the completion of tile in the bathroom and kitchen, lighting fixtures, and final features such as counter-tops, waterfall dinette table, and oak shelving. Continuing to work closely with our general contractor and key tradesman, we do not foresee any delays in finishing the final remodeling phases.

Furniture has already been identified from a mixture of local providers with the intent to add a combination of comfort and style to the space. Additionally, Tony has already laid out a plan for the final interior-design aspect of the project that will focus on the small details that are often overlooked but are critical for success: bold colors, local artwork, and boutique tile-designs. This final phase will be executed upon completion of the remodeling phase.

I have partnered with https://www.voyagepro.co/ to handle key marketing aspects such as video promotions, photography, and social media accounts. With a proven partner like https://www.voyagepro.co/ I will be able to showcase The Eisenhower to the world in an efficient and all-encompassing manner.

With your help, any potential risks to a grand opening of October 1st are completely mitigated. We have the plan, the people, and the motivation. With your final assistance, The Eisenhower will be available to showcase the best of Scottsdale to the world.
story_txt:
About
The goal of The Eisenhower is to redefine the vacation rental experience.  I was sick of the cookie-cutter approach that many owners are employing when they put a rental on the market. This approach is boring and forgets one of the primary reasons WHY people utilize platforms like Airbnb and VRBO...uniqueness of the space. The Eisenhower is different. It combines a love of the local art and culture that is so prominent in Scottsdale with the status of a modern boutique hotel. To make The Eisenhower a reality I brought on a talented and published local designer, an amazing general contractor, multiple local artists, and a proven marketing team to help me complete this project. 

Amazing location ... right in the heart of Old Town Scottsdale

Tony of https://www.anthonywdesign.com/ is the talented designer behind The Eisenhower

Bill @dadsocks is bringing the Scottsdale art culture to the living room of The Eisenhower

Local artist Lily Reeves https://www.lilyreeves.com and "Distortion Rainbow" in the master bedroom
Scottsdale's Eisenhower, a two-bedroom/one bath condo, is located within the apartment structure, "Americana." Built-in 1958, the Americana is one of 14 Garden Style Apartment complexes situated in the shadow of the Valley Ho Hotel.  Garden Apartments gained in popularity in the '50s, and '60s because they were quick to build and well suited to the climate of Southern California and Arizona. Garden Apartments also catered to a growing percentage of young Americans whose appreciation for indoor/outdoor living began to take hold.

The Eisenhower is located within the historically significant, Garden-Style Apartment complex, The Americana

Enjoying the amenities of The Americana complex
The Americana and the 13 other complexes are considered the predecessors to the modern boutique hotels we currently enjoy in America. The unique location of The Eisenhower, within the Garden Apartments Historic District, provided an opportunity to hold true to the classic mid-century design of the space, but bring in relevant features of modern Scottsdale. The Eisenhower will feature the amenities and trappings of a stylish boutique hotel and in a location that allows all our guests to feel immersed in the vibrant culture of Scottsdale. A city that we love very much.

Bringing the Scottsdale art-vibe into a space where guests can enjoy the local culture within an intimate setting.

Future guest admiring the work-in-progress.
Our goal is to have The Eisenhower be the first of many new vacation rentals. More specifically, vacation rentals that bring back the essence of why someone would want to visit...the uniqueness of the space and the connection to the local culture.

story:
Our Story

Jianna and Jason Heuer met when they were both working in book publishing 13 years ago. Their love of literature and learning is part of what brought them together, and keeps them together. Jason (a book cover designer, teacher, and artist) and Jianna (now a clinical social worker) have spent the past three years living in Rockaway. They have been regular contributors to the community and subscribe to the idea that collaborating with other small businesses is what makes all businesses successful. 

They came up with the idea to open a bookstore bar because they love books and wine, and what better combination is there really? Also, they have been following the rise of the independent bookstore industry, and that conceptually the combination of coffee, wine and beer, food, and books seems to work to sustain bookstores. We also know how much food and wine play a part in our social lives and wanted to create a space where people feel comfortable and able to stay and read, or chat with someone. Providing libations is a great way for people to feel welcome and cozy in the space.

Once Jianna and Jason realized the need for this type of space in the Rockaways, they began running small pop-up bookstores to test their theory. In June 2019, a local business owner let them use a storefront to try out their concept on a larger scale. The feedback from the community was enthusiastically loud and clear: WE WANT A BOOKSTORE BAR!

The couple feel that their combined talents and knowledge of running small businesses (they each already have their own) will allow them to run a successful community space that offers a space to come together, talk, create, read, eat, drink and socialize. Along with regular bookstore wares, ATD Bookbar will also provide a selection of live events including appearances by local authors, artists, and poets, and strive to sell and promote all things local.

If we could do it on our own we would. To ensure a successful launch, we are asking for your help. Your contribution, along with our savings, and what we have made through previous pop-ups, will result in a beautiful bookstore bar and cafe. We will strive to provide jobs and small business internships that are needed in this community by pairing with schools and colleges to hire local youth who are interested in starting their own small businesses one day. You will be giving a small beachside community a place that deserves and wants a literary hub that gives back. As we have for all previous pop-ups, we will continue to contribute a percentage of our profits to local non-profits that work to create much-needed services and beautiful spaces in the Rockaways.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $60,000 to get our dream off the ground. Here is where the money will go:

Money to lease a storefront

Furniture and bookcases

Books

Sink/kitchen area renovation

Tavern License (for beer, wine, and cider)

Board games

Kids corner

Insurance

Permits

Toaster oven

Refrigerator

Coffee machine

Perks:

$10 Pencils

$15 Buttons

$30 T-shirt (Women's and Men's, Small, Medium, Large, Extra-Large)

$50 Tote Bag

$50 Membership

$100 Piece of  art

$100 Membeship

If you donate over $500 you will get a bundle of all the preceding perks.

$500 Sponsor a shelf with your name on it.

$1000 Host an event in the store.

$5000 Sponsor a chair/table with your name on it.

The Impact

The Rockaways is a unique community. We have the beach, great food, and a thriving art and music scene. What's lacking is a bookstore that brings people from all different walks of life together, and we want to be that place. If we are successful, you will be contributing to the Rockaway community and its visitors in a way that helps to create jobs, internships, and a place where people can come together to celebrate the community that forms the heart of Rockaway.

We have already received an enthusiastic and supportive response from many members of the community who feel there is a real need for a Bookstore Bar. If given the space and opportunity we want to provide that. We just need your help to make it a reality,

Other Ways You Can Help:

Share this link to your social media or with any book lovers you know!

story:
Wailele Farm - Twin Falls Maui. Managing free public recreational access as an inspiration for all. Honoring the traditional uses of Ho'olawa valley - Twin Falls Maui, Hawaii since 1997.

For the past 17 years, Wailele Farm has taken on the responsibility of managing access to the area known as Twin Falls. Before us, many people remember a very different picture, void of all the cars and the constant stream of people. Back then, the Twin Falls experience included a two track rugged jeep trail winding its way through cow pasture. Small foot trails made their exits through guava shrubs and tall grass to the very same waterfalls and pools that a vast number of people enjoy today. It was unpopulated and secluded. Fast forward to the present and it seems to be a very different place. Change can be unsettling. At all hours of the day the same gravel parking lot that occasionally had a car or two parked in it now is consistently filled. The jeep trail is now a smooth gravel road. There is a fruit stand at the entrance that constantly seems to have business. The cows are gone. Many of the guava shrubs are replaced by tropical clumping bamboos, fruit trees, lilikoi vines, and flowers. People come from all over the world to visit. It is a busy and popular place. Although the passing of time has changed it, the reason people come to Twin Falls remains the same. Free recreational access has remained unbroken for generations and we intend to keep it that way for generations to come.

Aloha, my name is Jonathan Marshall. My partners and I have made it a priority to keep recreational access to Twin Falls, open everyday to the public, for free. 

Twin Falls Maui is a natural,  biologically diverse, 40 acre farm located on the North Shore of Maui. 

After 17 years, for the first time, we are asking for public assistance, in the form of donations, to help in the preservation, maintenance and growth of Twin Falls Maui. Please offer your generous support to help us do the following:

Ensure safe and well managed access to this beautiful valley

Protect natural resource for future generations

Continue to provide portable toilets for public use daily. 

Care for, plant and maintain a large and diverse collection of tropical plants

Develop a plant nursery and propagation area

Infrastructure development to handle the increase in visitors to Twin Falls Maui

Research and development of impact studies on ecosystem and remedial solutions to minimize damage to natural resource. 


We serve 500-1500 visitors per day and we are growing. We have to upgrade our infrastructure in order to accommodate the growing local/tourist population over the coming years. We have been doing this work for 17 years and our goal is to continue in perpetuity. 

If you or anyone you know has enjoyed visiting Twin Falls Maui, please request their monetary and/or social networking support at this time. Millions served.

Ua mau ke ea o ka aina i ka pono - The Life of the Land is Perpetuated in Righteousness (translation)

Twin Falls Maui - Doing the work, manifesting the dream.

Thank You All, sincerely and deeply, Aloha Nui Loa

Jonathan Marshall

Pass it Forward

story:
Who We Are

Avancement vers le Développement Valable pour Haïti (ADVH) is a Haitian-run grassroots organization on the Dominican border in Anse-a-Pitre, Haiti. We formed ADVH in May 2013 in response to the mounting food and unemployment crises faced by Haitian citizens living on the Haitian-Dominican border. 

However, we are not a relief organization. If you support this project you are supporting the creation of small sustainable social enterprises that increase food security and ecological health for Haiti.

Breadfruit

ADVH has created this campaign to help raise the funds necessary to begin a breadfruit flour production site. We already own the land, and we have partially built a modest structure. With this campaign we are seeking to send four community leaders to Jeremie, Haiti to the University of the Nouvelle Grande Anse (UNOGA), where they will be trained by experienced agronomists on how to produce breadfruit flour. In addition, we are seeking the funds to transport equipment to rural Haiti, to complete the structure so we can have a locked storage space to keep our equipment safe, and to build a sturdy open air shelter that will serve as a production site. In the future we will be able to hold trainings, classes and workshops in the same space, including Atelier Ansapit.

We have just received an amazing and generous donation from Trees that Feed Foundation of all the equipment necessary to start processing breadfruit and make it into cereal and/or flour which has an extended shelf life and can be used to make a variety of foods. Other projects in Haiti are experiencing great success feeding school children with breadfruit cereal. It is delicious and nutritious and locally sourced. 

Here is Colbert with the shredder and grinder:

This is the structure we have partially built on our land in Anse-a-Pitre:

Why This is Important

More than fifty percent of households in the village of Anse-a-Pitre are headed by single mothers. With this in mind, ADVH seeks to create entrepreneurial opportunities that are safe, flexible, home and community-based and utilize the abundance of natural resources available. Breadfruit is one such example; there regularly is a surplus of this nutritious crop. 
Because an estimated 80% of food is imported it is an urgent priority to create local food enterprises that provide single mothers with home-based economic opportunities. At present a large percentage of single mothers cross the border to the Dominican Republic to work as domestic servants and risk serious danger to themselves each time they make the crossing. 

What We Need

Our budget grand total to complete construction, transport equipment from Brooklyn to Haiti, pay for travel to and training at the University of the Nouvelle Grande Anse, and cover miscellaneous equipment costs is as follows:

  1. Complete construction: the total cost for materials and labor is $10,370.50
  2. Transport equipment from Brooklyn, NY to Anse-a-Pitre, Haiti: the cost of this involves round trip travel for us (Colbert and Susannah) as we will need to accompany the equipment and spend at least a month in Anse-a-Pitre overseeing the construction project: $1,420
  3. Training at the University of the Nouvelle Grand Anse in Jeremie, Haiti: this covers the cost for four ADVH leaders to travel roundtrip to Jeremie and receive two days of training with experienced UNOGA agronomists: $1,290
  4. Purchase of miscellaneous equipment including food safety materials, bowls, buckets, knives, tables, storage equipment, spaghetti machine, tables and counters: $1,083 
GRAND TOTAL: $14,163.50

Please note, we are asking for $2,163.50 less than our actual budget requirements because this is our first experience with crowdfunding and we would like to avoid incurring extra fees associated with not reaching our funding goal. But we do actually need $14,163.50 to complete this project and create a sustainable future for our organization.


What if We Don't Meet Our Goal

Any amount of money will still help us towards achieving our goal. The first $1,400 raised will be used to transport the equipment to Anse-a-Pitre, Haiti. This in and of itself will be a big accomplishment, as it is very remote! The next $1,300 will be used to send ADVH leaders to a two-day training program in Jeremie, Haiti on the other side of the island. There they will learn how to use the equipment and to see the process of making breadfruit porridge and flour at Haiti's largest breadfruit processing site. Any money beyond this $2,700 will be used to finish our production site in Anse-a-Pitre. We are a resourceful group and we don't lose hope easily. We will work outdoors with a temporary (tarp) shelter until we have a completed site. Please note,however, that having a secure, stable building is very important because Haiti is very vulnerable and prone to natural disasters like hurricanes.

What If We Exceed Our Goal?!

We will use additional funds to run plumbing to our building and install a water filtration system. Currently we have to carry water in buckets from the water source, about 50 meters away. Piped water onsite would greatly increase our functioning capacity. In addition we would like to purchase a drying rack that is being developed specifically for drying breadfruit shreds. The mechanical engineering department at the University of St. Thomas has been working hard on this and it will greatly reduce drying time. Above and beyond those goals we would like to start working on Atelier Ansapit. 

Other Questions People Ask Us

  • You say you want to serve single mothers, so why are there not more single mothers represented in leadership roles in your organization? The struggle of single mothers in Anse-a-Pitre who are head-of-households is complex. They do not have the time or resources to take an unpaid leadership position with a grassroots organization because they are occupied washing clothes by hand, cooking, carrying water, caring for children, all while trying earn enough money to feed their family. We realized that in order to get women involved in community organizing, we must offer them employment solutions, and food and water sources. We are seeking to do all these things with the proceeds from this campaign. 
  • It isn't easy to change the way that people eat. How do you expect to introduce a new food and get people to include it in their diet? We have an advantage in that breadfruit is not unknown. Many people enjoy eating it fried, roasted and boiled. Our partner organization, Trees That Feed Foundation has had great success introducing the breadfruit porridge to school children. It can be prepared either as a sweet or savory meal depending on how you season it. The school children have taken to the cereal quickly. Once this happens, they are sent home with a small bag and encouraged to ask their mothers to prepare it for them at home. It is in this way that other members of the family have been introduced to the cereal and it has been very successful. 
  • Is my donation tax deductible? At this time, no. We are, however, seeking nonprofit status in the United States.
Other Ways You Can Help

  • Post on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram
  • You can donate perks to this campaign as incentives for others to make financial donations
  • Send emails to people and tell them about ADVH and this campaign
  • Talk about it with people you know who might be interested
  • Think of two people you know who could make a big impact on this project and call or write to them requesting their participation
  • Become a part of our community. We want you to be involved in our programs in whatever capacity you are able
