Any money beyond this $2,700 will be used to finish our production site in Anse-a-Pitre. We are a resourceful group and we don't lose hope easily. We will work outdoors with a temporary (tarp) shelter until we have a completed site. Please note,however, that having a secure, stable building is very important because Haiti is very vulnerable and prone to natural disasters like hurricanes.What If We Exceed Our Goal?!We will use additional funds to run plumbing to our building and install a water filtration system. Currently we have to carry water in buckets from the water source, about 50 meters away. Piped water onsite would greatly increase our functioning capacity. In addition we would like to purchase a drying rack that is being developed specifically for drying breadfruit shreds. The mechanical engineering department at the University of St. Thomas has been working hard on this and it will greatly reduce drying time. Above and beyond those goals we would like to start working on Atelier Ansapit. Other Questions People Ask Us

You say you want to serve single mothers, so why are there not more single mothers represented in leadership roles in your organization? The struggle of single mothers in Anse-a-Pitre who are head-of-households is complex. They do not have the time or resources to take an unpaid leadership position with a grassroots organization because they are occupied washing clothes by hand, cooking, carrying water, caring for children, all while trying earn enough money to feed their family. We realized that in order to get women involved in community organizing, we must offer them employment solutions, and food and water sources. We are seeking to do all these things with the proceeds from this campaign. 

It isn't easy to change the way that people eat. How do you expect to introduce a new food and get people to include it in their diet? We have an advantage in that breadfruit is not unknown. Many people enjoy eating it fried, roasted and boiled. Our partner organization, Trees That Feed Foundation has had great success introducing the breadfruit porridge to school children. It can be prepared either as a sweet or savory meal depending on how you season it. The school children have taken to the cereal quickly. Once this happens, they are sent home with a small bag and encouraged to ask their mothers to prepare it for them at home. It is in this way that other members of the family have been introduced to the cereal and it has been very successful. 

Is my donation tax deductible? At this time, no. We are, however, seeking nonprofit status in the United States.

Other Ways You Can Help



Post on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram
You can donate perks to this campaign as incentives for others to make financial donations
Send emails to people and tell them about ADVH and this campaign
Talk about it with people you know who might be interested
Think of two people you know who could make a big impact on this project and call or write to them requesting their participation
Become a part of our community. We want you to be involved in our programs in whatever capacity you are able

story:
My Story

Hey guys! I am starting this campaign because we have a serious problem. Have you ever seen a gaming tablet or laptop that doesn't cost at least $1000? I am trying to bring this concept into reality. Many Windows 8 tablets and laptops will cost around $400-900 just for something that can only be used to browse the internet and do light tasks. None of them can properly run games because they all lack a graphics processing chip. I want to bring a tablet to the market that has the mobility of a tablet and the power of a desktop, all without having to destroy your bank account. 

Compromise and key features

  • Ability to change graphics processors. When you are on the go, you can swap to Intel's HD graphics to save precious battery life. When you are plugged in, you can change it to gaming graphics and perform a lot faster.
  • Most storage on a tablet. You can expect to store all your games, movies, songs, and work without the headache of cloud storage or SD card expansion.
  • Mobile. The tablet will be around 10 inches diagonal. If you guys desire a larger or smaller screen, it will be perfectly possible to do so. The funding goes mostly towards the development of the awesome motherboard and internals. Changing out a screen will be no problem.
  • Low cost and powerful. Expect to see this tablet sold for around $600. This will be the best mix of everything any device has to offer. It will compete directly with well-known companies, and you will be able to brag to your friends how you can run Battlefield 4 on your tablet.
  • Aggressive or Sleek.  I want the community's feedback on the design on the tablet. It could look very aggressive to stand out, or sleek to blend in with other devices. One thing is for certain though. The tablet will have noticeable vents to keep the device as cool as possible, as well as changeable LEDs to fit your personality. This is a tablet made by the community, so the community can have whatever they want.


What We Need & What You Get

To make this project a reality, I need to pay a company willing to develop the tablet's motherboard. It is quite costly, but I managed to hit it off well with a guy. He is willing to create it for $60,000. I also need a little bit more for material costs required for mass production. The last ingredient I need is some time and community feedback. I'll create a page for this product on Facebook where I can interact with you guys and see what you want in a tablet. Whether it be an aggressive design, or more storage, this tablet is in the hands of this community. The more funding, the better. It will certainly speed up development with more money, which means you guys get your super tablet a lot faster! 

The Impact

You guys are making a big difference to our current market by backing this project. There is no tablet in the world that can replace a desktop without spending at least $1000, until now. Please help make this a reality so we can have more choices. We do not have to spend $800 and be unhappy with our laptops or tablets because they do the exact same thing a $300 tablet or laptop can do. Nobody has to be told they can't run the latest Call of Duty game because their mobile device is too slow. Nobody should have to go out and buy a desktop either.

Risks & Challenges

I currently have a company willing to create the motherboard for my tablet, but it is going to cost close to $60,000. I am trying to raise $80,000 to fuel development of the motherboard and spend the rest on production costs. I really want to make this a reality for everyone looking for a good, reliable tablet that can run anything you throw at it. Our prototype is currently in production and should be revealed within a month or two. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot afford this tablet, it would also help to share this page with your friends. You should especially share it with friends or family who may need a powerful tablet for school or work in the future. This will make a great graduation gift for newcoming college students or the workaholic!

story:
A veteran's dream

Once upon a time a veteran decided to start his own business, he wanted to build the meanest, biggest, and fastest vehicles out there, offer custom metal work for home decor and furniture plus replica weaponry from your favorite eras in history and fandom. The dream was put on hold though, small business funding required collateral at every turn and although lenders and the SBA were on board, it was a road block that wouldn't budge. Budgeting, two year projections, employees (two more vets), federal tax ID (EIN) have all been set up, this is the final step. 

12 years he served our country, now he needs a helping hand from the community, from you, to get his dream off the ground.

Getting off the ground

The money that we raise here will become the backbone of Wild West Steel, the backing necessary to get a small business loan and give the company wings to fly. Welding, custom fabrication and blacksmithing all require expensive equipment and materials. Once the company has the funds to set this up, the possibilities are endless! Wild West Steel will customize everything from cars and trucks, tractors, furniture, replica weaponry, and more! 

  • Toolboxes built into your vehicle
  • Dumpbeds on any truck
  • Tandem axles
  • Custom fabricated front and rear bumpers
  • Exhaust and suspension
  • Swords and knives from your favorite era
  • Fandom replicas of all kinds
Customize anything - the skies the limit at Wild West Steel!

Help us spread the word!

If you are interested in this project but aren't able to contribute monetarily, help give us a little push! Visit the Facebook page and give us a like and share the word!

story:
For far too long, your alcoholic beverage laws have served special interests, protecting private, rather than public welfare, and it’s time we take a stand. We have taken legal action against our (otherwise) great state and are asking craft beer lovers, both near and far, for support in this cause. We are sorry that legal action is the only way to bring about fairness in an antiquated system that has failed to adapt to the legal, social, and commercial changes of the past 82 years.


The injustice in question is the unfair and unconstitutional laws that prohibit microbreweries from selling their products on-site for off-premise consumption. You see, Texas allows every other alcoholic beverage manufacturer to do just that – wineries, distilleries, and even brewpubs are allowed to sell their products directly to the end consumer for off-premise consumption. Microbreweries cannot. 

The Equal Protection Clause of the Constitution requires that government treat similarly situated persons the same, or precludes it from treating one set of persons differently than others who are similarly situated. In other words, beverage laws in Texas must treat all businesses similarly situated alike. How are wineries, distilleries, or even brewpubs - making exactly the same products as a microbrewery - any different? What state interest is being served? How is this prohibition against microbreweries protecting the welfare, health, peace, temperance, or safety of the people of Texas? Long story short, it isn’t.


This prohibition against microbreweries is meant merely to protect private interests and has no rational justification to the citizens of Texas. It is long past time for Texas to start making significant changes to its Beverage Code that promote the fair and equal treatment of its Members.


Oh, we've tried. Over the past 7 legislative sessions (14 years), bills have been introduced that would allow some level of beer to be sold for off-premise consumption. Unfortunately, all dreams of such laws passing are usually quickly crushed by the powerful distributor lobbyists. This whole lawsuit thing was tried once before as well; however, it never moved past a summary judgement. With your help, we plan to take this case the distance and see it succeed. 

“The essential definition of corruption in a representative democracy is the usurpation of public authority to the advancement of private interests. The system currently used to regulate alcoholic beverages in Texas now promotes private, rather than public, welfare.“

Now, before you go getting all crazy that we just called the entire Commission corrupt,  this quote was taken directly from a position paper submitted in 2006 as part of the Texas Sunset Commission, which is tasked with making regular assessments of the continuing need for each state agency to exist. Unfortunately, this Position Paper was not formally considered or adopted by the Sunset Commission. Had that been the case, maybe all of this could have been avoided.

(Read the full position paper, here.)




But here we are. Not only are we, as microbreweries, being unjustly prohibited from selling six-packs to go, but consumers – the citizens of Texas and beyond – are being unjustly prohibited from directly supporting their favorite Texas brewery. 

Join us in Operation Six-Pack to Go and Help us #SueTABC to abolish the unconstitutional laws that unfairly discriminate against our growing number of microbreweries!

As you’re already aware, we have taken the first step by filing the lawsuit, but there is still a very long ways to go. We have retained two law firms and several expert witnesses, including the former general Counsel for TABC. Lawsuits are expensive, but with your support, we can see this across the finish line! Not only will your contribution help the cause, but it will also send a strong message to our lawmakers that we want continued progression in our craft beer laws!  


We believe that being part of history and helping further craft beer in Texas is a reward in itself, but we're also tossing in some cool perks for your help! 




We hope we do! And, if so, we plan to use those funds to further the efforts of craft brewers within the state. The top seven contributing breweries will form a panel that will oversee and vote on the deployment of any overages raised. These funds may go to the Texas Craft Brewer’s Guild, Open the Taps, or perhaps used to employ lobbyists to further the interests and growth of our state’s growing beer community. There’s still plenty to be done, but we think this is a great start. Hopefully, Operation Six-pack to Go will be a major success, and we can bring about some real change.

Based in the legendary blues-born and rock-raised urban district known as Deep Ellum, this trend-setting Dallas brewery creates smooth and assertive craft beers worthy of the area’s eclectic heritage. Since the company’s founding in 2011, Deep Ellum Brewing Co. has crafted an award-winning roster of year-round, seasonal and limited-release brews, including Deep Ellum IPA, Dallas Blonde, Double Brown Stout, Four Swords Belgian Style Quad, Oak Cliff Coffee Ale, and this summer’s newest addition — Easy Peasy IPA. To learn more about Deep Ellum Brewing Co. beers, retail availability and brewery tours, follow Deep Ellum Brewing Co. at Facebook.com/deepellumbrewing, Twitter.com/deepellumbrewco and www.deepellumbrewing.com.

story:
The Show

Help us build REAL Rock Bars, NOT just another place that uses Rock and Roll to get you in the door. Now is your chance to be a part of history and ensure there is a place that answers to you, instead of shareholders. 

It is not a just a contribution, it is a way to get some great swag that sets you apart as someone that supported this from the beginning.

What can you get for your contribution besides a great place to hang-out?

  • 20% off dinner at the restaurant
  • Commemorative t-shirt
  • Bike cleaning kit
  • Whip's Vape Juice
  • Whip's Glassware set (US shipping only)
  • Select-A-Head wall art
  • Hand made Guitar Pick Necklace
  • Dinner or happy hour with Whip
  • Sponsorships (Gold, Silver, & Bronze)
  • The ability name a stage.


WE WANT TO

 

Your contribution will build venues dedicated to the unapologetic style of ”Rock & Roll" and give you the best mix of classic and new rock from artists you know and regional acts waiting to be discovered. These will be fun, "edgy" bars/restaurants and concert venues, where everyone will be free to be themselves.



Your support will build a place that feed your inner rebel.


     Backstage:

    Whip's Bar & Grill is the creation of friends Michael "Whip" Wilton (the legendary guitar player of Queensryche, Soulbender, and Wratchet Head) and Paul Whitlock (music enthusiast, lifelong biker, and avid beer lover).

    In our world the term Whip is synonymous with two things: Michael "Whip" Wilton and custom rides, this place brings the two together along with other goodness like great food, an edgy staff, and fantastic beer. 

    Our goal is to ensure the party lives on by combining the things we have been most committed to our whole lives: Bikes, Rock, and Brews.

    For the Bikers:

      The first location will be in Richmond VA, half way between Washington DC and Virginia Beach VA. It will include ample outdoor space for events and be a destination for two wheeled travelers. This will be the spot for bikers traveling to the East Coast's largest bike rallies to take a break, weekend riders to start and end their ride, or for biker groups to hold a charity event in an environment made just for you. There will be regular bike nights and cruise-ins where you can show off your Whip. 

     We know bikers like to show off their ride, so Whip's will feature front row uniquely lit parking areas where your ride will get the attention it deserves. All future Whip's Bar & Grill's will be located in areas with high bike traffic and near medium to large cities.


    For the Rockers: 

      Our Mission is to create the best Rock and Roll bars in America. The first will be a 150 seat restaurant with Rock Star attitude and plenty of space to rock out to your favorite music: Rock, Classic Rock, Hard Rock, and Heavy Metal. The size of the venues will depend on the market where they are located, but the theme will be the same.

    Live music is the best form of entertainment and great music from national and local artists will be the staple of every venue we open. We will bring you the best shows from top tier bands and great new bands you will want to discover. 


    Something For Everyone:


      You don't have to ride to enjoy the atmosphere at Whip's. No club or secret handshake here. Everyone that wants to have a good time, listen to great music, eat fantastic food, and enjoy Rock & Roll inspired drinks will enjoy the VIP treatment.

      The food we serve at all Whip's Bar and Grill's will be the highest quality, locally sourced blend of the dishes we have found while out on the road. The house beer will be Michael's own "Whip Ale" as well as a large selection of both "Major Labels" and "Indies". The food, the music, and the servers will all be Rockin'.

    Sound Check

    Before any great show can start, everything has to be setup, checked, and adjusted. To do things in full on Rock & Roll style we are not thinking small. We want, and the fans deserve, a shrine to the music and the lifestyle they love.

    We have been working on this project for over 4 years and have accomplished many things:

    • We have a solid business plan.
    • We are dedicated to "green" practices to reduce environmental impact and long term costs.
    • We have identified local suppliers who specialize in "Farm to Table" foods and craft spirits that can handle the volume necessary.
    • Many of the details that will make this a "must visit" for bikers and rockers have been worked out.

    Amenities of the first Whip's will include:

    • A 6000 square foot restaurant/bar with great locally sourced food, 24 on tap beers, and servers who possess that "Metal" edge to take care of you
    • Multiple stages, both indoor and outdoor, to accommodate everyone
    • Rock and Roll and Biker themed decor
    • Outdoor space for activities, a motorcycle rest stop, rallies, and parking

    Now it is up to you! If this sounds like a place you would hang-out, please support this campaign today.


     

    Security

    We know this journey will not be without challenges but we are committed to overcoming them to make this happen:

    • The foremost concern for us is ensuring the safety and security of the fans and the entertainers.
    • Industry hurdles to overcome.
    • Financial risks will always be present.
    To solve these issues, we have experts in the areas of concern and will be using their experience in our risk mitigation plan.


    Street Teaming

    We understand that the last few years have been hard on many people. That does not make those that cannot contribute any less important to us or this campaign, because money is not the only way you can help. You are just as important to the scene as everyone else!

    • Shout it out loud! Post and tweet using #WhipsBar as often as you can.
    • It is easy and you can do it right from here using the indiegogo share tools.

    Cancellation Policy


    It is highly unlikely that there are not as many Rock fanatics as we think; but, if this campaign fails to meet the goal, we will still move forward. We will take advantage of other options available to us and we will still open the venue.

    • We will fulfill the perks as specified.
    • Happy Hour and Dinner with Michael will happen upon opening the restaurant.
    • Contributors will have a very limited amount of one time only products.

first will be a 150 seat restaurant
with Rock Star attitude and plenty of space to rock out to your favorite
music: Rock, Classic Rock, Hard Rock, and Heavy Metal. The
size of the venues will depend on the market where they are
located, but the theme will be the same. 

Live music is the best form of entertainment and great music from national
and local artists will be the staple of every venue we open. We will bring you
the best shows from top tier bands and great new bands you will want to discover.  Something For Everyone:
  You don't have to ride to enjoy the atmosphere at Whip's. No club or
secret handshake here. Everyone that wants to have a good time, listen to great
music, eat fantastic food, and enjoy Rock & Roll inspired drinks will enjoy
the VIP treatment. 

  The food we serve at all Whip's Bar and Grill's will be the highest
quality, locally sourced blend of the dishes we have found while out on the road. The house beer will be Michael's own
"Whip Ale" as well as a large selection of both "Major
Labels" and "Indies". The food, the music, and the servers will
all be Rockin'.
Sound Check
Before any great show can start, everything has to be setup, checked, and
adjusted. To do things in full on Rock & Roll style we are not thinking
small. We want, and the fans deserve, a shrine to the music and the lifestyle they love. 

We have been working on this project
for over 4 years and have accomplished many things:

We have a solid business plan.
We are dedicated to "green" practices to
     reduce environmental impact and long term costs.
We have identified local suppliers who specialize in
     "Farm to Table" foods and craft spirits that can handle the
     volume necessary.
Many of the details that will make this a "must
     visit" for bikers and rockers have been worked out.

Amenities of the first Whip's will
include:

A 6000 square foot restaurant/bar with great locally
     sourced food, 24 on tap beers, and servers who possess that
     "Metal" edge to take care of you
Multiple stages, both indoor and outdoor, to
     accommodate everyone
Rock and Roll and Biker themed decor
Outdoor space for activities, a motorcycle rest stop,
     rallies, and parking

Now it is up to you! If this sounds
like a place you would hang-out, please support this campaign today. 


 

Security
We know this journey will not be
without challenges but we are committed to overcoming them to make this happen:


The foremost concern for us is ensuring the safety and
     security of the fans and the entertainers.
Industry hurdles to overcome.
Financial risks will always be present.

To solve these issues, we have experts in the
areas of concern and will be using their experience in our risk mitigation
plan. 


Street Teaming
We understand that the last few years have been hard on many people.
That does not make those that cannot contribute any less important to us or this campaign, because money
is not the only way you can help. You are just as important to the
scene as everyone else! 

 Shout it out loud! Post and
     tweet using #WhipsBar as often as you can.

It is easy
     and you can do it right from here using the indiegogo share tools.

Cancellation Policy

It is highly unlikely that there are
not as many Rock fanatics as we think; but, if this campaign fails to meet the
goal, we will still move forward. We will take advantage of other options
available to us and we will still open the venue. 

We will fulfill the perks as specified.
Happy Hour and Dinner with Michael will happen upon
     opening the restaurant.
Contributors will have a very limited amount of one
     time only products.

story:
Présentation du projet

L’association AVIJED et son équipe de juristes et avocats, souhaite offrir gratuitement aux citoyens un service d'information juridique de qualité, accessible, et qui soit réellement adaptée à vos besoins. 

Fondée en 2013, l'association a en effet un seul objectif : favoriser l’accès au droit des individus. A une ère où les textes de lois et les sources d’informations se multiplient, nous souhaitons faciliter votre compréhension des droits et obligations qui concernent votre vie quotidienne.  


À quoi servira la collecte ? 

Partager le droit avec un plus grand nombre, c'est notre passion. L'objectif de ce projet est de ramener le droit vers vous. 

En finançant ce projet, vous contribuerez à :

- la mise en place d'une plateforme d'informations juridiques;

-  des versions tablettes et mobiles;

- la rédaction d'articles juridiques clairs et accessibles sur vos divers droits et obligations;

- le développement de modules multi-supports d'informations (vidéos, animations etc.);

- la mise en place des mécanismes de retour sur vos expériences en tant qu'utilisateurs sur les contenus (commentaires, réunions d'informations etc.);

- l'animation d'ateliers d'informations juridiques interactifs. 

Notre service permettrait de renforcer la confiance des individus en leur propre capacité à prévenir ou résoudre les problèmes de la vie courante.

Nous vous remercions de votre soutien !

L’équipe AVIJED

Hi, my name is Tim Olden I'm a graphic designer and illustrator.
     I've a passion for e-cards that has seen me spend a lot of time, love and commitment, producing over a 1000 unique and individual products.
At TimOlden.com we firmly believe we have something fresh, new and exciting,
for our brand launch in the USA.
     Our business models low subscription fee of $16 for 1 year and $24 for 2 years membership, allows the user as many e-cards as they like.
     All our animations and products are ready to go, and we're now seeking funding to build a shop window Website to grow our business.
     $9000 may seem costly but it is below the norm for a project of this size. We want to compete with the very best and therefore we need a website to do just that. The chosen company to build our website is based in New York.

E-CARDS
Our animated e-cards include voice over actors speaking the lines, sound effects and above all good content.  You can personalize them with your own message. The many categories range from Birthday, Friendship, Get Well, Celebrations, Thank You, Teddy Collection, all USA Holidays, Valentine’s Day and Mother’s Day etc.

Click to play                                                                 Click to play

                                                                       

VIDEO, PHOTO & MESSAGE CARDS

Upload your own family or holiday videos or photos to our cards and send off for that special occasion. If you don’t want to do that just include a voice message wishing “Someone well” or  “Be my Valentine!” for example.
See birthday videos at ;- https://www.youtube.com/user/MrTimOlden/videos


PRINT & GIFT IDEAS

When you want to buy something original for yourself or someone else. Look no further than our Print & Gift section, produced in association with Zazzle.com. 

Full of our original illustrated products for printing onto Mugs, T-Shirts, real cards to mail out, phone cases and hundreds of other product types. You’ll never be short of an idea or two!

See our store:- http://www.zazzle.com/timolden



ANIMATED JOKES
So if you want to send an animated joke to a work colleague or friend we have just the thing for you. For all the family they are all good taste and not offensive. Put a smile on someone’s face today!

Click to play                                                                Click to play


WEEKLY BANTER
Join our newsletter without any news!  We call it “Weekly Banter” it’s Free of charge, just subscribe to it. It's full of Jokes, Trivia, selected Videos and Magic online. No rubbish or spam just good fun and sent out weekly.


PERKS TABLE



If you can't make a donation send us a Like on Facebook to spread the word!
Click to open Facebook page

story:
Apeiron is an association working with the Nepalese women for their socio-economic empowerment since 2004. Among other projects, this campaign is targeted specially to the project for the people living in the squatter settlement in the Agarakhola river. Apeiron has been working with them since 2009 with various activities and has just finished building houses for the 30 families but the water supply system needs more and additional intervention in order to sustain the people and their families in a new environment.

Imagine yourself immersing inside the wild river, searching for the stones, carrying them on your back and breaking them into small concretes with your hand so that you can sell it in order to make less than 1 dollar in a day.  

Imagine you are not sending your children to school because you could always use an extra hand (even if it’s small) to make a little bit more and mostly because you cannot afford it. 

Imagine with all the hardships in life , you have a hut made out of plastic and bamboo to call your home where winter is too cold, summer is too hot, monsoon wipes your clothes and beds more often than not and you will always fear of the wild animals coming inside uninvited. 

Imagine that whatever little you earn, you are still cheated by the contractors because you cannot read and write.

Difficult, isn’t it? 

But for 116 families living in the riverbanks of Agrakhola, Dhading-Nepal, it is their reality. 

We have been working with the stonebreaker community since 2008. We have assisted them in making extra income through pig farming, sent their children to school and provide medical services throughout.

However, the only thing that is keeping them from improving their livelihood is the lack of a proper house. Because everyone deserves a home where they can rest, sleep in peacefully, eat in a proper kitchen and have private moments, we at Apeiron are building 30 houses for the 30 neediest households amongst the 116 families living in the riverbanks. The houses are almost complete and we are in the transition to shift the families to their own homes. One house consists of one bedroom and a kitchen. They will have communal toilets and kitchen garden as well. There is electricity in their homes already connected. However, the natural resource of water we had planned to bring in the houses has dried up significantly and we are scared that it will not be enough for all the 30 households.

What do we want to do?

We would like to build a permanent water system that will provide clean water for the 120 people living in the 30 houses. The water will be brought in from another natural resource which is 2 kilometers away from the houses. It will then will channeled into an underground reserve tank with the capacity to hold 25000 liters of water with GI  pipes. From the tank, the water will be distributed to the communal taps and toilets.

The water will fulfill their daily household needs as well help in irrigating their kitchen garden as well as other agricultural activities.  The water brought in from this project will help the people drink clean water from a natural resource as well as use the same for their small garden where they will grow their vegetables.

What do we need?

We will need 11,050 USD to make it possible of which 86% will go to build the water supply system and 14% will go as the campaigning tools as Indiegogo.com and PayPal processing fees. 

If the fund exceeds the planned goal then we will be motivated to do more for the rest of the people whereas if the fund doesn't reach the goal, we will use whatever we will receive for the water supply system and will try to raise funds in other ways possible.
A helping hand will never return empty, so for every contribution we receive for the project we would like to thank you with some amazing perks. All the products you will see here are made by underprivileged women in Nepal with whom Apeiron has been working for years as well as the materials used are traditional resources of Nepal. For example;

Besides, you can also help us by sharing this campaign with your friends and also visiting us on Facebook. 
We appreciate you taking your time to read this. The children and families at the Agarakhola will be very grateful. Thank you. Dhanyabaad. Namaste!

story:
Background & History

In August of 2007, cofounders Tim & Tammy Bogeman picked up their son, Tom, whom has a cognitive disability, from a special needs summer camp in Crivitz, Wisconsin.  The camp has a limited number of spaces each summer and is very hard to get into.  Knowing and understanding the lack of resources in Northern Wisconsin, especially in the tri-county area of Vilas, Oneida and Forest Counties, they started brainstorming.  They first thought of starting a camp in their own community that would provide recreation for people with special needs.  Then in 2009, when their son, Tom graduated from high school, they had to look within their own community for job opportunities for him.  Where was Tom to work; he needs one on one supervision? Where was he to be productive and feel like he was a contributing, viable citizen? The need of starting a farming community that would provide supportive life skills experience for people with physical and developmental disabilities became very clear.  When looking into the future for their son, Tom, it seemed so uncertain.  Their desire for him is to be successful and to enjoy his life, enriched with opportunities that would support him now and in the future.


Short Summary

Chick A Dee Acres Farm, Inc. (CDAF) is a farming community that provides supportive life skills for individuals with physical and developmental disabilities.  This program will offer a daily multi-faceted program to include supported life skills and recreation.  Within the life skills program, CDAF will strive to instill healthy life style habits through exercise, education and proper nutrition.  In order to best meet the needs to our clients, we will conduct a strength and weakness evaluation and observations.  Results will determine goals, accommodations, modifications and levels of support to increase success, independence and maximize work potential. Life skills experience will include organic gardening, woodworking, car detailing, maple syrup collecting/processing and wreath making among others.  Midday, the individuals will have the opportunity to enjoy recreational activities including but not limited to: archery, fishing, swimming, bowling, movies, snowshoeing and craft projects.  Products produced on the farm will be packaged, marketed and sold through a Community Supported Agriculture (CSA) program and at community-based flea/farmers markets.  Working together within their community, CDAF clients will have natural opportunities to increase their communication and functional math and reading skills.  The ultimate goal for the CDAF community is that clients have an array of opportunities that will contribute to a sense of fulfillment, joy, success and purpose.

CDAF will be certifying the farm house as a 3 to 4 bed group home.  I addition, within the first 5 years we plan on building more 3 to 4 bed certified group homes on the property.

Mission Statement

The mission of Chick a Dee Acres Farm is to provide a supportive community for individuals with physical and developmental disabilities, where enjoyable recreation and lifelong learning are fostered, both on the farm and in the local community.


What We Need & What You Get

We are shooting for $175,000.00

We are in need of $125,000.00 towards down payment and closing costs to purchase farm property.

We are in need of an additional $50,000.00 for a tractor with implements and garden seed.

If we are unable to reach our goal of $175,000.00, we will put any funds we receive into savings towards our farm project and continue with the fund raising until such time that we have the funds needed to purchase the farm. 

The Impact

 After personally working with children and adults with physical and developmental disabilities for the past five years, we have found that there is a lack of supportive opportunities within our tri-county area of Northern Wisconsin.

Within the physically and developmental disabled population, we have found that there is such a broad range of abilities. Each person within the disabled community has unique needs and it is hard to find supported equal opportunities in our local community for them.  The farm program will provide a wide variety of life skills essentially.

Risks & Challenges

As with all endeavors there are certain risks.  For CDAF, these could potentially include:

Natural disaster, inclement weather could cause a less profitable season, possible injury or harm to a client or supportive staff.

A Communicable virus that would cause a decreased number of clients and support staff.

Here at CDAF, we feel that our most important challenge will be to evaluate each  client, determining what segment of the program would best support their abilities.  The ultimate goal for the CDAF community is that clients have an array of opportunities that will contribute to a sense of fulfillment, joy, success and purpose. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We ask that you spread the word about our project to all of your friends and family.  This is such an important program not only for us but mostly to the special needs community in our area.

Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools

Thank You to all for the great support!!!

story:
Greetings from Phnom Penh!



Hi! We are Mary and Christoph and we are building Phnom Climb, Phnom Penh's first rock climbing gym. 

Most people don't immediately think that a low income country like Cambodia would need something like a climbing gym. Yet, after living here for over 5 years, we are convinced that our beloved city, Phnom Penh, would be better off if there were more fun, constructive, and healthy activities available. We have watched the rapid growth of the economy and consumer possibilities, but no parallel growth of sports or extracurricular activities for young people. Phnom Penh is hungry for a rock climbing gym!

Team work, the sense of achievement, mutual trust, community, overcoming boundaries and fun are the values that are embodied in the experience of rock climbing and this is what we want to bring to the people of Phnom Penh!

THIS is why you should continue reading:

  • You love rock climbing and you believe that everybody should have access to a climbing gym
  • You believe the values of rock climbing for personal and team growth
  • You live in Cambodia and you really want to climb!
  • You are an enabler and you want to see rock climbing happening in Phnom Penh!
We need you to make this campaign a success. Become an enabler for Phnom Climb! Check out our Perks! Chip in or send this campaign to anyone who is interested in climbing, Cambodia or an opportunity to support a great cause!


Phnom Climb started as a dream two years ago and now, we can open our business soon! We've raised sufficient funds to build a structurally sound facility (which was not available for rent), some of the bouldering walls and a top rope climbing wall so that we can open our business soon! However, we need an additional $12,000 to complete the gym with an overhanging lead climbing wall. 

We want to use our space well and build additional climbing walls. We've hired a local American-Cambodian engineering company to design and build the climbing walls but we need additional funds. That's why we need your help! 

Please support us by giving to our project and sending this campaign to your friends and family!


What is Phnom Climb?

Phnom Climb is a professional indoor climbing gym in the heart of Phnom Penh, Cambodia’s capital and largest city. It is open to everyone who wants to climb. 

The gym is a social business with two main objectives: (1) create and maintain an inclusive community of Cambodian and expat climbers in Phnom Penh; and (2) support organizations that work with disadvantaged children and young adults by offering them access to Phnom Climb to develop their self-esteem, trust, physical endurance and mental fortitude through climbing. 


Our Story

We are climbers who have been living in Phnom Penh for five years (and counting). We are enthusiasts and fervently passionate about this sport because it builds community, a safe and supportive environment, trust, self-esteem, confidence and perseverance. 

Since we have arrived, we have been organizing outdoor climbing trips. These trips are well attended by Cambodians and expats alike. Often, they are limited to once a month since the closest climbing site is 1.5 hours away. Transportation, travel costs and distance also exclude many interested climbers from participating and climbing more frequently. We are building this climbing gym so climbing can be more accessible to anyone who is interested. 

Working in and managing a local business for many years has helped us to understand how the market works and what is required to successfully establish a sustainable business in Cambodia. 


Why Phnom Penh? Why Cambodia?

Cambodia is a hidden gem in Southeast Asia. The Kingdom is best known for the ancient temples of Angkor Wat and the tragedy of the Khmer Rouge. But tourists and expats who come through Cambodia fall in love with the people and their kindness, friendliness and happiness. Having lived and worked with Khmer people for 5 years, we have gotten to know this country and the people well and also witnessed a lot of rapid change. 

We have seen the institution of traffic lights, the first sky bridge, the availability of ambulance service, 3+ public bus lines, a new modern mall housing two state of the art cinemas and ice skating rink, and a rising middle class with disposable income. But Phnom Penh still lags behind in recreational activities and community spaces for the average people. It is the only major city and capital in the region without a climbing gym. Neighboring Thailand alone has, at least, 11 climbing gyms and Vietnam has 4.

Less noticeable is the persistent lack of community and unity. In our experience, Cambodians are very hospitable, kind and generous to foreigners but this treatment is not often extended to their compatriots. Distrust amongst each other remains three decades after the collapse of the Khmer Rouge.

We believe Phnom Climb can foster community and confidence and trust and meet this growing need for and interest in recreational activities. 


Why care about a country on the other side of the world?

We know most people don't know where Cambodia is. Many of us didn't either until we found ourselves flying here for a job or for a holiday. 
Yet, when you taste a bit of Cambodia, you're bound to fall in love with its simplicity and sincerity of the people and the culture. 
  • You have visited Cambodia before and want to give back to the people who live here.
  • We are looking for support from climbers that see the power of using climbing to build up broken or underprivileged communities.
  • We need support from YOU or anyone who can see the value of our mission and want to help push us forward.


How will your investment be used? 

So far, Phnom Climb is privately financed through our own investment and loans from family and friends. The entire investment has gone into the setup of Phnom Climb, covering the cost for the construction of the warehouse, facilities, the bouldering space, the top rope walls, climbing gears, ropes, mats, etc. 

We want to construct a lead climbing wall to complete the rock climbing experience at Phnom Climb!

To be as transparent as possible to you, none of your investment will finance our salaries and your investment will be used for building the last section of the climbing wall. Here is a breakdown of what we need. 

  • $3,500 - Cost of professional expertise and construction labor
  • $3,000 - Cost of steel, bolts, and screws
  • $2,650 - Cost of climbing holds
  • $1,500 - Cost of plywood
  • $   400 - Cost of paint
  • $   450 - Cost of T-nuts

How will Phnom Climb make Phnom Penh a better place?

Phnom Climb’s social mission is an essential component of the climbing gym. We believe in the principles behind the UN’s Right to Play and how play can be used to encourage behavior change and positive attitudes. 

Phnom Climb sees rock climbing as a development solution in the following way:

  • Foster self-esteem and confidence in disadvantaged youth, children and girls
  • Help children and youth overcome trauma
  • Enable young people to build positive life skills and behaviors 
  • Strengthen trust between young people of different economic classes and backgrounds
  • Promote physical and psychosocial health
  • Practice problem solving skills, goals setting, decision making, stress management and effective communication

We are developing partnerships with organizations working with disadvantaged young people and street children. By offering discounted or free climbing sessions and workshops, we can use climbing to teach young people to build trust, perseverance, teamwork, and communication within a supportive, affirmative setting. 

In additional, Phnom Climb aims to partner with the Siem Reap-based climbing NGO – Angkor Climbers Net[1]  by providing employment for their young Cambodian climbers when they graduate from high school. Most of these student climbers come from very poor families and have limited education. After they graduate, many find themselves working as cleaners in the hotel industry or security guards for restaurants and night clubs. We see this as a great opportunity to partner together to build up Cambodia's youth.

[1] http://www.angkorclimbers.net/AW/aw_concept.html


What now?

The success of this campaign is in your hands! 

If you are inspired by our vision and our commitment to it, please consider giving to our campaign. You also can support us by simply spread the word among your friends!

If you find yourselves coming to Cambodia, come drop by to the newest addition to the Phnom Penh scene - Phnom Climb! We are excited to welcome you to our new home!
story_txt:
Greetings from Phnom Penh!



Hi! We are Mary and Christoph and we are building Phnom Climb, Phnom Penh's first rock climbing gym. 
Most people don't immediately think that a low income country like Cambodia would need something like a climbing gym. Yet, after living here for over 5 years, we are convinced that our beloved city, Phnom Penh, would be better off if there were more fun, constructive, and healthy activities available. We have watched the rapid growth of the economy and consumer possibilities, but no parallel growth of sports or extracurricular activities for young people. Phnom Penh is hungry for a rock climbing gym!
Team work, the sense of achievement, mutual trust, community, overcoming boundaries and fun are the values that are embodied in the experience of rock climbing and this is what we want to bring to the people of Phnom Penh!
THIS is why you should continue reading:



You love rock climbing and you believe that everybody should have access to a climbing gym


You believe the values of rock climbing for personal and team growth


You live in Cambodia and you really want to climb!


You are an enabler and you want to see rock climbing happening in Phnom Penh!


We need you to make this campaign a success. Become an enabler for Phnom Climb! Check out our Perks! Chip in or send this campaign to anyone who is interested in climbing, Cambodia or an opportunity to support a great cause!





Phnom Climb started as a dream two years ago and now, we can open our business soon! We've raised sufficient funds to build a structurally sound facility (which was not available for rent), some of the bouldering walls and a top rope climbing wall so that we can open our business soon! However, we need an additional $12,000 to complete the gym with an overhanging lead climbing wall. 
We want to use our space well and build additional climbing walls. We've hired a local American-Cambodian engineering company to design and build the climbing walls but we need additional funds. That's why we need your help! 

Please support us by giving to our project and sending this campaign to your friends and family!





What is Phnom Climb?

Phnom Climb is a professional indoor climbing gym in the heart of Phnom Penh, Cambodia’s capital and largest city. It is open to everyone who wants to climb. 
The gym is a social business with two main objectives: (1) create and maintain an inclusive community of Cambodian and expat climbers in Phnom Penh; and (2) support organizations that work with disadvantaged children and young adults by offering them access to Phnom Climb to develop their self-esteem, trust, physical endurance and mental fortitude through climbing. 





Our Story
We are climbers who have been living in Phnom Penh for five years (and counting). We are enthusiasts and fervently passionate about this sport because it builds community, a safe and supportive environment, trust, self-esteem, confidence and perseverance. 
Since we have arrived, we have been organizing outdoor climbing trips. These trips are well attended by Cambodians and expats alike. Often, they are limited to once a month since the closest climbing site is 1.5 hours away. Transportation, travel costs and distance also exclude many interested climbers from participating and climbing more frequently. We are building this climbing gym so climbing can be more accessible to anyone who is interested. 
Working in and managing a local business for many years has helped us to understand how the market works and what is required to successfully establish a sustainable business in Cambodia. 




Why Phnom Penh? Why Cambodia?
Cambodia is a hidden gem in Southeast Asia. The Kingdom is best known for the ancient temples of Angkor Wat and the tragedy of the Khmer Rouge. But tourists and expats who come through Cambodia fall in love with the people and their kindness, friendliness and happiness. Having lived and worked with Khmer people for 5 years, we have gotten to know this country and the people well and also witnessed a lot of rapid change. 
We have seen the institution of traffic lights, the first sky bridge, the availability of ambulance service, 3+ public bus lines, a new modern mall housing two state of the art cinemas and ice skating rink, and a rising middle class with disposable income. But Phnom Penh still lags behind in recreational activities and community spaces for the average people. It is the only major city and capital in the region without a climbing gym. Neighboring Thailand alone has, at least, 11 climbing gyms and Vietnam has 4.
Less noticeable is the persistent lack of community and unity. In our experience, Cambodians are very hospitable, kind and generous to foreigners but this treatment is not often extended to their compatriots. Distrust amongst each other remains three decades after the collapse of the Khmer Rouge.
We believe Phnom Climb can foster community and confidence and trust and meet this growing need for and interest in recreational activities. 




Why care about a country on the other side of the world?
We know most people don't know where Cambodia is. Many of us didn't either until we found ourselves flying here for a job or for a holiday. 
Yet, when you taste a bit of Cambodia, you're bound to fall in love with its simplicity and sincerity of the people and the culture. 



You have visited Cambodia before and want to give back to the people who live here.

We are looking for support from climbers that see the power of using climbing to build up broken or underprivileged communities.
We need support from YOU or anyone who can see the value of our mission and want to help push us forward.



How will your investment be used? 

So far, Phnom Climb is privately financed through our own investment and loans from family and friends. The entire investment has gone into the setup of Phnom Climb, covering the cost for the construction of the warehouse, facilities, the bouldering space, the top rope walls, climbing gears, ropes, mats, etc. 

We want to construct a lead climbing wall to complete the rock climbing experience at Phnom Climb!
To be as transparent as possible to you, none of your investment will finance our salaries and your investment will be used for building the last section of the climbing wall. Here is a breakdown of what we need. 


$3,500 - Cost of professional expertise and construction labor
$3,000 - Cost of steel, bolts, and screws
$2,650 - Cost of climbing holds

$1,500 - Cost of plywood

$   400 - Cost of paint

$   450 - Cost of T-nuts



How will Phnom Climb make Phnom Penh a better place?

Phnom Climb’s social mission is an essential component of
the climbing gym. We believe in the principles behind the UN’s Right to
Play and how play can be used to encourage behavior change and positive
attitudes. 
Phnom Climb sees rock climbing as a development solution in
the following way:



Foster self-esteem and confidence in
disadvantaged youth, children and girls


Help children and youth overcome trauma

Enable young people to build positive life skills and behaviors 
Strengthen trust between young people of different economic classes and backgrounds

Promote physical and psychosocial health

Practice problem solving skills, goals setting, decision making, stress management and effective communication

We are developing partnerships with organizations working
with disadvantaged young people and street children. By offering discounted or free climbing sessions and workshops, we can use climbing to teach young people to build trust, perseverance, teamwork, and communication
within a supportive, affirmative setting. 
In additional, Phnom Climb aims to partner with the Siem Reap-based climbing
NGO – Angkor Climbers Net[1]  by providing employment for their young Cambodian climbers when
they graduate from high school. Most of these student climbers come from very poor
families and have limited education. After they graduate, many find themselves working as cleaners in the hotel industry or security guards for restaurants and night clubs. We see this as a great opportunity to partner together to build up Cambodia's youth.




[1] http://www.angkorclimbers.net/AW/aw_concept.html

If you are inspired by our vision and our commitment to it, please consider giving to our campaign. You also can support us by simply spread the word among your friends!
If you find yourselves coming to Cambodia, come drop by to the newest addition to the Phnom Penh scene - Phnom Climb! We are excited to welcome you to our new home!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Jim Hudgell. I am a veteran of the US Navy, former member of FEMA's Ohio Task Force One Urban Search and Rescue, and currently work as a Firefighter and Paramedic in Metro Atlanta, Georgia. After a lifetime spent helping and serving others I find myself needing help. In 2013, we were blessed with a little boy that we named Ronin. Ronin was born 2lbs 15 3/4oz and spent 2 and a half months in the Neonatal Intensive Care Unit. He has Down's Syndrome and some other health issues. My wife had to quit working to stay home and care for him due to daycare costing $400 dollars a week. We started his disability, but due to making a huge amount of money (just joking) as a firefighter we get $290 a month for 10 months of the year. Needless to say times are tight. We need your assistance in starting a family owned and operated firearms company. I have been working on guns all my life and recently restored a few antique arms and completed other work for police officers, hunters, etc. All have said I need to be in business. So we want to start a business in Ronin's name. A place where he will be able to work when he gets older and have people around him that love and care about him. A business that, as we grow, wants employees with special needs kids, where we will have a daycare on site, that our employees can bring their child to work with them and go and see them anytime they are working. A company that looks forward to hiring Veterans and disabled veterans, these are my brothers and sisters and we will not turn our backs on them. This is about making sure Ronin and other families have a bright furture, making sure that, after I am gone, there is something to provide for him.  We want to provide American jobs, a high quality product, and help the community. I was finally able to save enough money to purchase our LLC and domain names hopefully I can get the websites up soon. I assure you, your donation will not go to waste.

What We Need & What You Get

We are trying to raise a minimum of $100,000 dollars, we actually need more than that. The money will be used for the following:

  • CNC Milling machines
  • CNC Lathe
  • Heat presses
  • Vacuum pumps
  • Welders 
  • Laser
  • Tools
  • Supplies
  • Advertising
  • Building Lease

We have put together some extremely uniquely designed perks.

$50 dollars, you get your choice of shirts blue or yellow. The front says Ronin Weaponry, the back says "Team Ronin" with a block shaped T21. The T21 is Ronin's  type of Down's Syndrome. The shirts look like this:

$100 dollar donation, your choice of shirt and choice of blue or white mesh Flexfit embroidered baseball hat. The hats look like this:

$200 dollars gets you: The shirt, hat and your choice of a tactical pistol or tactical rifle class taught by the Draco and Ardent Groups. These are Ex US and Isreali Military instructors and they offer an extremely good class for shooters of all levels. Really top notch training ($500 value). You will be responsible for transportation to and from training, firearm, ammo, and signing required waivers. *NOTICE - if at anytime you display dangerous behavior or any other reason the instructors feel you need to be dismissed from the class, you will be asked to leave and there will not be a refund*
$500 dollar donation: You get shirt, hat, choice of classes, and your first weapon with us will be built at cost. You will still be responsible for purchasing all components, but will not be charged labor, tooling, etc. 
The Single largest donation: if we reach our goal the single largest donation, that beats all others by $100 dollars or more, to the campaign you will receive the shirt, hat, choice of class, the assembly discount and a one of a kind 1911 that will have serial number: TeamRonin1. *Notice you must be able to own firearms to win this perk*
If we don't reach our goal we still get to keep the donations but Indiegogo takes a much higher percentage to be able to keep it, so please tell everyone you know and LETS MAKE THIS SUCCESSFUL!!!!! 

The Impact

By contributing you will help us provide a better life for our son, and that is something every parent wants for their child, especially those of us with blessed little ones. We will use your donations to help provide jobs in the community and as a place that special needs individuals will be able to come and work. We truly want to move the employee/ employer  relationship in new directions. We will continually post our progress online so all contributors will be able to follow. We will keep you all up to date on what is happening within the business, equipment purchases, builds, community events, etc. We know your money is hard earned and we appreciate that fact and your generosity will be given the utmost respect as will you. The shop will always be open to contributors to come and tour, ask questions, just stop by to say hello, or arrange to meet Ronin (he loves meeting new people).

We pledge that 10% of all profits will be given back. 5% will go to Camp Southern Ground (a camp for disabled and under privileged children) and Down's Syndrome Research. 5% will go to Special Operations Wounded Warriors and Wounded Warrior Projects. These causes are near and dear to us. We will always be available for charities. 

Risks & Challenges 

We understand that the gun market is a crowded one. Our model is simple: Build the absolute best firearm for the money and make it unique to each customer. You will pick everything you want on the firearm: buttstock, frame, receiver type, barrel length and type, flash hider, foregrip, pistol grip, sights, optics, custom Cerakote colors (every firearm), caliber, accessories, etc. Your firearm will come with trigger work already done, polished feed ramps, and our top secret process, basically anything you will send out to a gunsmith after you have spent money on an expensive gun to make it better. Our firearms will come that way out of the box. If I would not be proud to own it, IT WILL NOT LEAVE THE SHOP. We will be making fully custom 1911's, AR's, Holsters,  gunsmithing services and eventually suppressors.

We will offer limited lifetime warranty, normal wear and tear is not covered, basically as long as you didn't do something to cause a malfunction, catastrophic failure, or lets face just plain dumb, and it is a proven manufacturing defect, your weapon will be replaced. The warranty will be able to be transferred to immediate family members in the event of death in family or just passed down (this will require documentation). If someone buys the firearm, they will be able to transfer the warranty for a fee after providing documentation from FFL dealer. Our goal is to make firearms that will become heirlooms for generations, from the everyday American to the most discerning firearms aficionado. 

As a firefighter we are used to coming up with creative solutions to unknown problems and we will bring our experience, knowledge, team of military and law enforcement experts to solve your firearm needs, wants and wishes.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate we understand. We understand sometimes the money isn't there, if anyone understands that, it is this family. All we ask is if you didn't or could not, or even if you did, please tell everyone you possibly know about us and help us change the community, provide superior products to the military, law enforcement, security services, and the everyday American. If you are a manufacturer of any of the equipment needed from above, an equipment donation will also be much appreciated. Thank you for your time, donations, and understanding. Take care and GOOOO.... TEAM RONIN!

story:
The San Diego Workers Center is a unique place where day laborers and household workers come together to seek work, get protection for their rights, and learn ways to become more professional in the work they do.  They are hard working men and women who are reliable, dedicated to supporting their families and active contributors to our community.  The center brings people together to get jobs done: painting, gardening, roofing, moving, carpentry, plumbing, construction,  as well as house cleaning and caring for children and the elderly.  
Our mission is to achieve full human rights for day laborers and household workers, including a living wage, equal pay and treatment before the law, and freedom from harassment based on religion, color or creed.   
We are in the beginning stages and we need your help in order to do our outreach work among our workers and employers.  Your dollars will help our organizers hook up workers with jobs, conduct health and safety workshops, defend workers' rights, and teach English and other skills that make for a healthy and productive work force.  Your contribution is tax free!
