story:
About Coreach:

CoReach: Is the Community Outreach arm of The Sanctuary in Marlton New Jersey.  We are a faith based community with a passion for serving our surrounding communities and have been doing so for over ten years.   Each project, whether a Community Build, Food  Drive or a Family "Grief Relief " Day Camp, has been met with great success.  Thank you for taking the time to check out our latest opportunity to compassionately share the tangible love of God.

Steve already "paid it forward"

To many people, a degenerative muscular syndrome would seem an insurmountable barrier, resulting in deep depression and a lifetime of disability checks. Leg braces and lack of fine motor skills would appear to preclude any type of career with a physical component. Self-pity can be overwhelming, but not in Steve’s case.

Steve shared his brilliant mind and indefatigable spirit with all who were willing, especially his students. For years, he taught special education to at-risk kids; but his lessons included so much more than math and reading.  Steve helped his kids understand friendship and compassion with group activities like fishing and hiking. He understood that many life lessons are impossible to communicate in a classroom setting. 

You could say that Steve has already "paid it forward".  Now he needs your FRIENDSHIP, COMPASSION and SUPPORT.

Steve’s muscles have become weak to the point where he is no longer able to be independent. The leg braces are not enough to support him, confining him to the house, preventing him from enjoying many of his favorite hobbies and making  routine doctor visits an exhausting ordeal. 

 

Steve needs an access ramp built onto his home-NOW

Please GIVE toward this Community Build project. 

This ramp will give Steve the dignity  and independence he deserves. 

 

Take a look at our project budget and how we anticipate your donations will be put to immediate use to get Steve the help he needs.

All the necessary labor will be donated by compassionate people willing to give of their time and talent. We'll have all kinds of  folks from contractors to cup bearers co-laboring to get the job done.

Please note-All donations are tax deductible

What this will mean to Steve

Getting to a doctor's appointment for most people is sometimes taken for granted.  For Steve, getting outside, let alone to a doctor's appointment is at the opposite extreme of "taken for granted."
When we install this ramp with your help, Steve will  be able to get outside for fresh air, easily keep physician appointments and enjoy the sound of the birds in his yard this summer. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you've been so kind as to read all the way to the end of this page and you just can't afford to give at this time.  No worries!  Here is how you can help Steve:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about Steve.  Link this request to your FB site, call a friend and share the need or bring it up at your next social gathering.
  • You can also use the convenient Indiegogo share tools as well! 
  • Get educated:  Steve suffers from a syndrome that is related to Muscular Dystrophy.  Click the link to learn more.

Learn More

 

Whatever you can do...THANKS so much!  We will be certain to keep you in the loop with updates and certainly for those who live in the  Greater Philadelphia Area and have a desire to serve, please email us to get the details about the Day-Of Build.
story_txt:
About Coreach:CoReach: Is the Community Outreach arm of The Sanctuary in Marlton New Jersey.  We are a faith based community with a passion for serving our surrounding communities and have been doing so for over ten years.   Each project, whether a Community Build, Food  Drive or a Family "Grief Relief " Day Camp, has been met with great success.  Thank you for taking the time to check out our latest opportunity to compassionately share the tangible love of God.Steve already "paid it forward"To many people, a degenerative muscular syndrome would seem an insurmountable barrier, resulting in deep depression and a lifetime of disability checks. Leg braces and lack of fine motor skills would appear to preclude any type of career with a physical component. Self-pity can be overwhelming, but not in Steve’s case.Steve shared his brilliant mind and indefatigable spirit with all who were willing, especially his students. For years, he taught special education to at-risk kids; but his lessons included so much more than math and reading.  Steve helped his kids understand friendship and compassion with group activities like fishing and hiking. He understood that many life lessons are impossible to communicate in a classroom setting.  You could say that Steve has already "paid it forward".  Now he needs your FRIENDSHIP, COMPASSION and SUPPORT.Steve’s muscles have become weak to the point where he is no longer able to be independent. The leg braces are not enough to support him, confining him to the house, preventing him from enjoying many of his favorite hobbies and making  routine doctor visits an exhausting ordeal.   Steve needs an access ramp built onto his home-NOWPlease GIVE toward this Community Build project.  This ramp will give Steve the dignity  and independence he deserves.  Take a look at our project budget and how we anticipate your donations will be put to immediate use to get Steve the help he needs.All the necessary labor will be donated by compassionate people willing to give of their time and talent. We'll have all kinds of  folks from contractors to cup bearers co-laboring to get the job done.Please note-All donations are tax deductibleWhat this will mean to SteveGetting to a doctor's appointment for most people is sometimes taken for granted.  For Steve, getting outside, let alone to a doctor's appointment is at the opposite extreme of "taken for granted."When we install this ramp with your help, Steve will  be able to get outside for fresh air, easily keep physician appointments and enjoy the sound of the birds in his yard this summer.  Other Ways You Can HelpMaybe you've been so kind as to read all the way to the end of this page and you just can't afford to give at this time.  No worries!  Here is how you can help Steve: Get the word out and make some noise about Steve.  Link this request to your FB site, call a friend and share the need or bring it up at your next social gathering. You can also use the convenient Indiegogo share tools as well! 
Get educated:  Steve suffers from a syndrome that is related to Muscular Dystrophy.  Click the link to learn more.

Learn More
 Whatever you can do...THANKS so much!  We will be certain to keep you in the loop with updates and certainly for those who live in the  Greater Philadelphia Area and have a desire to serve, please email us to get the details about the Day-Of Build.

story:
Isaiah: one of our many Failed Society models! 

Make a difference! 

My brother, Nick Schiro, created Failed Society brainstorming ideas with a friend. He was working for Fed Ex full time, but his passion has always been fashion. So 3 months ago he quit his job and we teamed up to form Failed Society LLC. He attended Rockwood Summit High School in Saint Louis, Mo, and earned a degree in film and video production in NYC. I attended Vianney High School , and graduated from Quincy University w/ a business management/marketing degree. Nick is the creative side, while I handle the business side of things, so we make a good team, and family is key. 

Failed Society has gotten off to a great start, and the feedback on the designs, quality of products, and marketing have been encouraging! Nick's creative genius has brought this very new brand to the forefront of the skate and street wear culture that is growing ever so rapidly!  We were already able to open our first flagship store March 7th 2015, and sales have been promising & we are carrying 5-6 other exclusive street and skate wear brands as well. DGK, Diamond Supply, and Crooks and Castles are just a few to name. This campaign is vital to getting the Failed Society line and store to the next level. We need radio spots, a possible TV commercial, sponsorship's of local events and concerts, & promotional expenses for items to give away to spread the word about this new lifestyle brand. 

What We Need & What You Get: $ = Perks 

We are currently trying to raise at least $7,000 for an advertising campaign. This money will go towards radio spots at two local radio stations, the sponsoring of Pointfest ($1,500), which is a 23 band festival here locally, sponsorship's of other events like the Cinco De Mayo festival, and Loufest, and to purchase promo items for giveaways and marketing materials like stickers, lighters, hats, etc.  Also these funds will contribute to building our online store as well. We currently have the domain purchased and a team building the site, but it also takes times and money.  
We constantly have exclusive tee shirts, jackets, joggers, and other custom items in our store that are limited quantity to ensure you are wearing a one of a kind or limited item. Anyone who donates $50 will receive a free t-shirt! $500 or more gets you dinner with the owner, Nick Schiro! We also have events in store: art shows, live entertainment, and other activities to keep customers returning. The next event is Friday, April 3rd from 5:30-10pm & will feature DJ Mahf (7 time best DJ in St. Louis) and two local artists showcasing their artwork! Our store located on historic Cherokee Street in St. Louis, Mo. is unlike any other and a perfect fit for our area and demographic. St. Louis city and the people here need something like this....something positive, something unique, and something fashionable worth wearing!  

This fundraiser and campaign could have a very long and lasting impact on Failed Society! These funds can potentially catapult Failed Society to the next level! Our brand is about pushing the envelope in fashion, and using rebellious creativity to express our freedom of speech and rights in society today. 
So far in a very short time Failed Society has grown from a dream and idea to a vision and reality! We already have a storefront that is getting a lot of local attention, and on March 24th we were featured on Channel 2 news!  Help us raise the funds we need for this advertising campaign and the building of our online store. We can make a difference! Here is a link to the news segment. 

http://fox2now.com/2015/03/25/get-exclusive-street-skate-wear-at-failed-society-on-cherokee-street/

Challenges we can overcome! 

Advertising is never cheap, and sometimes can put a small business underwater. Failed Society is in a position to do big things in the fashion world....just with the right push and support! Our team is qualified across the board to make this brand known nation wide, and provide some extremely dope and unique designs for skate and street apparel. 

Spread the word!

If you can not contribute that's OK, get the word out, tell a friend, and check us out on Twitter & Instagram @failedsociety14  and soon our online store www.failedsociety14.com And don't forget to use Indiegogo's share tools on here! 

Thank you so much to all those that already support Failed Society, and to those that will be supporting in any way! 2626 Cherokee Street.

story:
We opened The Gathering Place nearly five years ago on a mission to improve the experience of pregnancy and birth for all families in Miami by establishing a dynamic resource center for childbirth education, breastfeeding, parenting and women's health care. Our vision is a work in progress. We founded our non-profit, Project Motherpath about a year after we opened The Gathering Place. We knew that we needed a 501c3 in order to grow our capacity to provide education and support to every family who walked in our doors. Project Motherpath first began in 2009 as BirthGirlz, a non profit organization working to normalize and revalue all aspects of motherhood through education, outreach, community building and activism. BirthGirlz was created by a pair of mamas who wanted to organize a local revolution, and create change - one birth, one mama at a time. From protests to playgroups, the focus of Birthgirlz was on sharing resources and building a network to connect moms locally. Birthgirlz provided free community doulas, hosted monthly support groups for postpartum adjustment and infant loss, fundraised to increase women's access to vaginal birth after cesarean (VBAC) in birth centers across the State, conceived the 2010 and 2011 VBAC Summit conferences, and campaigned to save the nurse-midwifery service at Jackson South Community Hospital. Project Motherpath is a re-visioning of Birthgirlz that maintains the core principles of activism and advocacy and refines the work to focus more broadly on the full spectrum of challenges facing mothers in Miami. ​The progress we have made along the way is due to the support and encouragement of our community - our moms and dads and babies, our staff, our mentors and our families. We have a long way to go still and in order to get there we are going to continue to need support.

We've been asked a lot this year what we want most now that we have accomplished opening Magnolia Birth House. We've thought long and hard about how our families and clients could best support the work we want to do moving forward and so here it is - we want you to help us give more women in our community the opportunity to benefit from the support of a doula.


Here's how you can help improve birth outcomes in Miami

We have a staff of over twenty doulas who are committed to Indigo. This alone is a gift. Thus far our program has operated without funding using a specific formula: providing discounted doula training and mentoring to women in our local area who wish to become doulas and have a desire to provide services to women who are underserved and having families who contact us for services pay as much they are able. We compensate experienced doulas who provide care to our clients with stipends regardless of whether the client payment covers the full cost of the care they receive. This is a sustainable model that for the most part works well - families pay what they can, and both experienced doulas and doulas in training are available to work with clients who are referred. Why are we fundraising? The need is growing. In recent months we have asked by various organizations in our local area to serve families for whom there will be no ability to pay: low-income undocumented immigrants, teen mothers (ages 11-19), domestic and sexual violence survivors and women who are homeless and living in shelters. These new opportunities help us get closer to our goal of making doula services available to anyone who wants them. To ensure we are able to meet the demand - we need your help.

Our funding goal for this campaign is $15,000. Here is where your money goes:

  • EDUCATION | childbirth, breastfeeding and parenting education and immediate postpartum support for 100% of clients
  • SERVICES | birth doula services for women who otherwise would not benefit from doula care
  • TRANSPORTATION & CHILDCARE | for many of our neediest clients transportation to the hospital during labor and childcare for their minor children is a huge stressor
  • NEEDED TRAINING | domestic violence, cultural competency & social justice training for all doulas participating in the program to ensure they have the tools needed to work with at risk populations
  • 10 NEW DOULAS | comprehensive doula & breastfeeding educator training for women in our community to become Indigo Doulas (pay it forward)
Your contribution will help make doula services available to women in our community would otherwise be unable to afford them.  

Families in our community desperately need doulas!

South Florida is a challenging place to have a baby.

  • HIGH C-SECTION RATES. Miami has the frightening distinction of being a city with one of the highest rates of cesarean section in the nation - 1 in 2 women in Miami-Dade County gives birth by surgery. Most hospitals rates are approaching or over 60%. The hospitals with the lowest rates: county funded Jackson Health Systems. Of the ten facilities statewide with the highest cesarean rate, six were located in our county. Patients who deliver by c-section face recovery from major abdominal surgery alongside the exhausting demands of caring for a new baby. 
  • FINANCIAL & CULTURAL BARRIERS. Miami-Dade County has one of the highest uninsured rates in the country due to high rates of poverty and immigration. More than 700,000 residents (29.2%) have no health insurance, including Medicaid.
  • THE HEALTH DISPARITY GAP. 1 out of every 7 black babies in Miami-Dade County is born premature. Prematurity is the leading cause of death for babies in the first year of life. Further, the black infant mortality rate in Miami-Dade is almost three times higher than the infant mortality rate for whites.
  • ROUTINE INTERVENTION & INDUCTION. Most births typically take place in a hospital room, where women are confined to their beds by continuous fetal monitors and offered little one-to-one labor support. But this is not actually the biggest problem, more egregious is the routine use of interventions that are not medically necessary, alarming rates of induction of labor without medical indication and the lack of informed consent. Stories like the one linked here are not uncommon and success stories are few and far between. None of the hospitals in our county currently have doula programs, and some even ban the use of a doula.
  • POOR BREASTFEEDING OUTCOMES. In the majority of area hospitals, mothers and babies are still routinely separated after birth. Breastfeeding support postpartum is often little more than lip-service with formula feeding suggested at the first sign of difficulty. 75% of women in Miami-Dade County initiate breastfeeding but only 9.9% continue to 6 months.
Options are disappearing. Interventions are rising. Disparities are growing. Women in our community need doulas! Our doulas are contracted through Project Motherpath and do not work for hospitals, birth centers, or other health care professionals. Our doulas work for the family, providing intimate care that is focused on making the birth and postpartum experience the very best it can be.

Here is why doulas matter

Doula is an ancient Greek word that means “a woman who serves” and is now used to refer to an individual trained and experienced in childbirth whose role is to provide emotional, physical and informational support to a mother and family before, during and immediately following childbirth.

Benefits of Doula Care

Decreased medical intervention in labor*:

  • Reduces need for cesarean by 26%

  • Reduces the need for forceps or vacuum extractor by 41%

  • Reduces use of pain medication by 28%

  • Reduces dissatisfaction with birth by 33%

  • Reduces length of labor

6 weeks after birth, mothers who had doulas were*:

  • Less anxious and depressed

  • Had more confidence with baby

  • More satisfied w/ partner

  • More likely to be breastfeeding

Doula are uniquely aware of the struggles, adjustments and questions of expectant mothers. They have respect for the wisdom and decision-making abilities of parents and do not replace the critical role of family members. Doulas make a difference!

Here's how your tax-deductible donation makes a difference for moms and babies in Miami

Typically costs for birth doulas services in South Florida range from $600-$3000. Not every expecting woman and her family can afford the full price of these needed services. We created INDIGO for families with lower budgets in an effort to ensure that doula services could be available to everyone in our community.

Services include:

  • prenatal and postpartum visits

  • childbirth education

  • birth plan preparation

  • linkage to community resources

  • breastfeeding support

Project Motherpath doulas serve women from the third trimester through birth and until a baby is about six to eight weeks old at low /no cost. Our doulas are community-based and provide prenatal support and parenting education, continuous emotional and physical support throughout labor and delivery, and assistance in early postpartum. We serve clients in English, Spanish and Creole.

Our fundraising goal is large but achievable. Every donation - even a few dollars - will help us reach our goal ! All donations are tax-deductible. You can make a donation of any amount or purchase a perk to benefit our program participants. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Spread the word!! The more people who hear about this campaign, the better chance we have of meeting our goal! (Indiegogo provides tools to share this campaign through Facebook, Twitter and Google+)
  • Educate yourself and your friends about the kind of services a Doula offers! Know someone who's expecting? Ask them if they're planning on having a Doula present at their birth and encourage them to learn more about the benefits of Doula support.

By providing education and support we can foster independence and respectfully guide women and their families through the process of pregnancy, labor and birth. Thank you for considering making a donation to help fund our work!

story:
Vídeo Vignettes: Community Organizing

  • I am riding my bicycle to South America in order to document community organizing projects and to realize a dream.  Help me get there!
  • It all started with Bikes Across Borders.  As my very first bike tour drew to a close, I rode over coastal hills in southern Tamaulipas state with four others.  The night had fallen and the pungent scent of flowering blooms impregnated the air.  I was riding with Bikes Across Borders, as I've done now for over six years.  We teach and learn DIY/low-cost bicycle touring on our way to donate bicycles to people in northern México, with whom our goal is to establish relationships of solidarity.  On that first trip, I donated my bicycle to a student in the fishing village of Tepeguaje, enjoyed wonderful hospitality on the way and learned how intoxicating the freedom of bicycle travel can be.
  • Travelling is a privilege and I should use this opportunity to do something positive
  • There is a lack of documentation about good people doing good work for their communities in Latin America.
  • This is a low budget media project.  Your money goes really far when supporting a pedal powered adventure!
  • Departure: January 3, 2015
  • Current location: Oaxaca
  • We are using the name Kuautli Kondur (Eagle Condor) because we are travelling from the North where eagles live, towards the South, where condors live.  This idea is used symbolically by Native American peoples to suggest the union of the North and the South.  "Kuautli" is a word from the Nahuatl language of the North.  "Kondur" is a word from the Quichua/Quechua language(s) of the South.  Both are living languges that were once spoken by the peoples of complex, pre-Colombian empires in Las Américas: the Mexica/Aztec and the Quechua/Quichua/Incan empires.  We will be travelling through the lands that Nahuatl and Quichua/Quechua speakers live on.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need to cover our daily expenses.  These should be extremely low.
  • We plan to camp and cook whenever possible.
  • Bikes Across Borders has shown me that bicycle touring can be one of the cheapest ways to travel.  We expect to live on less than $10 a day.
  • We have already invested thousands of our own dollars into cycling equipment, video equipment and the beginning of the journey.
  • We also need to pay for a plane ticket back to the U.S. and a months living expenses for post production.

The Impact

  • The long term goal of this project is to attract attention and resources to organizations doing important community organizing work in Latin America
  • I have been a successful part of Bikes Across Borders, a community organizing project focused on donating bicycles to communities in Northern Mexico, teaching DIY/low-cost bicycle touring and establishing relationships of solidarity
  • Help us complete one of the first pedal powered projects focused on community organizing in Latin America
  • The world needs examples of people doing positive work.  Help support a lens that will focus on the solutions that will help us to create the world that we want to live in.

Risks & Challenges

  • The physical challenge is great but our years of touring experience will help to meet this challenge
  • Storing, organizing and editing the footage that we generate will be a challenge but so many tools are now available to manage a project with high quality, micro technology that we are confident it can be done and done well. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Help us get the word out!  Talk with friends!  E-mail people who you think might support us!
  • Share the campaign on Facebook and Twitter!
story_txt:
Vídeo Vignettes: Community Organizing 
I am riding my bicycle to South America in order to document community organizing projects and to realize a dream.  Help me get there!
It all started with Bikes Across Borders.  As my very first bike tour drew to a close, I rode over coastal hills in southern Tamaulipas state with four others.  The night had fallen and the pungent scent of flowering blooms impregnated the air.  I was riding with Bikes Across Borders, as I've done now for over six years.  We teach and learn DIY/low-cost bicycle touring on our way to donate bicycles to people in northern México, with whom our goal is to establish relationships of solidarity.  On that first trip, I donated my bicycle to a student in the fishing village of Tepeguaje, enjoyed wonderful hospitality on the way and learned how intoxicating the freedom of bicycle travel can be.
Travelling is a privilege and I should use this opportunity to do something positive
There is a lack of documentation about good people doing good work for their communities in Latin America.
This is a low budget media project.  Your money goes really far when supporting a pedal powered adventure!
Departure: January 3, 2015
Current location: Oaxaca

  What We Need & What You Get 
We need to cover our daily expenses.  These should be extremely low.
We plan to camp and cook whenever possible.
Bikes Across Borders has shown me that bicycle touring can be one of the cheapest ways to travel.  We expect to live on less than $10 a day.
We have already invested thousands of our own dollars into cycling equipment, video equipment and the beginning of the journey.

We also need to pay for a plane ticket back to the U.S. and a months living expenses for post production. 
  The Impact 
The long term goal of this project is to attract attention and resources to organizations doing important community organizing work in Latin America I have been a successful part of Bikes Across Borders, a community organizing project focused on donating bicycles to communities in Northern Mexico, teaching DIY/low-cost bicycle touring and establishing relationships of solidarity Help us complete one of the first pedal powered projects focused on community organizing in Latin America
The world needs examples of people doing positive work.  Help support a lens that will focus on the solutions that will help us to create the world that we want to live in. 
  Risks & Challenges 
The physical challenge is great but our years of touring experience will help to meet this challenge Storing, organizing and editing the footage that we generate will be a challenge but so many tools are now available to manage a project with high quality, micro technology that we are confident it can be done and done well.  
  Other Ways You Can Help 
Help us get the word out!  Talk with friends!  E-mail people who you think might support us! Share the campaign on Facebook and Twitter!

story:
Our Story


A Collective of Anti-Racist Organizers…   

                                   

Students Organizing Against Racism at Tulane (SOAR) was founded in 1999. We are a multiracial, multicultural organization dedicated to humanistic, anti-racist organizing at an individual, institutional and cultural level. Our goals are to analyze and organize around issues of race and racism at Tulane University, as well as to respond to specific problems on campus. We also strive to forge a meaningful relationship between Tulane and the greater New Orleans community.


Why We’re Undoing Racism 

We are launching this campaign to raise funds so that we can continue to undo racism on our campus the best way we know how: by hosting the Undoing Racism® Workshop by the People’s Institute for Survival and Beyond every semester to give students a foundation and a language to begin meaningful conversations around racism. We have organized the workshop on Tulane’s campus every semester for 15 years since our founding. Over the last five years, SOAR has filled the workshops with participants desiring the knowledge and skills presented to them (40 people per workshop). Members of the Tulane community and SOAR have asked and requested more events and programming around race/racism and anti-racist community organizing but unfortunately our requests are rarely met. Therefore, we are excited to utilize this platform to help us bring in funds to keep our organization going and people involved in undoing racism!

Racism has played a crucial role in the history and formation of the United States, just as it did here at our institution--Tulane University.

     

Racism was done and it can be undone through effective anti-racist organizing with, and in accountability to, the communities most impacted by racism. SOAR believes that Tulane can and should be at the forefront of acknowledging and combating racism in the Tulane and New Orleans community. Tulane strives to connect its values and mission to the needs of the city of New Orleans, the state, and the nation. Community involvement is now more important than ever as the university participates in the rebirth of post-Katrina New Orleans. SOAR believes that in order to fulfill its mission to be a tool for transformational change in our community, Tulane needs to equip its students, faculty, and staff to understand the role race relations play in our institution and society.

Anti-racism is also important to us because we have seen how racism affects the Tulane environment and its relations with New Orleans. All of us have experienced racism on a personal, cultural, and societal level regardless of whether we are on the receiving end of privilege or oppression and as an organization we care about our university, our community and the people within it to want to do something about it.

                                                                       

We’ve been an organization dedicated to this cause for 16 years and we plan to continue doing our work in a humanistic and positive light. With your help to bring the Undoing Racism® Workshop training—which is facilitated by internationally recognized leaders in the field of anti-racist analysis and instruction--to our campus, we will be able to achieve our goal of undoing racism at Tulane University.


Our Community Partner

Undoing Racism® is a signature workshop of The People's Institute for Survival and Beyond. This weekend-long training consists of 20 hours of instruction and facilitation by two to three of the People’s Institute’s staff. The multiracial team of trainers includes anti-racist organizing experts who have worked for years with civil, labor, and welfare rights, educational, social service and health reform movements, in addition to youth and grassroots community organizing. This unique workshop is offered by The People’s Institute which is a national, multiracial, anti-racist network of anti-racist organizers dedicated to ending racism and other forms of institutional oppression. Over the last 35 years, they have provided training, consultation, and leadership development to more than 500,000 people in organizations nationally and internationally. The People’s Institute believes that racism is the primary barrier preventing communities from building effective coalitions and overcoming institutionalized oppression and inequities. Today, The People’s Institute is recognized as a leader in the field - in a 2002 Aspen Institute survey of eleven top racial justice organizations, five credited The People’s Institute with having the most effective anti-racist analysis. The People’s Institute for Survival and Beyond focuses on understanding what racism is, where it comes from, how it functions, why it persists and how it can be undone. Their Undoing Racism workshop utilizes a systemic approach that emphasizes:

· Learning from history,

· Developing leadership,

· Maintaining accountability to communities,

· Creating networks,

· Undoing internalized racial oppression, and

· Understanding the role of organizational gate keeping as a mechanism for perpetuating racism.

Undoing Racism® is an interactive training that challenges participants to analyze the structures of power and privilege that hinder social equity and prepares them to be effective organizers for justice.

Fundraising for A Cause 

                                                   

Our funding goal for this campaign is $17,700. Below is a breakdown and outline of our budget for these funds.

·  $4,850 will go towards our Spring 2015 Undoing Racism® Workshop that is projected to be held April 17th – April 19th. This will cover the payment for the following:

o  Remaining Balance to the People’s Institute for the Cost of the Workshop and Its Trainers ($1,000)

o  Meals for Participants - Each Individual Receives Two Breakfasts, One Lunch, and One Dinner ($3,600)

§  40 Participants

§  Two Breakfasts ($1,500)

§  One Lunch ($1,200)

§  One Dinner ($900)

o  Materials: i.e. - Printing Costs for Handouts, Markers, Pens, Etc. ($250)

Because of the generosity of various donors, we are already halfway to covering the costs of our Spring 2015 workshop! (Yay!)

·  $10,850 will go towards our Fall 2015 workshop. These funds will help pay for the following expenses:

o  The People’s Institute for Survival and Beyond Undoing Racism® Workshop - Cost of the Workshop and Its Trainers ($7,000)

o  Meals for Participants - Each Individual Receives Two Breakfasts, One Lunch, and One Dinner ($3,600)

§  40 Participants

§  Two Breakfasts ($1,500)

§  One Lunch ($1,200)

§  One Dinner ($900)

o  Materials: i.e. - Printing Costs for Handouts, Markers, Pens, Etc. ($250)

·  $2,000 will go towards funding race/racism and anti-racism community organizing events and programming. Our organization has discussed planning various activities such as speakers, films, discussions, organizing campaigns, community service, and travelling to places of interest within the local New Orleans area.


As a thank-you for donating, there are perks that you can receive from us! They are all personalized from us at SOAR and we hope that you enjoy them. You can select your perk and find the details of each one on our campaign page. They are categorized by set amounts that you can choose to contribute. 

                                                     

If our funding goal is not reached, the money will still be reserved to help fund subsequent workshops in the future. We will continue to seek funding from various departments, institutions, and private donors.


The Impact

By participating in the Undoing Racism® Workshop participants will:

· Develop a common language and analysis for examining racism in the United States;

· Explore one’s own connection to institutional racism, particularly as a member of the Tulane community;

· Understand how all of us, including white people, are adversely impacted by racism every day, everywhere;

· Address surface assumptions about how our work is affected by racism, and use that knowledge to be more effective in public service, and;

· Understand the role of community organizing and building effective multiracial coalitions as a means for Undoing Racism.

We believe that members of the Tulane community who participate in these trainings will start to form deeper, more authentic relationships with one another. By providing a comprehensive series of Undoing Racism® trainings, we can foster a community that acknowledges and understands the role race relations play within Tulane and New Orleans. These Tulane students, faculty, and staff will have the support needed to continue lifelong learning around topics such as race relations, community engagement, and social justice.

From participating in these workshops, SOAR members and its allies have successfully organized campaigns, dialogues and responses to:

-  Tulane University’s proposal to increase police patrol on campus and around its perimeter in the surrounding New Orleans community;

-  Tulane’s accountability with New Orleans, especially along the facet of volunteerism and community service;

-  The Mike Brown and Eric Garner decisions in November and December 2014 in response to racist police brutality, the disproportionate incarceration of Black males in America and how this relates to Tulane and the New Orleans community; 

               

-  Cultural appropriation on college campuses, especially during Halloween;

-  Those who organize within the social justice community on Tulane's campus (Women’s, Environmental, Queer, Labor Movements, etc) we have partnered with to help them further their analysis and guide them to anti-racist resources;

-  White allyship;

-  Regaining our humanity by caucusing so that we can form meaningful relationships with each other and create a space for healing; 

-  Facilitating Skillshares and conversations on films such as Dear White People;

-   Meeting with administration, faculty, and staff of various departments to express our concerns of racism within our institution;

-  Tulane's threat to close the Department of African & African Diaspora Studies on our campus;

- And many more…

Not only do we organize together, but we are a family too! We have dinner together, hang out and have fun! #SOARFam (See our gallery!)


Testimonials From Participants on The Undoing Racism® Workshop and The SOAR Experience

 “The Undoing Racism® Training opened my eyes... As a result of this training, I have thought more critically about how to best work with the children, families, and schools in this community.” - Elizabeth C., Graduate Student

“The Undoing Racism® Training is a transformative experience that every organizer needs to have. The Labor Movement has been split by race and class divisions and the Undoing Racism® training gives me the tools to think critically about the systems and institutions I participate in.” - Benjamin Z., Alumni

“SOAR saved me.” – Alex W., Undergraduate Student and SOAR Member

“I have done over nine trainings and get something new and powerful every time. Participating in the training ushered in a complete and profound paradigm shift in my thinking and healing in my personal and professional life.” - Avery B., Staff and Participant

“If it wasn’t for SOAR and the People's Institute, I wouldn’t be the person that I am today with an understanding of how race affects all of us.” – Mykia K., Undergraduate Student and SOAR Member

“I would say the training was life-changing, and I think that everyone who wants to work with any community needs to go through this workshop. I know that I will be a much more effective organizer and member of the Tulane and greater New Orleans community because of this workshop.” - Lauren H., Alumni

"The best damn event that has happened on this campus all year!" - Elias G., Undergraduate Student and SOAR Member


Additional Ways You Can Help Us!

If you are not able to contribute but support our organization, please spread the word about our campaign to those you know! There are Indiegogo sharing tools on our campaign page and we would really appreciate it if you could post it in your social media networks! Also, please like and follow our Facebook page!

https://www.facebook.com/soartu


Thanks for reading our story and helping us to make our world a better place.

Love and Solidarity,

          SOAR

story:
What's East Bay Coffee Company?

East Bay Coffee Company is unlike any coffee house you've visited - we promise! Do you enjoy organic fair trade coffee? House-made syrups & drink creations? Healthy, hand crafted treats? How about live music & art installations? 

East Bay Coffee is a, third wave coffeehouse that serves exceptional organic coffee that is sourced by fair trade practices. Created for lovers of coffee, their beans are uniquely roasted locally using oak wood, which maximizes the flavor of every drink. One of the things that makes East Bay Coffee unique is it's a music and arts driven destination venue. They host concerts, book signings, art displays, lectures, poetry slams, and open-mic nights, worship and faith-based events.

The flagship location for East Bay Coffee Company is in "Old Town" Pinole, California where they serve the City of Pinole and it's surrounding East Bay communities including Hercules, El Cerrito, Berkeley, El Sobrante, Richmond, Crockett, and Rodeo. I am been blown away at the amount of community support they’ve received.

I approached East Bay a few months ago and asked if they would support my efforts to launch an East Bay Coffee initiative in the Haight-Ashbury district of San Francisco.

The answer was a resounding YES! With their help and the relationships and support established with our Real Life Church family, we are taking this step of faith and moving forward.  


Bringing East Bay Coffee to Haight-Ashbury


Right now we are in the beginning stages, which is exciting for everyone! Why? It gives you the unique opportunity to partner with us as pivotal founders!  We’re launching this campaign to raise funds, awareness and to offer you some cool perks and a chance to join this initiative to give back to a community and help to influence lives with faith.

This vision is costly which is why we are coming to you for help. Here is a small look into what we are looking at to launch successfully.

1)Building Fund : the City of San Francisco is the 2nd most expensive city to live in or own a business in the United States. Strangely enough, commercial business properties are in hot demand! Our building fund, which will cover our build out, property rent and operations costs is roughly $100,000.

2) Espresso Machines and Equipment:Opening a new coffee house means purchasing new equipment (which we're pretty stoked about) that will make us more efficient in serving you. Estimated cost $20,000 - $30,000.

Why then are we only asking for $40,000? Because we think it's insane to ask for more. We're working hard every day to find avenues to finance and get this work done as cheaply and efficiently as possible. We've created stretch goals with this campaign because well... every bit helps. Thank you for making HopeforHaight possible.

The Perks: what you're getting! 

Pounds, pounds, pounds! If you haven’t had our coffee, we will hook you up with our little bags of fresh-roasted joy and make you a believer.

East Bay Coffee Mug: Sip that cup o' joe in style! These porcelain mugs are functional and will represent East Bay wherever you go. 

The Holdster! We have been looking for a non-disposable option for our hot and cold drinks for some time now. The Holdster is a great product that was launched through a crowedfunding campaign (near and dear to our hearts!) that provides reusable stay and/or travel cup options. All Holdsters are hand-made and feature a vegetable based tanning process, they are also hand-riveted which make for a for a solid, long-lasting carrier for your favorite drinks from East Bay Coffee.

 


Limited Edition East Bay Coffee Company Candle: These candles will give you the perfect excuse to slow down and relax, knowing you've helped fund our sweet shoppe. 100% homemade, soy wax and in some yummy scents, these are simple yet unique! Perfect for gift giving or to enjoy yourself! 

Our Founders Club: The founders wall was an ingenious idea from our Head Barista Billy - what is a better way to display our gratitude than to hang your cup for everyone to see?! The picture below is to give you a visual of what we're thinking but the actual wall will vary in design.


Other Ways You Can Help!

We understand the economic climate and that sometimes your just not in a position to help some strange coffee people! If you're into what we do... tell people! Help us promote this in any way you can. Indiegogo has some great sharing tools that make sharing easy! Just a few clicks and you've done us a huge service. Thank you!
story_txt:
What's East Bay Coffee Company?




East Bay Coffee Company is unlike any coffee house
you've visited - we promise! Do you enjoy organic fair trade coffee? House-made
syrups & drink creations? Healthy, hand crafted treats? How about live
music & art installations? 
East Bay Coffee is a, third wave coffeehouse that
serves exceptional organic coffee that is sourced by fair trade practices.
Created for lovers of coffee, their beans are uniquely roasted locally using
oak wood, which maximizes the flavor of every drink. One of the things
that makes East Bay Coffee unique is it's a music and arts driven destination
venue. They host concerts, book signings, art displays, lectures, poetry slams,
and open-mic nights, worship and faith-based events.
The flagship location for East Bay Coffee Company is in
"Old Town" Pinole, California where they serve the City of Pinole and
it's surrounding East Bay communities including Hercules, El Cerrito, Berkeley,
El Sobrante, Richmond, Crockett, and Rodeo. I am been blown away at the amount
of community support they’ve received. 
I approached East Bay a few months ago and asked if they
would support my efforts to launch an East Bay Coffee initiative in the
Haight-Ashbury district of San Francisco.
The answer was a resounding YES! With their help and the
relationships and support established with our Real Life Church family, we are
taking this step of faith and moving forward.  




Bringing East Bay Coffee to Haight-Ashbury





Right now we are in the
beginning stages, which is exciting for everyone! Why? It gives you the unique
opportunity to partner with us as pivotal founders!  We’re launching this
campaign to raise funds, awareness and to offer you some cool perks and a
chance to join this initiative to give back to a community and help to
influence lives with faith.
This vision is costly which is
why we are coming to you for help. Here is a small look into what we are
looking at to launch successfully.
1)Building Fund : the
City of San Francisco is the 2nd most expensive city to live in or own a
business in the United States. Strangely enough, commercial business properties
are in hot demand! Our building fund, which will cover our build out, property
rent and operations costs is roughly $100,000.
2) Espresso Machines and
Equipment:Opening a new coffee house means purchasing new
equipment (which we're pretty stoked about) that will make us more efficient in
serving you. Estimated cost $20,000 - $30,000.
Why then are we only asking for
$40,000? Because we think it's insane to ask for more. We're working hard every
day to find avenues to finance and get this work done as cheaply and
efficiently as possible. We've created stretch goals with this campaign because
well... every bit helps. Thank you for making HopeforHaight possible.

The Perks: what you're getting! 
Pounds, pounds, pounds! If you haven’t had our coffee, we will hook you up with our little bags of fresh-roasted joy and make you a believer.




East Bay Coffee Mug: Sip that cup o' joe in style! These porcelain mugs are functional and will represent East Bay wherever you go. 



The Holdster! We have been looking for a non-disposable option for our hot and cold drinks for some time now. The Holdster is a great product that was launched through a crowedfunding campaign (near and dear to our hearts!) that provides reusable stay and/or travel cup options. All Holdsters are hand-made and feature a vegetable based tanning process, they are also hand-riveted which make for a for a solid, long-lasting carrier for your favorite drinks from East Bay Coffee.


 


Limited Edition East Bay Coffee Company Candle: These candles will give you the perfect excuse to slow down and relax, knowing you've helped fund our sweet shoppe. 100% homemade, soy wax and in some yummy scents, these are simple yet unique! Perfect for gift giving or to enjoy yourself! 

Our Founders Club: The founders wall was an ingenious idea from our Head Barista Billy - what is a better way to display our gratitude than to hang your cup for everyone to see?! The picture below is to give you a visual of what we're thinking but the actual wall will vary in design.



    Other Ways You Can Help! We understand the economic climate and that sometimes your just not in a position to help some strange coffee people! If you're into what we do... tell people! Help us promote this in any way you can. Indiegogo has some great sharing tools that make sharing easy! Just a few clicks and you've done us a huge service. Thank you!

story:
Marriage is the heart of the Family (Our Mission) 


The Marrying Kind, Inc. was formed out of concern for the alarming state of marriage in America.  The Marrying Kind, Inc. is a non-profit organization who's mission is to promote marriage via education, motivation and exaltation.  We provide support for marriage through consultation and seminars.  We are a non-profit  organization that teaches people how to get married, how to stay married and how to be happily married.  We believe that marriage is the fundamental building block of societies. 
Happy marriages =  happy families = happy communities. MARRIAGE MATTERS! 


Happy Couples make Happy Families- 

Date For A Mate Meet & Greet


Date for a Mate is a quarterly Meet and Greet held in downtown Los Angeles, where professional singles can meet and mingle in a fun and light hearted atmosphere.  While the Dj spins, there will be icebreaker games and fun. 
A good foundation is paramount any structure, and good relationships have good foundations.  "Date For A Mate" facilitates in the meeting of hearts by providing a space where professional singles can have good conversations, food and fun.  
Help Us Create That Spark!

 WE NEED YOUR HELP!  Hosting an event like "Date For A Mate" in a beautiful venue space in downtown Los Angeles takes a lot of resources, and resources require money.  Your donations help our organization  cover:

  • Venue Space 
  • Food & Beverage 
  • Decorations 
  • Incidentals
By sowing into marriages, you will reap a bountiful harvest of healthy happy families. Here are a few "perks" to show our appreciation for your support.


Make Some Noise

Can't donate? Help us spread the word about The Marrying Kind, Inc. and our "Date For A Mate" campaign.  Use Indiegogo's share tools to tell your friends and family about our wonderful organization! Information is worth it's weight in gold, so get the info out!!
  Like Us on Facebook

https://www.facebook.com/pages/I-Am-the-Marryin...


Follow Us on Instagram

http://instagram.com/iamthemarryingkind



 Thank you for your support!

story:
Hello Welcome to our fundraising site for Lumaca-J


My name is Victoria E. Toussaint-Hill and I am the Owner, CEO, President and Everything Else for Lumaca-J. I say that because at this point in time, I am the sole person responsible for the designs, marketing, sales, accounting, advertising and so forth and so one. We are a small company that passionately believes in our Christian faith, nowadays it seems, Christians are castigated for being a follower of Christ, I want people to be able to put their faith on display with Lumaca-J. We produce high quality T-shirts, Hoodies, and Hats with Bold, Edgy and Unique phrases for both men, women, and kids.  We also utilize premier companies for our production.  We are seeking donations so that Lumaca-J can attend Mega Fest in Dallas, Texas 2015, to showcase our product's.  All Donations are appreciated, whether large, (preferable large) lol  or small. We will put these donations to very good use, it will help us to produce more designs and variety in style, Update our website, advertise and promotion, pay for booth rental, buying mannequins to display our t-shirts and hoodies. gift bags, photography, etc. etc. etc.

We are seeking $10,000 dollars,  Your support is appreciated and I look forward to seeing my donors at the event, if you can make it, if not then i will send you a photo and our deepest gratitude for your support. Also with each donation, you will receive a variety of perks. Once you make your donation, I will ship you the perk that was selected.   Or if you want to remain anonymous, that is fine also.  Your support helps us to take the word of God to Christians and Non-Christians; in a bold and edgy way; without you saying one word!  Thank you and Lets Display Our  Faith with Lumaca-J. If you want to see our faith based clothing, donate here and then take a look at www.Lumaca-J44.com or visit us on twitter. With Golden Regards and many blessings Victoria E. Toussaint-Hill Owner, CEO and President for Lumaca-J

story:
I am trying to start a small, backyard Carnivorous Plant (and other exotic plants) nursery. I need $5000 in seed money to get started. 


I have been growing Carnivorous Plants for a few years now, and my collection is getting bigger and bigger.  I just built a new greenhouse in my backyard which has inspired me to try to open a small, backyard nursery specializing in Carnivorous Plants and other exotics


I have researched and made a list of materials I need to begin propagation on a somewhat larger scale.  I will need to build another green house, gets shade screen, humidifier, misting fans, propagation trays, a drip irrigation system, etc.  I have priced everything I need at Farmtek and it comes to about $5,000 (including materials for a new and better greenhouse).


But alas, I am but a lowly civil servant (with a green thumb) and cannot even afford that paltry sum.


That is why I am asking for your help, dear neighbor.  Give what you can if you can and you have my gratitude. 


Risks and challenges

There are risks, from natural disasters to pest problems, from drought to teenage vandals...but barring any of that I am capable of succeeding in this. I have been growing and propagating CPs small scale for years and have the happy plants to prove it.

There is also the risk that I will slip over to the dark side, create an army of giant, flesh-eating triffids and attempt to take over the world. But I wouldn't really worry about that.

You will no doubt note that I have the shipping time set for November of next year for many of the rewards. That is because many of the CPs (mostly the temperate CPs) go through a dormancy during winter...which will make them much easier to ship and for you to transplant.

story:
The #sayhitoastranger Story


Hi there! My name is Kaare Long and I'm a Digital Marketing Specialist. I provide Public Relations and Social Media Support to small businesses in Vancouver, B.C.

In 2013 I found myself suddenly single, and as a 42 year-old mother of 2 daughters, I was quite afraid of 'getting out there' into the dating world again. The online dating sites like POF, Tinder, and Cupid just seemed to be so impersonal, overwhelming, and stressful. I played along though, and found I ended up having to weed through the inevitable weirdos and crazy messages to the point that it became a second job.

There HAD to be a better way! During a conversation one night with one of my younger interns, Adam Bajan, who was himself single,  we started chatting about how difficult it was to meet someone in Vancouver as a single person. Age didn't seem to matter, and gender and sexual preference didn't seem to make a difference either.  After reading some damning articles online, written by both men and women, my team and I decided that there was definitely a 'cold' problem in Vancouver that had nothing to do with the weather. 

An icy reputation comes with Vancouver and many other Canadian Cities and we decided to go out there and see if this was really true. We tested the idea on Social Media sites and got a flurry of responses that indicated this might be a 'thing' that people felt strongly about. Then we embarked on a braver mission and I grabbed a video camera, Adam donned a big sign on his shirt and we walked around Gastown, Yaletown and Downtown Vancouver for 4 hours one sunny Sunday. What we found was surprising, and it also backed up the many bad 'raps' we had heard about Vancouver being a 'cold city' to meet people in. This was disappointing to say the least, and both of us realized why neither of us felt comfortable approaching strangers just to say 'Hi!' and maybe meet someone new. Especially when thinking about dating prospects, that just seemed IMPOSSIBLE in this city.

This video created a massive response in the city with opposite viewpoints, both passionately defending their beliefs. "Vancouver is REALLY hard to meet people in!" "I hate being single in Vancouver", and " Vancouver is awesome, don't bash our city like that!" So - we decided to create a city-wide campaign to prove the theory, and the reputation of Vancouver WRONG! 

#sayhitoastranger was born. A campaign that begins online leading up to the weekend event, and culminates in a full weekend of saying 'Hi!' to strangers. Local  businesses also got involved and gave out FREE goodies if participants came in and said 'Hi!' which also supported all our local shops! In one weekend, we warmed the city up for many folks and took tons of photos and videos. 

After this pilot project, we realized that The city we live in really just needs a way to break down the barriers that we have all put around ourselves, be it 'stranger danger', shyness, or fear of any kind. Maybe we have a weekend where we can all just let it go and feel free to say 'Hi!' to anyone we pass by. Then perhaps we can begin to trust each other as a community and begin to meet more friends, connections, and perhaps future romantic partners!

We want to bring this amazingly fun and connective weekend to Vancouver again and eventually other cities around the world and we have officially launched the dates of the second installment. 
Feb 13-15th, 2015: Valentines #sayhitoastranger!

We need YOUR help to make this BIGGER and BETTER than our pilot project. We have a full production team ready to volunteer their services to get this party happening, but we need financial assistance to ensure that everyone hears about this campaign and has the opportunity to join in!

Does YOUR city need a #sahitoastranger day? Help us make it possible to bring this event to your hometown.

Be a part of the founding community of partners by contributing whatever you think you can to help us build this weekend for you! 
And BTW - I am NO LONGER single! :-)

What We Need & What You Get

We're asking for $20,000 in cold hard cash to pay for the following:

  • Design and printing for wearable items that can be utilized during the weekend. A #sayhitoastranger T-shirt, wristband, or coffee mug!
  • Design and printing for 'We #sayhitoastranger!' signs for all of the local shops  that partner with us to encourage visitors to come in and get FREE stuff!
  • A video and production crew to follow us around during the weekend and talk to strangers and shops as people #sayhitostrangers and get FREE stuff! Also, we want to hear what YOU think about Vancouver, and what you feel we need to be able to connect more to each other.
  • Website maintenance - We have launched our beautiful website, but we need support in maintaining it. All sponsors of this initiative and community partners will be on this website! And that means YOU! If you contribute ANY financial amount, we will put your name on the website. We will also post the schedule on this website so that you can visit as many participating partnering shops to get much FREE stuff and meet many new peeps as possible!
  • Administration costs to assist us in streamlining this process so we can do it again next year! And then maybe move on to another city that needs some warming up! (Do we hear Toronto being whispered?)

The Impact

The impact of this Campaign will be felt by ALL who value community, connection and 'buying local.' Not only will we be shattering our barriers to saying 'Hi!', we will be supporting all of our local businesses. Coffee shops, bakeries, art shops, bookstores, yoga studios - ALL sorts of businesses that need our support to thrive!

This was our success last year with only 2 weeks to create, launch and execute this awesome weekend.

2013 CAMPAIGN RESULTS:

  • Approximately 200 people checked into 4 Community Partner locations.
  • 3,400 video views, 400 blog post views, 900 website visits, and engagement using #sayhitoastranger hashtag from November 4-10, 2013, totalling over 5,000 online interactions.
  • #sayhitoastranger trended on Twitter on November 7, 2013.
Media Attention:
The Rush with Fiona Forbes - Interview 

Vancity Buzz - Say Hello to a Stranger Vancouver

Hello Vancity - Say Hello to a Stranger Weekend in Vancouver

BCIT News - Greet a Stranger, Warm a City

Let me out Creative - Vancouver – mild weather but icy reputation

I live in East Van - Will you say Hi to a stranger?

Marc Smith - #30DaysOfKindness meets #sayhitoastranger!

Risks & Challenges

A project like this builds momentum on its own because it is something we all yearn for in our city. We all WANT to be able to meet people with more ease as we go about our days. BUT, it still requires an awful lot of work, preparation, money, time and passion to recruit businesses, create websites, share on social media, design and create signs and logos, interact with the community to set up 'checkpoints' and create the schedule for the weekend. 

We need HELP! And money is the BEST way to assist us in strengthening and expanding this mission!

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't have the cash, but still want to help? GREAT! We can use all the voices possible to spread the work and word of this campaign. 

  • SHARE with your friends on Social Media and use the Indiegogo SHARE tools to easily post this call for help on your social media platforms.
  • Get out there on the event weekend Feb 13-15th, 2015 and JOIN us in warming up this city!

Thank you for your support! We are so very grateful!

story:
My name is Rosie Lovell. I started my cafe in Brixton in 2003, aged 23, and have published two cookbooks. 
I first moved to Peckham when I was 18 and it feels like home. I love everything about Rye Lane, the noise, the mess and the mix and would love to bring some of what I have created in Brixton in a warm and inviting cafe with delicious everyday food. I am what Peckham needs and I need Peckham. 

We need to build a small catering kitchen so that we can knock out our signature delicious homestyle food. The space has been an office so is horrid and really needs a good facelift so that it is the kind of room you would want to enjoy some coffee and cake in or knock back a few beers by night.  
This project will not be possible without crowdfunding.  
We have raised half of our funding ourselves but to make the space really fantastic, we need more! Plasterers don't come for free, but I hadn't realised quite how expensive they were. 
Spread the word, even if you can't contribute. Help the homecoming to Peckham!

story:
"Reluctant Saint"

I'm Carol Thornton, a distance healer that some people tell me I'm a saint! haha! Seriously though -- I have healed people of schizophrenia (twice), improved autism, healed emotionally traumatized people from panic attacks, post traumatic stress disorder, depression, uncontrollable anger outbursts, and achieved great releases from many kinds of diseases -- mental and physical -- through understanding the holography of unconscious archetypes.

Many, many people have profusely and passionately  wished me many blessings, so now I am finally asking!  You can fulfill their wish of the deepest gratitude to me... the great Circle of connections ... by helping me fulfill my passionate dream. 

I deeply desire to live in an eco village, in either Oregon or Washington, with start-up funds to contribute to the village's cottage industries. There are several communities available, and the successful ones require an investment sum. They are interested in human-scale equipment (instead of mega-factories) and they require the screened applicant to show up with partial start-up costs for a small-scale business. One of these four businesses would easily be successful: 1) purchase three miniature cows (Dexters preferred). Their milk makes fantastic cheese; mini-cows are in great demand for breeding too.  (Full-sized cows are just too big for most villages.)  

2) Industrial hemp: human-scale threshing machines so that hemp can be processed to make paper or clothes, or virtually anything. We could start by simply supplying the threshed fibers to paper companies or other users. 

3) medicinal marijuana is also a very noble endeavor  

4) There's huge demand for assisted death in Oregon, where it is legal.  The "Death with Dignity" and "Right to Die" movement is huge!  People are traveling to Oregon for those services, and I could easily get certified and do that.

I am crazy in love with the idea of living in a sustainable community. Haha, maybe my future husband is a farmer!  =D

As you probably know, "alternative healers" don't make much money, but it has been my talent and my dharma. Now I want to teach it in a community so that it lives on and on. "Miracles greater than these" I can easily expect from my students!  I have absolutely done miracles and I'm just getting started!


Anastasia's "Take Back Your Motherland, People"

“The whole Earth could be a Motherland for each one of its inhabitants, and Man could be caressed by everything in the Universe, but for that to happen, he would need to join together all planes of being into a single point, call it his Motherland, and create with his own self a Space of Love therein. Then all the best things of the Universe would come into contact with it firsthand – come into contact with the Space of your Motherland. You in yourself will feel the whole vast Universe through this point, and possess power unsurpassed. They will know about this on other worlds. Everything will serve you, as God, our Creator, wanted it.” – Anastasia

I am saddened by living alone and I want to become a member of a "tribe" of farmers -- eco villagers --because it would be the reward for so many healings I have done, so many lives I have saved, so many people whose realities shifted in significantly wondrous ways.

The beautiful eco village concept, in general, is about shared housing, with its community kitchen, dining, and community shower-and-laundry facilities makes it possible for rent of approx. $500/mo for a large "bedroom" that accommodates a computer table, small kitchenette, and 1/2 bath, comfortable for a single person or a couple.  This also saves Water! I surprise myself how passionately I would like to live with others in such a beautiful way. 

Lots of orbs that night

Major-Scale Energy Work

I have done great works for the benefit of humanity in general as well, not just individuals. So now I am praying for the good karma for my great work, for my dream to come true.  I am a young 56yo with plenty to give and teach and mentor  and some very lucky young farmers are going to become fabulous healers if I can raise the funds!  I hope you consider this, I pray and Thank You if you will finance my migration to a happy homeland of love and joy

Thank You

Carol Thornton

Short Summary

The $50,000:

1) 25,000 is the required "buy in" that prosperous Eco Villages put towards cottage industries, which are chosen by group vote. I'm hoping for approval to breed Dexter miniature cows. Or pitch in to an already-existing human-scale industry that is growing.

2) the other $25,000 is to build a tiny house or yurt for me to live in. 

If I don't receive the total amount, I can at least begin to build some sort of hovel, while I'm paying cheap rent for a single room. I've rented rooms in peoples' houses many times and I'm an excellent housemate. Another option is to lease a small bit of land from a landowner and start my own cottage industry.

And I know I will be a fabulous community member, especially with my healing abilities!

Helping the World Be A Better Place 

I believe Eco Villages will survive climate changes and droughts, in Washington and Oregon. If you contribute to my campaign, according to Eastern thought, then you would deserve the right to reincarnate to the Village that you helped and nurtured with your contribution.  

Living close to nature is a gorgeous and happy way to become enlightened, and I believe your contribution makes you part of that future "tribe" of peeps that Mother Nature herself will protect and sustain.  I have no particular religious affiliation because I believe Truth is at the heart of all religions, and I can and do communicate with animals, plants, Consciousness. Everything is God, and opening to communication with all things makes people extremely happy. I want to play the role of "grandma" to the millenials that are raising the next generation, and who are likely to survive all global challenges. 

When I apply for residency, I think that a wise administrator will ask me for a distance healing session, and, once experienced, the astonishment will rapidly put me at the top of the list as a valued prospective member. Holographic healing is virtually unknown, and yet unbelievably remarkable.  Its effects can be subtle, but within a few months, very significant changes have occurred in the person's personality, consciousness, and life, and then the fascination with the methodology truly begins.  I have often helped people that doctors gave up on, and I want to be of service to a community of "preppers", or hippies, whatever you want to call us  =D

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, but want some good karma for your own future survival of these radical times of economic and climate change, please use the Indiegogo share tools and ask your folkies to visit me here.  Thank you, Dearie!!!

story:
What is Spabear?

Spabear is changing the beauty industry through innovation while striving to offer  something new and exciting.  We are creating a new way to get your nails, waxing and facials done by changing the way that people meet their beauticians and receive their services. How does it work? Anyone can meet a professional and book a service all from the convenience of their computer or smartphone. Then, they come to the client’s house or apartment to perform the service. 

Spabear is the fun, convenient and affordable new way to book beauty services in your home!

It's such a luxury to receive beauty services in your home but what is really exciting is that  these services are also really affordable. How? We are cutting out the "middle man" (such as a salon) and  clients (“spa mem-bears”) and beauticians (“bear-ticians”) are able to create real, lasting relationships. Clients have the potential to earn some great rewards and gifts and to refer friends in order to earn discounted services. This system is also beneficial to the beauticians as they are able to work outside of a salon environment and have the potential to make much more money. In this high-tech world with so many busy people and such active lives, Spabear simply makes sense. It is the next logical step in the beauty industry and has the potential to change it forever.

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help to get more spa mem-bears and bear-ticians to stay home!  The funds will be distributed in three parts, if we achieve our goal. If we don’t achieve the goal we will use most of the funds toward marketing so we can create more awareness and generate more sales.

1.  Technology Factors:

These funds will be used to improve our website and, if possible, we will begin development of our mobile application. 

2.  Marketing Factors:

The second portion of the funds  will be used for  marketing to create more awareness about spabear and boost our brand recognition.

3.  Human factors:

 We will use the remainder of the funds to source and convert more beauticians into bear-ticians so there are more choices on our site and more spa-membears can stay home.

OK, so what do you get?  We have some awesome perks for you.

We will share some of the goodies that our spa mem-bears get to experience when they stay home with us. Our honey kit, for example, is filled with post-care products that you will love.


Please Note : 

All reservations are based on availability. Your booking is based on an estimated reserve time, most services will be rendered within the reserve time. You will be notified via SMS minutes before the bear-tician arrives at your residence.

The Impact

Beauticians who offer services like nails, wax and facials do not have the same flexibility as a hairstylist, massage therapist or make-up artist.  They’re often forced to be at a “physical” salon where they get paid low hourly wages and have to compete against other beauticians for the same customers. In supporting the spabear vision, you are helping beauticians become independent by being their own boss and creating their own destiny.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Please be a “social” bear and help us in creating awareness. Follow us on your social media channels.  In addition, if you have friends and family who reside in NYC, please let them know about our company and services.

story:
Tapology and Youth

Tapology Dance Festival for Youth serves more than 1,000 young people each year.  The program has become a remarkable beacon in our community, impacting lives and futures through the beauty of art and a child's love of dance. 

In its 13th year, Tapology has become one of the most important sites for art education, through tap dancing, in our nation; attracting some of the greatest performers in the world.  

Tapology offers programing during the summer months, in before and after school programs, in special projects, and through Tapology's Youth Ensemble.  These programs aggressively support activity for youth who are economically challenged, and have limited availability to arts programming. 

Art, vigorous physical activity and preservation of the history of tap as an American dance form, with emphasis on African American influence, and the impact of Jazz on an exciting performance style, combine to create a dynamic learning experience. 

Participation in the program supports a student's critical thinking skills and mathematical logic, giving them skills that will allow them to succeed in life and fulfill their dreams.   

We Need You

Tapology needs to raise $5,000 in the next 60 days to meet a matching funds challenge!  Your donation to this campaign will be matched on a one to one basis by the Ruth Mott Foundation allowing us to provide:

  • Tap dance instruction to disadvantaged students through our outreach programs.
  •  Tap shoes for deserving students.
  •  Free performances at assisted living facilities for senior citizens.
  • Intensive training for students wishing to excel to artistic excellence.
  • Support to our Visiting Schools Day program serving more than 700 youth from public and charter schools annually.

The Impact

  • Your support will help provide free, quality tap dance instruction to students lacking the financial and parental support to participate in the traditional dance studio culture.  Programs such as this have proven to be a deterrent to crime, drug abuse and teen pregnancy; while exposing the student to creative learning processes that positively affect traditional learning.
  • As young dancers grow and develop, rigorous training requires an advanced  shoe that supports and protects their feet. Many students, due to lack of funds, wear shoes that are too small, or badly in need of repair.  Your support will help eliminate  pain and embarrassment for students who can earn a high quality tap shoe through hard work and dedication .   Your donation will also help fund the Tapology shoe bank which provides  good basic tap shoes for beginning students participating in our after school and outreach programs.
  • Performances at assisted living facilities are met by tears of joy, smiles and thank you's from severely under served Seniors confined in assisted living facilities.  A little happiness for many who are at the last station of their lives.
  • Summer Tap Intensive and artist residency programs allow students to gain advanced training beyond the studio from working professionals for a full week of hard, dedicated work.
  • Our Visiting School program, which serves more than 700 youth each Fall, exposes  students to the art and a brief history of tap while encouraging them to participate in more expansive program opportunities provided by Tapology. 

Your Donation

Satisfies a small portion of the need in you to be the change needed to create a better future; the change our youth need to help them develop and pursue their dreams of becoming successful, contributing members of society.   Your donation helps to directly impact the lives of young people, today!

The Challenge

  • Tapology's concept is tried, it works to produce young people who are determined and active.  Those who are less likely to be thrown off course by negative influences.  Because of it's successful model, the program is in demand and we need your help to meet that demand.  More teachers, more shoes, development of more programs, more space to teach, more time to spend with students...
  • Your donation of as little as $25 can help us do the work on the ground, helping the youth who need our attention now!   In fact, your donation up to $1,000 will be matched dollar for dollar through the generosity of the Ruth Mott Foundation.  Please help by making your donation now .

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you are unable to make a monetary contribution but are willing to help, please send this link to those individuals you know who support the arts and want to make a difference in the lives  of young people.  LIKE our campaign on Facebook.  Mention it on Twitter.
