story:
Carol Hagen is a purveyor of ARTISAN CREAMED HONEY.  "I transform small batches of raw, Tennessee honey into an aromatic and creamy spread of pure honey and organic spices. Pair my Nashville-made honey spreads with sharp white cheddar, sliced apples, bagels, baked sweet potatoes, grilled salmon, cake icing, sauces, roasted chicken or a SPOON! " 

  4oz Cardamom infused Sourwood Creamed Honey

My INDIEGOGO campaign  is the result of a surprise move, my rental was sold in November, 2014, in the middle of the holiday season. I had plans to move in the spring; after a successful holiday season and winter production cycle. However, an unsolicited real estate offer in October 2014, had me making and selling honey while negotiating a new lease, transforming a spare bedroom into a honey kitchen; plus packing and moving the old honey kitchen, my life, my bees and my Goldendoodle, Honey Dew. The last batches of 2014 creamed honey were made in the new kitchen.

Now it's time to finish the kitchen  and get this honey business back on track.  To demonstrate my commitment to this campaign and bee conservation I post a daily bee fact and honey recipe right here under the UPDATE tab.  In addition to your particular perk, on March 16th all funders receive a PDF booklet, "30 INDIEGOGO DAYS of BEE FACTS and HONEY RECIPES".  This series is also available on my ARTISAN CREAMED HONEY blog. 

My ACTION LIST  & budget for this campaign are provided below.

  60,000 bees and I applaud your involvement.   Carol Hagen, artisan and beekeeper  

Artisan Creamed Honey  is made with Middle Tennessee Clover honey or East Tennessee Sourwood tree blossom honey. My unique crystallizing recipe transforms liquid honey into a creamy spread. The culinary goal is for you to taste the unique flavors of the honey; followed by a subtle flavor of infused organic ground cardamom, cinnamon, cinnamon-clove or orange essential oil. It really does ignite smiles and laughter with rolling eyes and calls for "You gotta try this!"

Tennessee Honey Bar  refers to my Nashville Farmers Market booth where you are welcome to sample East and Middle Tennessee raw honey and pollen; samples are available at restaurants and specialty markets where ARTISAN CREAMED HONEY is served. The honey I offer is from family owned and operated apiaries with 800 to 1000 hives; they work 24-7 caring for healthy bees in the Tennessee hills and mountains. 

  Bee Poster by Greg Decker - $25 Perk

I am a beekeeper, but my focus is on community education. I take an observation hive to the farmers market, garden clubs and festivals. I introduce bees as our busy and gentle benefactors; then we discuss conservation and "beeing" aware of how to protect honey bees and native bees from poison.

                                 First batch from the new kitchen.

To move forward  I must:  

  • Complete my new honey kitchen  to Certified Domestic Kitchen standards
  • Update branding  with my new kitchen address and new product titles
  • Triple the volume of honey purchased  for creaming and for resale
  • Hire part-time help.  I believe in paying a living wage of $15 hourly and already allow $1.25 per jar for labor.  I am able to make a reasonable profit and produce an exceptional product at a price people are willing to pay. 12 jars @ $1.25 = $15


ACTION LIST for $15,000 in campaign revenue:

  •   $1715      HONEY KITCHEN: interior doors, dishwasher, ceiling light fixture, install the bathroom sink (now on the floor), plus electric and plumbing inspections allowing for possibly upgrades                                                                         2014 winter investment + original kitchen assets = $2149
  •     $560     (4) additional compact refrigerators @ $140 each                              Six compact refrigerators would enable me to triple my production and are ¼ the cost of one wine case
  •     $180      New Domestic Kitchen Certification  and safety course @ $100 and upgraded business license
  •     $350     Farmers Market Vendor Insurance - In 2014, I was covered by a supplier I sold honey for; the Tennessee Artisan Honey Bar is independent.
  •     $280    Change of address on branding,  plus new market banners & apron
  •   $6152     Purchase native honey for creaming, jars and labels,  this figure includes shipping campaign honey perks
  •   $5763     Purchase native honey for resale, this figure includes gas for picking up honey, because honey is heavy and shipping is really pricey!
  • NOTE:       Buying large quantities of honey  three times annually saves money that I can convert into wages.  Going forward, revenue from spring and summer sales finance fall and winter overhead.
  •   Equals $15,000  
  • BUZZZZZZZZZZZ  PAST $15,000 into that $20K - 26K stratosphere and you enable me to expand my helper's hours, advertise and design displays.Thank you!
story_txt:
Carol Hagen is a purveyor of ARTISAN CREAMED HONEY.  "I transform small
batches of raw, Tennessee honey into an aromatic and creamy spread of pure honey
and organic spices. Pair my Nashville-made honey spreads with sharp white cheddar, sliced apples, bagels, baked sweet potatoes, grilled salmon, cake icing, sauces, roasted chicken or a SPOON! "    4oz Cardamom infused Sourwood Creamed HoneyMy INDIEGOGO campaign  is the result of a surprise move,
 my rental was sold in November, 2014, in the middle of the holiday 
season. I had plans to move in the spring; after a successful holiday season and winter production 
cycle. However, an unsolicited real estate offer in October 2014, had me making and 
selling honey while negotiating a new lease, transforming a spare 
bedroom into a honey kitchen; plus packing and moving the old 
honey kitchen, my life, my bees and my Goldendoodle, Honey Dew. The last batches of 2014 creamed honey were made in the new kitchen.Now it's time to finish the kitchen  and get this honey 
business back on track.  To demonstrate my commitment to this campaign 
and bee conservation I post a daily bee
 fact and honey recipe right here under the UPDATE tab.  In addition to your particular perk, on March 16th all funders receive a PDF booklet, "30 INDIEGOGO DAYS of BEE FACTS and HONEY RECIPES".  This series is also available on my ARTISAN CREAMED HONEY blog. My ACTION LIST  & budget for this campaign are provided below.  60,000 bees and I applaud your involvement.   Carol Hagen, artisan and beekeeper   
Artisan Creamed Honey  is made with Middle Tennessee
Clover honey or East Tennessee Sourwood tree blossom honey. My unique
crystallizing recipe transforms liquid honey into a creamy spread. The culinary
goal is for you to taste the unique flavors of the honey; followed by a subtle
flavor of infused organic ground cardamom, cinnamon, cinnamon-clove or orange
essential oil. It really does ignite smiles and laughter with rolling eyes and
calls for "You gotta try this!"

Tennessee Honey Bar  refers to my Nashville Farmers Market 
booth where you are welcome to sample East and Middle Tennessee raw 
honey and pollen; samples are available at restaurants and specialty 
markets where ARTISAN CREAMED HONEY is served. The honey I offer is from
 family owned and operated apiaries with 800 to 1000 hives; they work 
24-7 caring for healthy bees in the Tennessee hills and mountains.   Bee Poster by Greg Decker - $25 PerkI am a beekeeper, but my focus is on community education. I take an 
observation hive to the farmers market, garden clubs and festivals. I 
introduce bees as our busy and gentle benefactors; then we discuss 
conservation and "beeing" aware of how to protect honey bees and native 
bees from poison.                                 First batch from the new kitchen.To move forward  I must:   

Complete my new honey kitchen  to Certified Domestic Kitchen standards

Update branding  with my new kitchen address and new product titles

Triple the volume of honey purchased  for creaming and for resale

Hire part-time help.  I believe in paying a living wage of
 $15 hourly and already allow $1.25 per jar for labor.  I am able to 
make a reasonable profit and produce an exceptional product at a price 
people are willing to pay. 12 jars @ $1.25 = $15
 




ACTION LIST for $15,000 in campaign revenue:

  $1715      HONEY KITCHEN: interior doors, dishwasher, ceiling light fixture, install the bathroom sink (now on the floor), plus electric and plumbing inspections allowing for possibly upgrades                                                                         2014 winter investment + original kitchen assets = $2149
    $560     (4) additional compact refrigerators @ $140 each                              Six
compact refrigerators would enable me to triple my production and are ¼ the cost
of one wine case
    $180      New Domestic Kitchen Certification  and safety course @ $100 and upgraded business license
    $350     Farmers Market Vendor Insurance - In 2014, I was covered by a supplier I sold honey for; the Tennessee Artisan Honey Bar is independent.
    $280    Change of address on branding,  plus new market banners & apron

  $6152     Purchase native honey for creaming, jars and labels,  this figure includes shipping campaign honey perks

  $5763     Purchase native honey for resale, this figure includes gas for picking up honey, because honey is heavy and shipping is really pricey!

NOTE:       Buying large quantities of honey  three times annually saves money that I can convert 
into wages.  Going forward, revenue from spring and summer sales finance fall and winter overhead. 

  Equals $15,000  

BUZZZZZZZZZZZ  PAST $15,000 into that $20K - 26K stratosphere and you enable me to expand my helper's hours, advertise and design displays.Thank you!

story:
(For our continually updated Distribution Strategy, scroll to the bottom)

Introduction

Imagine learning that a couple hundred children in your community died last year because they didn't have safe water to drink. In most industrialized countries, that would be front page, national news. I don't think that's happened in the US for centuries. Now imagine that instead of a hundred, it was 5000 children. Annually.

Clean water is something us modern first-worlders take for granted. In much of the United States, restaurants are required by law to give a free glass of water to anyone who asks. In Zambia however, people have to walk miles to obtain such a simple product and there are only so many hours in a day. Oftentimes, Zambian parents are forced to choose between working for food or walking to get water. It's a lose-lose decision and many of their children end up paying the price of drinking stagnant, pathogenic water.

Crett and Connor Mitchell, the founders of the PENS4Life campaign, felt a responsibility for these people as they are a part of our community- the community of the human race. Fatalities are more than just a statistic, they are a cry for help.

The Story(Long)

"5000 Zambian Children die every year due to unsafe drinking water"

-Water Aid

5000 children. In one country. Every year. Gone.

If these kids can't even get clean drinking water, what good is providing them with vaccines or schools? Crett was in the process of preparing to travel to Lusaka, a small village in Zambia, with his daughter Courtney and Chrysalis, her boarding school, when he stumbled across this devastating fact. Chrysalis is a small therapeutic boarding school in Montana for girls ages 13-18 that organizes an annual trip to Zambia, with the purpose of building schools and immersing its students and their families in the culture of a third-world country. Upon learning that so many children were in need of some kind of water-purification system, Crett contacted SteriPEN (makers of the SteriPEN Ultra) before he left, hoping for a small donation that he could bring with him to Lusaka.

SteriPEN donated 5 SteriPEN Ultras to the Chrysalis school trip which were brought to the children in Lusaka. Met with immense gratitude, the trip organizers at Chrysalis took some video and pictures of the children using the innovative SteriPENS to purify their water. They sent the media files to Crett who sent them to SteriPEN, and long story short, SteriPEN's management team had a meeting where they decided to sponsor a larger scale version of Crett's experiment. The sponsorship lead to Connor's involvement in setting up this IndieGoGo campaign PENS4Life in Zambia and the hope that with your help, we can stop all contaminated-water-related deaths in Zambia.

The Story(Short)

  • 5000 Zambian Children Die Every Year Due to Unsafe Drinking Water                   -WaterAid
  • SteriPEN provided Crett Mitchell with 5 SteriPEN Ultras to donate to Zambian children in Lusaka, Zambia
  • The charitable donation met with HUGE SUCCESS, inducing SteriPEN's management team to sponsor a larger scale fundraising effort
  • Following news of the sponsorship, Connor Mitchell put together this IndieGoGo PENS4Life in Zambia campaign in hopes of crowdsourcing the funds from the benefactors of the world in order to help stop contaminated-water-related deaths in Zambia

The Campaign(Long)

SteriPEN's sponsorship brought much more than just their vocal support:

For every SteriPEN the public provides, they will donate an extra one free- up to two hundred FREE SteriPENS!

The approximate value for such a donation would be $20,000!

A portion of the funds will be used to purchase an equivalent supply of portable solar panels. These will allow for a more economical and environmentally friendly method for charging the PENS. 

Even if we don't reach our lofty goal of $50,000, all funds will be used to purchase as many SteriPEN Ultras as possible to maximize our impact on the lives of these children. Crett and Connor will be responsible for the delivery of any and all SteriPENS to Zambian children. They acquired connections in Lusaka through the flagship venture with Chrysalis in October, and therefore maintain the infrastructure required to efficiently and effectively distribute the pens. Chibwe, a member of our management team and our chief connection in Zambia, has a personal connection with Doctor Clarence Chiluba in the National Zambia Health Organization who knows exactly where the SteriPENS should go to have the greatest impact. With the additional help of Tumba Makuwa and Thandiwe Banda, members of a global health organization, the distribution team will make sure that the SteriPEN Ultras go where they are needed most.

Should this Zambian Pens4Life campaign prove even moderately successful, we plan on expanding to include other third world countries with drinking water problems- both in Africa and elsewhere.

The Campaign(Short)

  • SteriPEN offered to match every public donation (up to the value of 200 SteriPEN Ultras or $20,000!!)
  • Portion of funds raised will be used to purchase an equivalent number of portable solar panels (brand yet to be determined)
  • Every Dollar will be spent on providing the necessary means for Zambian children to treat their own water- even if we don't reach our goal
  • Delivery will be executed by Crett and Connor who will travel to Lusaka, Zambia and work with Chibwe Sondashi, Doctor Clarence Chiluba (NZHO), Tumba Makuwa, and Thandiwe Banda to provide the SteriPENS where they are needed most.

The Supporters- YOU(Long)

Enough about us. We aren't the reason the PENS4Life campaign exists- you are. Please know that any donation you make will bring you as much satisfaction as it does the children who receive their magic SteriPEN wand as a result. 

Okay, maybe that was a slight exaggeration. The SteriPENS do save their lives after all. But our perks, coupled with the karmic cleanse altruism provides, is quite the reward. I mean a Personal Thank You from the Zambian child you save?! Words can't do it justice:

$150 gets you this priceless jewel plus a premium t-shirt (see Image Gallery for pictures) and a chance to call our cause your own. But we at PENS4Life aren't exclusive in the slightest. Can't afford the $150 Complete Package? Just $20 gets you Team Membership Status! And even if you can't spare the change- just sharing us with your friends and family can earn you Team Member Status! (IndieGoGo's tools make it easy!) Shoot us an email with a quick explanation of how you helped our cause and don't be surprised to receive an invitation to join our team soon after. Collaboration is powerful- the more team members we have, the more people we can reach. Feel a pull to help? Join us today and reap the benefits.

The Supporters- YOU(Short)

  • The Personal Thank You Perk from a $100 donation is priceless (see video above)
  • The $150 Complete Package provides incredible value, but don't be dismayed if you can't afford it- $20 gets you the most valuable perk of all: Team Member Status!
  • Can't spare the $20? Share our PENS4Life campaign with your family and friends, then shoot us an email briefly describing how you helped. You can expect an invitation to join our team soon after.

In Conclusion...

This campaign will have extraordinarily beneficial effects. Every SteriPEN Ultra we deliver is another 5 children with guaranteed safe water for five years. Sometimes all we need is a little time to get our feet under us, and that's what one SteriPEN Ultra provides these kids. Everyone deserves clean drinking water, especially children with their entire life ahead of them. Please donate whatever you can today and trust us to take care of the rest. We won't let you down.
****************************************************************************

March 10, 2015


PENS4Life Distribution Strategy

Introduction

Providing safe water to majority of rural Zambians in need is still a major challenge. About less than 60% of the rural population in Zambia has access to safe water.  The population without access to clean and safe water access their water from unsafe water sources that include shallow wells, dams and streams. To address this need, there is need for alternative methods to ensure that households have access to safe drinking water. Distribution of Steripens will aim at addressing this challenge to ensure that target rural communities especially children have access to clean and safe water and ultimately improved health.

The proposed distribution of Steripens will be done in 3 phases;

  1. Phase 1 - Pilot Stage

  2. Phase 2 – Actual Execution (Distribution at Large scale)

  3. Phase 3 – Monitoring


Phase 1: The Pilot Stage

Before rolling out distribution of steripens on a large scale there is need to conduct a pilot that will be of great significance towards informing how distribution should be done. The steripens are new purification devices to be introduced in Zambia thus the need to conduct a pilot. The pilot intervention will involve the distribution of steripens which are water purification devices through rural local authorities that have the mandate for improved provision of water supply and sanitation in rural districts. The Local authorities work closely with Ministry of Health in an effort to improve the lives of the rural populations in the provision of water and sanitation.  

During this phase the partners involved will have to be trained in the use of the devices before taking them down to intended pilot groups. The phase will also focus on sensitizing the users on the use of the devices and the importance of water purification and proper storage of the purified water to avoid recontamination.

Pilot Target Groups

The proposed distribution target groups will include schools and communities/villages without access to clean and safe water.

Objectives of the Pilot

The objectives of the pilot will include the following;

  • To test whether promoting and distributing of steripens through local councils or RHCs can be sustainable, and the extent to which such a model can create increases in correct and continued use of steripens among the rural populations.

  • Guide which target group would  make better utilisation of the device

  • Have a projected number of possible beneficiaries

  • What is the acceptance rate of the steripens among target group?

  • What is the extent of correct use of Steripens among target group?

  • What are the triggers and barriers to the continued use of steripens?

  • What other efforts/inputs are needed to stimulate demand for the use of steripens to the target group?


Pilot Duration and Areas

The proposed pilot period is 3 months and the council and MOE should be in a position to provide with necessary information on the use of the steripens on a monthly basis.  A simple questionnaire will be developed that will help capture necessary information that will help tailor the large scale distribution in an effective and sustainable way. Four districts have been proposed for the pilot and these are:

  1. Petauke

  2. Sinda

  3. Chisamba

  4. Kapiri Mposhi


Phase 2: Actual Execution

Phase 1 will feed into phase two as the information gathered will help plan for large scale distribution of steripens.  All the distribution requirements will be well understood from phase 1.


Phase 3: Monitoring

This phase will involve continuous monitoring of the distribution to ensure the right target groups benefit and that the devices are in use.

story:
Short Summary

When I was about 12 I took the batteries out of a little electric boat and hooked up a small solar panel.  The boat was able to zoom across the pool just on solar power.  Ever since then I have wanted to make solar boats people could live on.  I have made many models to test out different designs and now have a design that I really believe will work well.

My four boys are old enough now to be the engineers that help turn this dream into reality.

Making it easy and affordable for people to live on the ocean could have a big impact on the world.   Groups could work on projects without having to deal with visa and work permit issues.   Most taxes don't apply to people travelling.     Retired couples could live on the ocean without worry that their property taxes or electricity costs would go up.   These solar boats would not require the skills that sailing does nor the cost that motorboats do.  It could be a whole new lifestyle.

 Please help promote our campaign!  Share it on facebook, like it, etc.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Norella King I am a delegate for Miss Canada Globe Petite 2015!
This event provides young ladies with an opportunity to make their mark in today’s society. The pageant's focus is to assist charities and nonprofit organizations by helping raise funds and create public awareness for their cause. I believe that this national pageant provides woman, such as myself, personal growth, valuable experiences, and a chance to move hearts by becoming ambassadors and role models for causes in the Canadian community.

As an ambassador for Canadian Veterans and a spokesperson for The Canadian Legacy Project, I aim to use the competition platform to create awareness of the very real struggles our Veterans live with every day.

What We Need & What you get!
I am aiming to raise $7500

  • The funds cover flights, accommodations and subsistence, needed apparel, and incidental costs. Delegates in the competition are responsible for raising their own support.

    For every donation received I will post a picture/video of me doing something fun in the pageant wear, whether its handstands, acrobats, or climbing. Suggestions from donators are most welcome (especially if fun!) and I will do my best to accomadate! Click the Facebook link below to follow me on Facebook and find me on Instagram @ellasway. Visit my video gallery

    The Impact

The difference you and I will make together:

  • Having personally worked side by side by our Canadian forces over the past few years, I have seen the spirit and soul behind the uniform and the sacrifices they make in order for us to live as a free nation. One of the biggest struggles amongst our veterans is PTSD. Because of this trauma this can lead to withdrawal and isolation from society, often making holding a job very difficult resulting in quality of life to degrade significantly. One way to help to re-intergrate victims of PTSD into a normal routine is fitness. Fitness not only is great for the body and brain, but for social connection and emotional health and healing. With certain partnerships taking place with gyms and The Canadian Legacy Project, we have been able to get subsidized and affordable gym memberships for our Veterans! With the opportunity I have to participate in Miss Canada Globe 2015 (with your help!), I can gain a bigger platform so more people will hear about what they can do to support our Veterans through ideas like subsidized fitness memberships! Lets turn our remembrance into action. 

Risks & Challenges

Stepping out like this can always be risky. It's vulnerable to throw out an ambitious goal like this and have only 37 days to reach it. But I know there are several of you in  my network who have been wondering if there is a simple way you can support, and here it is! Whether its $5 or $500 it all helps, it all creates momentum! 

  • I am qualified to overcome any challenges that are placed in this path because I will never give up! Especially supporting a cause that is dear to me. Plus as a HUGE bonus I have you guys rooting for me!

Other Ways You Can Help

Can you help in any other way than financial sponsorship? YES!

  • Get the word out and make some noise about my campaign! Share this link on your social media and with your network. 
  • Lets collaborate and have me at your workplace or home for a meet and greet! Bring in people that you know could benefit by partnering with me and my vision! 
  • Have me to speak on the above issue at an event, whether its a school assembly, workplace or private function. I also love to speak on health (physical and mental), women empowerment, and pursuing dreams! 

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
Short Summary
 My name is Norella King I am a delegate for Miss Canada Globe Petite 2015!This event provides young ladies with an opportunity to make their mark in today’s society. The pageant's focus is to assist charities and nonprofit organizations by helping raise funds and create public awareness for their cause. I believe that this national pageant provides woman, such as myself, personal growth, valuable experiences, and a chance to move hearts by becoming ambassadors and role models for causes in the Canadian community.
As an ambassador for Canadian Veterans and a spokesperson for The Canadian Legacy Project, I aim to use the competition platform to create awareness of the very real struggles our Veterans live with every day.
   What We Need & What you get!I am aiming to raise $7500



The funds cover flights, accommodations and subsistence, needed apparel, and incidental costs. Delegates in the competition are responsible for raising their own support.
For every donation received I will post a picture/video of me doing something fun in the pageant wear, whether its handstands, acrobats, or climbing. Suggestions from donators are most welcome (especially if fun!) and I will do my best to accomadate! Click the Facebook link below to follow me on Facebook and find me on Instagram @ellasway. Visit my video gallery
The Impact
    The difference you and I will make together:

Having personally worked side by side by our Canadian forces over the past few years, I have seen the spirit and soul behind the uniform and the sacrifices they make in order for us to live as a free nation. One of the biggest struggles amongst our veterans is PTSD. Because of this trauma this can lead to withdrawal and isolation from society, often making holding a job very difficult resulting in quality of life to degrade significantly. One way to help to re-intergrate victims of PTSD into a normal routine is fitness. Fitness not only is great for the body and brain, but for social connection and emotional health and healing. With certain partnerships taking place with gyms and The Canadian Legacy Project, we have been able to get subsidized and affordable gym memberships for our Veterans! With the opportunity I have to participate in Miss Canada Globe 2015 (with your help!), I can gain a bigger platform so more people will hear about what they can do to support our Veterans through ideas like subsidized fitness memberships! Lets turn our remembrance into action.     Risks & Challenges  Stepping out like this can always be risky. It's vulnerable to throw out an ambitious goal like this and have only 37 days to reach it. But I know there are several of you in  my network who have been wondering if there is a simple way you can support, and here it is! Whether its $5 or $500 it all helps, it all creates momentum!   I am qualified to overcome any challenges that are placed in this path because I will never give up! Especially supporting a cause that is dear to me. Plus as a HUGE bonus I have you guys rooting for me!    Other Ways You Can Help Can you help in any other way than financial sponsorship? YES!  Get the word out and make some noise about my campaign! Share this link on your social media and with your network.  Lets collaborate and have me at your workplace or home for a meet and greet! Bring in people that you know could benefit by partnering with me and my vision! 
Have me to speak on the above issue at an event, whether its a school assembly, workplace or private function. I also love to speak on health (physical and mental), women empowerment, and pursuing dreams!    And that's all there is to it.

story:
Beginning on May 15, 2015, ultrarunner Steph Robinson will run across the United States from west to east, starting in Dillon Beach, CA and ending in Washington D.C. She hopes to average 30 to 40 miles per day on a foot journey of over 3500 miles in total. In light of the recent cuts to government food programs, her goal is to help raise funds for local food pantries across the United States, along with raising awareness of food insecurity. She will visit food pantries/food banks along her journey, and she invites folks to join her for a mile or two (or twenty), running or walking, to hear their stories about their own struggles with food insecurity. Steph will document these stories and personally carry them ON FOOT to Washington D.C., where she plans to share them with both legislative supporters and opponents of federal food assistance programs, such as SNAP. Along her journey, Steph will be raising money for Feeding America, the nationwide umbrella organization that provides assistance to emergency food pantries.

Steph is a long-time volunteer at the food pantry at the Amherst Survival Center, in Amherst, MA, and has been greatly touched by working with the population receiving assistance. Roughly one in six Americans is food insecure, and for children, that rate is one in five - 20%. Steph herself has been in the position of being food-insecure; as a graduate student in the late 1990s working full-time, making minimum wage, she frequently faced the choice between paying bills and buying groceries.  She is well-acquainted with how well government cheese melts!  To read more about Steph's background and the reasons why she's doing this run, you can read her story on her website here.

This run is planned to take approximately 3.5 months, and is a huge expense in and of itself. Steph is entirely self-employed, and doesn't receive any sort of "vacation time" or paid time off. She is looking for help in funding the run. She plans to minimize expenses as much as possible by camping, living out of her car, and eating as cheaply as possible. Money raised here will go to paying for food, camping/cheap motel fees, gas, running shoes (she plans to go through 10-12 pairs!) and basic necessities. Any extra money raised that is not used will be 100% given to Feeding America. If Steph is unable to complete the journey due to injury, the extra money will be donated in this case as well.

story:
What You Get for Going Gopher!

Welcome to our page! Gopher needs you!

So here's the deal:

As you can see, we are starting a full-fledged personal courier service in the greater Saratoga area. Help us make your life easier by contributing to the cause!

Have you ever been sitting at home on a cold friday night, and wanted take-out from your favorite local restaurant, but they don't deliver? Here's where the Gopher takes over! For a small fee, Gopher will go for you!

Now here's the fun part:

Because of your gracious and generous kindness in donations, we have a few generous rewards for you helping us get started!

  • $5 gets you a free delivery!
  • $25 gets you 5 free delivery fees from your pals at Gopher!
  • $50 gets you a free Gopher t-shirt! You gotta love that cute little guy!
  • $75 gets you 10 free delivery fees! We can't thank you enough!
And for our partners, $150 will get you our support in spreading the word about your small business helping you to reach a greater audience! Now that's teamwork!


We Love Your Support!

And that's why we want yo make you as comfortable as possible. At Gopher, we know you're busy and we know that you need time to relax. Donate now and start relaxing. Don't worry about it, just kick your shoes off and we'll do the rest!
We want your life to be as simple as possible. There's enough stress in the world without having to deal with things that you don't have time to do. We want to make your life easier and with your help, that's exactly what we are going to do.


Anything Helps!

Even just by sharing our Facebook, Twitter or IndieGoGo page, you can help us gain a following, we'll even give you a shout out and thanks for your support! Get Gophering!

story:
Vida...what?

VidaMark is an american human advertising network that hires homeless men, women, and veterans to assist in advertising our sponsors through social media. VidaMark employees would wear scan-able articles of clothing that when scanned, rewards the scan-ee with an "Exclusive VidaMark Coupon" from the sponsor of the month. The article of clothing also has the sponsors logo or image on the front, allowing for the possibility of advertising even when simply walking. 

That's it?

Team VidaMark also plans on implementing programs such as "Shelter Helper", which allows homeless shelters across the country to partner with us. Firstly, the said shelter fills out a partnership form (after the site is built). VidaMark then researches the shelter to make sure it is a legitimate homeless organization. Once accepted, VidaMark provides the scan-able T-shirts to the shelter. They can then get supporters and individuals to assist by wearing the shirts around, which when scanned, garners the shelter money to be used for medicine, food, and the basic needs of homeless men, women, and veterans across the country.  

The Impact

VidaMark:

  •  Provides work for a very under-utilized task force; people who are truly in need of it. 
  • Looks to support and partner with homeless shelters and organizations throughout the United States
  • VidaMark's success would allow us (the founders) to do something positive with our lives while also simultaneosly changing the lives of others.  Maybe one day, around the world. 

$20,000 for WHAT!?

  Our goal of $20,000 helps us 
  • Acquire office space
  • Create a website
  • Hire our first employee(s)
  • Market in the media
  • Preparation Costs (business cards/T-shirts/operation)

What You Get

  • Oh, our perks are the BEST! You could end up on our PERMANENT contributor hall of fame, get a Thank You card written and signed by team VidaMark, and/or receive a personal "Thank You" video from the team through email.
  • However, by the chance our campaign does NOT succeed, the funds raised would be used for securing our first employee and marketing only.

Risks & Challenges

Unfortunately, the word "homeless" has a negative connotation. This is our biggest challenge in growing VidaMark


Other Ways You Can Help

There are more ways to help without donating and contributing. Get the word out. Shout and make some noise about our campaign. Use the indiegogo share tools to help.


Featured and Published 

On over 260+ TV, newspaper, websites, radio stations including

story:
Riding Beyond Taking Root, Growing

Amazing things happened for all of us last year at Riding Beyond -- life-changing interactions for breast cancer survivors, their friends and family, as well as our volunteers and visiting health care professionals.  Our video gives you a taste of that, and there's more at our website ridingbeyond.org and our Facebook page. 

Over 60 people participated directly in either our individual sessions or our all-day group sessions. The three horses who participated demonstrated remarkable talents for interacting in precise, intelligent, compassionate, and wise ways, way beyond our expectations.  

National audiences are interested: Riding Beyond was shared with equine professionals through presentations at three national conferences. American Breast Cancer Society did a feature on us, as did the public television show Immense Possibilities.  We were regularly featured on local tv and radio and in the newspapers. 

Now we enter our second year, growing a firm foundation as the seeds we planted last year take root. After this year, we will qualify to apply for larger foundation funding. Your support will help us grow the program toward that goal to serve more women. We have three all day events scheduled, and we have a second horse joining the team to expand our offerings: golden-haired Gabe. 

Your gift, whether small or large, makes Riding Beyond possible, since we offer sessions free to breast cancer survivors. It is greatly appreciated and makes a difference, a world of difference to these women, as they testify. 

Read more information about Riding Beyond at our last year's campaign with Indiegogo. 

Just A Few Cups of Coffee

For the cost of a fine cup of coffee once a month for the next year, your fifty dollars can make a world of difference to a woman recovering from breast cancer treatment.

What We Need & What You Get

Your tax deductible gift, whether it’s $5 or more, can help grow the foundation that Riding Beyond began last year.  Regardless of your ability to give money, your best gift to Riding Beyond is for you to share our campaign far and wide: to breast cancer survivors, their friends and families, and to people who are horse enthusiasts. 

Our budget of $28,000 this year reflects two changes to last year’s budget of $29,000: On the one hand, we need less for equipment as most of those costs were handled last year. Those savings, however, are offset by increased expenses for printing and informing the public about our program as well as adding a second horse to expand the program. 

We ask you to anchor an $8,000 cornerstone for this year's work with your tax deductible gift. 

We anticipate four individual sessions of Riding Beyond June through September and three all day sessions serving a total of 75 women for this year. Plus we plan to offer more training sessions to health care professionals, as we did for 16 nursing students at Oregon Health Sciences University in fall of 2014. 

Walk, trot, canter, gallop your way into our Riding Beyond world with your gift! Our perks are listed right, but the main benefit is knowing that you are contributing to the well-being of women recovering from breast cancer treatment, and that our work is having far-reaching benefits beyond our local community into the future for yourself or a loved one who has taken the breast cancer journey. 

The Impact

Most of the women who have gone through radiation and chemotherapy treatment have ongoing issues to deal with, like these:

  • They need physical and emotional revitalization. 
  • Vital functions have been impaired, like digestion, respiration (shallow breathing) and rapid heart rate.
  • Self image is impacted by surgery and chemotherapy and radiation treatment. 
  • Tactile defensiveness: not enjoying touch or being touched. 
  • A need to reconnect to her body and to others. 
  • Physical weakness. 
Our website and videos attest to the power of working with horses for attending to these issues. 

Importance of Friends, Family & Health Care Professionals

We've discovered that these very issues make it extremely challenging for breast cancer survivors to reach out for help once they have finished treatment, much less to have a ready understanding of how a horse and a circle of women can make a significant difference.  We have expanded the scope of our Riding Beyond's reach by including frequent opportunities for health care professionals to have training and individual sessions with Riding Beyond so that they can encourage patients appropriately. 
Women who attended in 2014 invariably said that they had heard of the program but would not have actually signed up without the encouragement of friends and family. So, we make efforts to inform the broader population of the importance of their role in a friend or family member's journey. We are pioneering increased public awareness around these issues, here in the US and through international channels of the therapeutic riding industry. 

Dedicating Riding Beyond

Last year there were synchronicities and wonders at the Sundance where we dedicated Riding Beyond for 2014, among the wild horses of the American Horse Wild Horse Sanctuary. This year's season was dedicated at the Healing with Horse Festival and Symposium in Littleton, CO, at Zuma Horse Rescue Ranch, in mid May, 2015, where equine professionals were inspired with the possibilities that Riding Beyond offers for their own healing work with horses. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Just about everybody knows someone who has been challenged with breast cancer.  Please share this campaign with them, their friends and families, so that they can help us bring this beneficial program to more women. 

Know someone who loves horses?  Share the campaign with them and maybe they will see new possibilities for a horse that's in their lives. 

It's easy when you use the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
When All was Dark and Gloomy

Imagine a place with 49, 043, 595 youngsters. What comes to mind? Ground-breaking energy, earth-shattering power, norm-challenging ideas, paradigm-shifting concepts and above all, laughter, life and colours.

What if we tell you that such a place exists but the young people there are downtrodden, depressed, hopeless and scared, very scared; for their lives, their prosperity and their future. For, they feel directionless, misguided and alone.

Pakistan is an enigma to many and a tragedy to some. With inflation, illiteracy and terrorism constantly on the rise, this country still strives on.

  • Today, Pakistan ranks the 2nd on the global ranking for out-of-school children
  • As many as 58.7 million people in Pakistan live below the poverty line
  • Despite the dearth of opportunities and resources, Pakistan ranks number 4 worldwide in terms of Intelligence

Compare these statistics and you get a nation with unfathomable resilience and characteristics. These numbers call out for some action; but who would take the first step? We did.

The Silver Lining

We dreamed of creating a physical space which would serve as a beacon of hope for all the misguided youngsters to deal with the dearth of recreational avenues. The absence of community centers and youth facilities has led to young people deviating towards harmful activities including drugs, violence and gangs.

Unfortunately, most of us remain only big words with no actions – we decided to break the shackles and despite all warnings, ventured on a path completely uncharted – to create a facility for the youngsters of Karachi which provides them with a secure environment along with many domains to polish and enhance their educational, economic, talent, and social aspirations.

Being a pioneer youth centre, we went through a trial and error process for we had to set our own norms and benchmarks.

What we do

KYSN is a youth focused training/capacity building and opportunity sharing center for the youth of Karachi.  Overwhelming? That’s how we felt too when we realized the magnitude of potential and talent our youngsters possessed but could not utilize. We organize a wide-spectrum of events, trainings, workshops and seminars. Customized capacity building sessions, interactive meet-and-greets, inspiring success-stories showcases and engaging job fairs, education fairs and bazaars are just the first step towards transforming the lives of these youngsters. KYSN also provides space for new ventures to launch themselves.



What we need


Why do we need this money?

Sustaining KYSN for 6 months would mean:

  • Organizing events, sessions and trainings on a larger scale and with more frequency in order to benefit more youngsters
  • Incubating youth start-ups and providing business guidance
  • Increasing outreach and engaging a larger percentage of Karachi’s youth
  • Utilizing our database of opportunities to connect young people with relevant jobs, scholarships, educational avenues, talent utilization platforms and enhancing social responsibility & civic sense
  • Bringing young individuals from diverse backgrounds under one roof to exchange ideas, develop solutions and learn tolerance & acceptance

Our Success Stories:

Akifa Ahmed

I live in Korangi where women are not “supposed to” be out and about much. I used to get restless when surrounded by massive heaps of garbage all around my area. But hey, what can a girl do right? Wrong.

With the guidance of Karachi Youth Support Network (KYSN), I was able to start a cleaning project within my community. Taking the initiative was not easy mainly because of the stereotypical thought processes that prevail in our society. But seeing my persistence and dedication towards the cause, slowly and gradually a lot of people started to join me in my venture. I am currently working as an Ambassador for KYSN and I organize various trainings and workshops in my community with their assistance. KYSN has played a vital role in instilling positivity in me and developing leadership qualities in me.

Abdul Azeem Khatri

My life has been nothing short of challenging after I met with an accident which left me wheelchair bound. Lack of resources forced me to drop out of college and give up everything I once held dear. It was natural that I went into deep depression and became totally clueless about what to do with my life. I still remember the first time I went to KYSN, the thing that impressed me the most was the normality with which their entire team treated me. There were no side glances or sympathetic looks. I registered myself as a member that day only and became a regular visitor of KYSN. One of their team members mentored me one-on-one and encouraged me to do something substantial with my life. That’s when I decided to get out of my shell and talk to people around me. I started giving motivational speeches to people in my area. I also enrolled for private education.

The impact resonated from me and touched my family too as my mother set up a food stall at KYSN’s regular event, Bazaar.

For me, KYSN has been literally a ray of hope. The self confidence and acceptance which it instilled in me has renewed my will to fully live my life. My faith in my abilities was further restored when I was connected to a job opportunity by KYSN. 12 KYSN members were selected along with me to avail this opportunity and to give us our best chance, we were all given training by KYSN on how to ace interviews. Who does this much for you? Very few organizations.

Every dollar you contribute will go a long way towards transforming the life of a young individual and creating more success stories.

Beyond money— we need your help spreading the word

At its heart, KYSN is a grassroots movement driven by youngsters and civil society who want to transform the future of the youth. Whether you donate to our campaign or not, you can still help make history.

Ways you can help:

  • Share this video and campaign
  • Spread the word about the #SustainKYSN movement on Facebook, Instagram or Twitter
  • Recruit a local group to spread the word and gather contributions
  • Volunteer your time and expertise for KYSN
  • Stay connected. Follow KYSN on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram to stay up-to-date on Sustain KYSN movement
story_txt:
When All was Dark and Gloomy
Imagine a place with 49, 043, 595 youngsters. What comes to
mind? Ground-breaking energy, earth-shattering power, norm-challenging ideas, paradigm-shifting
concepts and above all, laughter, life and colours. 
What if we tell you that such a place exists but the young
people there are downtrodden, depressed, hopeless and scared, very scared; for
their lives, their prosperity and their future. For, they feel directionless,
misguided and alone. 
Pakistan is an enigma to many and
a tragedy to some. With inflation, illiteracy and terrorism constantly on the
rise, this country still strives on. 



Today,
Pakistan ranks the 2nd on the global ranking for out-of-school
children

As many
as 58.7 million people in Pakistan live below the poverty line
Despite
the dearth of opportunities and resources, Pakistan ranks number 4 worldwide in
terms of Intelligence
Compare these statistics and you get a nation with unfathomable
resilience and characteristics. These numbers call out for some action; but who
would take the first step? We did.
   
The Silver Lining
We dreamed of creating a physical space which
would serve as a beacon of hope for all the misguided youngsters to deal with
the dearth of recreational
avenues. The absence of community centers and youth facilities has led to young
people deviating towards harmful activities including drugs, violence and gangs. 
Unfortunately, most of us remain only big words with no actions – we
decided to break the shackles and despite all warnings,
ventured on a path completely uncharted – to create a facility for the
youngsters of Karachi which provides them with a secure environment along with
many domains to polish and enhance their educational, economic, talent, and
social aspirations.
Being a pioneer youth centre, we went through a trial and error process
for we had to set our own norms and benchmarks.

What we do
KYSN is a youth focused training/capacity building and opportunity sharing center for the youth of Karachi.  Overwhelming? That’s how we felt too when we realized the magnitude of potential and talent our youngsters possessed but could not utilize. We organize a wide-spectrum of events, trainings, workshops and seminars. Customized capacity building sessions, interactive meet-and-greets, inspiring success-stories showcases and engaging job fairs, education fairs and bazaars are just the first step towards transforming the lives of these youngsters. KYSN also provides space for new ventures to launch themselves.






What we need

Why do we need this money?
Sustaining KYSN for 6 months would mean:
Organizing events, sessions and trainings on a
larger scale and with more frequency in order to benefit more youngstersIncubating youth start-ups and providing business
guidanceIncreasing outreach and engaging a larger percentage
of Karachi’s youthUtilizing our database of opportunities to connect
young people with relevant jobs, scholarships, educational avenues, talent
utilization platforms and enhancing social responsibility & civic senseBringing young individuals from diverse backgrounds
under one roof to exchange ideas, develop solutions and learn tolerance &
acceptance
Our Success Stories:
Akifa Ahmed
I live in Korangi where women are not “supposed to” be out and about
much. I used to get restless when surrounded by massive heaps of garbage all
around my area. But hey, what can a girl do right? Wrong. 
With the guidance of Karachi Youth Support Network (KYSN), I was able to
start a cleaning project within my community. Taking the initiative was not
easy mainly because of the stereotypical thought processes that prevail in our
society. But seeing my persistence and dedication towards the cause, slowly and
gradually a lot of people started to join me in my venture. I am currently
working as an Ambassador for KYSN and I organize various trainings and
workshops in my community with their assistance. KYSN has played a vital role
in instilling positivity in me and developing leadership qualities in me.
Abdul Azeem Khatri
My life has been nothing short of challenging after I met
with an accident which left me wheelchair bound. Lack of resources forced me to
drop out of college and give up everything I once held dear. It was natural
that I went into deep depression and became totally clueless about what to do
with my life. I still remember the first time I went to KYSN, the thing that
impressed me the most was the normality with which their entire team treated
me. There were no side glances or sympathetic looks. I registered myself as a
member that day only and became a regular visitor of KYSN. One of their team
members mentored me one-on-one and encouraged me to do something substantial
with my life. That’s when I decided to get out of my shell and talk to people
around me. I started giving motivational speeches to people in my area. I also
enrolled for private education. 
The impact resonated from me and touched my family too as my
mother set up a food stall at KYSN’s regular event, Bazaar. 
For me, KYSN has been literally a ray of hope. The self
confidence and acceptance which it instilled in me has renewed my will to fully
live my life. My faith in my abilities was further restored when I was
connected to a job opportunity by KYSN. 12 KYSN members were selected along
with me to avail this opportunity and to give us our best chance, we were all
given training by KYSN on how to ace interviews. Who does this much for you?
Very few organizations.
Every dollar you contribute will go a long way towards
transforming the life of a young individual and creating more success stories.
Beyond money— we need your help spreading the word
At its heart, KYSN is a grassroots movement driven by youngsters and
civil society who want to transform the future of the youth. Whether you donate
to our campaign or not, you can still help make history. 
Ways you can help:


Share this video and campaign


Spread the word about the #SustainKYSN movement on
Facebook, Instagram or Twitter


Recruit a local group to spread the word and gather
contributions

Volunteer your time and expertise for KYSN

Stay connected. Follow KYSN on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram to stay up-to-date on Sustain KYSN movement

story:
Hi there my name is Sam

I am an individual the same as everyone else but one with a dream.  My dream is to come up with a new item that everyone could use. I have had this dream since i was a child. Even as a child I would look at things and see the improvements that could be done to any item. I would ask why do they not just do it like this instead of this. That question has stuck with me my whole life. Now I am making this dream come true. 
This campaign is to make an ordinary everyday item better to use and easier to use at the same time. Who knew just adding a clip to something could greatly improve it. Think about it your pocket knife what holds it on to your pocket, a clip and to think back in the day you had to have a leather case to hold it on to a belt. Lets take the ink pen for example as well, what holds the ink pen to your shirt pocket at work a clip. So with that being said why not add a clip to the lighter so it can to clip to your pockets. Think about it if your a smoker and you are in need of your lighter but your pocket has money and change in it, you got to dig around in that pocket of yours and risking not just pulling out your lighter but your money as well. The money in your pocket has now fallen to the ground and you did not notice it so now you just lost 20 bucks. If only you had a clip to that lighter you could of just pulled it out from the clipped position of your pants pocket. No digging around dodging your money, change or any other items that may be in your way to retrieving your lighter. Not just smokers though campers, candle lovers, fire place owners, and the list goes on. Everyone has a need of fire. 
Now imagine the impact of this product this new item being out there for the world to see, to use, to hold in their hands, and knowing we worked together to make this happen. This will change the way you see a lighter and its not one of those external lighter holders that extend and dangle and the cord is always to short. That thing you can loose than what you are out o few bucks but with this each one you buy has the clip on it ready to go. Ask your self do you buy an ink pen with out a clip. That is how i want this to be, I want it to be like that and as long as we work together on this one it can be just like that. I know when i buy pens i do not buy one with out the clip on it so I can have it at the ready. I use a pen on a very constant level as well as a lighter and I am sick of digging in my pocket to dig that thing out. I personally have lost money due to pulling my lighter out of my pocket, and my money fell out and boom there it goes. I did not even know it till it was to late and i went to pay for something and realized it was gone when I put my hands in my pocket to get it. I can tell you i was pretty mad at that point. So this great improvement to an item we all know and use is not only to make it easy like the ink pen or knife but it can save you as it could have saved me the trouble of loosing things like money. Lets do it lets turn the page to the way we see lighters lets make it happen together lets change the world. Well the world of lighters.
OK we have covered what this item is, what it can do, and how it is very useful. Now lets go over the funding. To get this started it is going to take 15,000 dollars. The money will be given to a company who has already been in the process of developing this new product The lighter Clip. Now after they get their money they will begin promoting and marketing this new item. I personally can not market it my self like how it needs to be done but that is why i have this company helping me out. World Patent Marketing is the name of this company. A very good and helpful place if you ever have a great idea. During this journey i have been on with them so far they have done a market study on this item and they score it between 1 and 79. Now 1 being the lowest and 79 being highest. This product The Lighter Clip scored at a 72 now that is awesome. Very excited about it. It is marketable and very much worth proceeding further. And now here i am asking for you all to join me in this venture. Now if for some reason we do not make the full amount that is ok no problem i will still give what I got to this company to still keep this ball rolling. Now for everyone who chooses to donate to this venture and join in on changing the way we see lighters you will be paid back and than some. Lets say you put in a dollar you will get back 3 dollars or lets say 5 you get back 10 and so on. lets say you put in the full amount I will triple what you put in add it up. Now WHO IS WITH ME CAN WE DO IT CAN WE MAKE IT. LETS CHANGE THE OLD AND BRING IN THE NEW. 
This new Lighter is not just a new product but a symbol that an average person like my self who has a family. That dreams can come true that there is a pot of gold at the end of a rainbow and we can share that pot. What I mean is for whom ever gets in with this average family man will earn back. It will be paid forward like i said for a dollar you will get 3 for 5 you will get 10 and so on but if you give the full amount I will triple it. To see this come to life would be a dream come true just we got to work together to make it happen. This product already has a record of success through the research put into it like that score of 72 out of 79 and that there is nothing else out there like it. Till we put it out there.
The main challenge is just ahead and that challenge is time lets say we make it to the amount needed then its just time that is required for the marketing and promoting to take affect. With that companies help it will get done they have all the resources needed to accomplish this goal. They have to put in the work as well traveling and talking to all the companies to promote and market it. Time is on our side i am patient and that is key patients. I have made it past the first of the obstacles. Now just time to finish the race.

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

We Can Do It Lets Rise up and Win

story:
Who We Are and Our Place in the Community

We are small group of residents of the Beach and surrounding area with a passion for community and local food. Our goal is to create a small communal garden in Ashbridges Bay called the Beach Community Edible Garden, in an effort to cultivate community in the Beaches through growing organic food locally. The project will welcome the Beaches and surrounding area citizens to participate in community gardening that will be interlocked specifically with the Beaches Rec Centre and the Glen Rhodes United Church Food Bank. The large majority of our food grown will go towards the food bank. With the Beaches Rec Centre, the children at the culinary camp will help grow the food in their space in the garden and then will get to eat it in meals they help to cook. 

  

The project involves members of Friends of the Beach Parks - a community group that has successfully initiated a very popular community fire pit in Kew Gardens Park, helped maintain this years Winter Stations and hosted several different events in the Beach, including three annual pumpkin walks. The project is also supported by the David Suzuki Homegrown National Park Project.

Through donating funds towards the Beach Edible Community Garden you will be contributing to cultivation of community, increased access to fresh and local organic food, an education site for all, a habitat for bees and butterflies, and of course healthy living and happiness. 

What We Need to Get Going

      

This project remains a dream without concrete funding. The funds contributed towards the garden will be used to obtain good quality and lasting items from the following list:

  • Garden tools and supplies
  • Plant Materials
  • Soil and Compost
  • Project Supplies for 4 cedar raised beds, a 3 bin composting system, and a wood shed
  • Promotional Materials 

Our Site
This is currently the site we have been assigned for the garden. It has consistent sun exposure, water access, and the Ashbridges Parking Lot is located very close by.


Currently lightly used as a picnic site, our goal for 2015 is to have this grassy area filled with veggies, and beautiful pollinator plants by way of raised beds. Our vision is to also have this lesser used area of the Beach functioning as a hub for people to come and learn together through urban agriculture.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please kindly share this campaign to family and friends or on social media sites. Our target build and plant date is the weekend of May 30th. 

We have a wish list of items needed for the garden to function properly. Here it is, if you think you may be able to donate something, let us know!

Wish list includes: Garden forks, spades, rakes, trowels, gloves, wheelbarrow, lock and key, hose (100'), easy hose (50'), hose bracket for hanging, hose sprayer, watering cans, sunscreen and safety supplies, plant tags, plants and seeds, myke, twine, compost, peat Moss, premium garden blend, wood (cedar) for raised beds/compost bins/shed,  weeping tile, plastic sheeting, landscape fabric, quarter inch mesh for lining compost, stones for levelling shed, logs, stepping stones and bricks.

Please email us at "beachcommunityediblegarden@gmail.com" if you have items to donate, have any questions or would like to get involved with the garden in the future. :)

story:
Do you like coconuts but don’t know how to open one? Cococrack  is the clever solution for opening a coconut easily, quickly and hygienically.

Have you ever tried to open a mature coconut in weird ways?  You have probably used a hammer, a saw, a screwdriver or maybe you threw it on the ground or hit it against the wall…  Well, this is all very dangerous, hard and unhygienic!

Cococrack is the innovative solution that allows you to enjoy  a delicious piece of coconut quickly, without any effort, and without hurting yourself.

Cococrack is made in Italy! This product has been designed to be efficient and effective and, at the same time, to show the best in Italian design. It is ergonomic and create using the best techniques and high quality materials. Cococrack is also easy to wash and keep clean. It's available in three colors: yellow, green and orange.

 

Cococrack is actually two kitchen tools, specifically designed to open the hardest fruit in the world!

Cococrack opener breaks the coconut shell. It’s really easy to use: you just have to insert the Cococrack’s  point in the soft eye of the coconut, that is the softest of the three eyes that you find on the top of the coconut, and then you screw it in like a corkscrew. This surprisingly simple operation easily breaks the coconut shell, lets you drain the coconut water and gets you in to the delicious coconut pulp.

Cococrack cutter is the second tool of the Cococrack set. You need it to easily cut the shell in smaller portions and then romoving the pulp from the shell is incredibly easy. So, in a few simple steps you can open the coconut and share the pleasure of eating a fresh slice of coconut with family and friends.

Before now, when you had to open a mature coconut, you had to use your imagination to get it open! Let’s have a look at the most common methods compared to Cococrack.





Who I am

I am an Italian entrepreneur and since I was young I have had the passion for innovative and simple inventions that can help people to deal with all the little difficulties everyday life imposes.  It has been because of my friends’ and relatives’ enthusiasm which pushed me to produce my Cococrack. They have been the first to try it and they really appreciated its practicality. They gave me the confidence I needed to keep on developing Cococrack.

How I got the idea

I got the idea to creating these two simple kitchen utensils on a hot summer night while I was struggling to open a coconut to offer to my friends. I remember I wanted to end dinner by sharing the pleasure of tasting a good and fresh slice of coconut, but I had trouble trying to open it; I was sweating heavily! So, I started to think about a way to avoid such a hard effort. At that moment I realized I had to exploit the weak point of the coconut: the softer eye. It took me only a few minutes and I came up with this great invention: a tool that everybody can use to open a ripe coconut in a few little gestures, effortless and in a hygienic and safe way.

Current stage of the project

In the last couple of months I managed the different aspects of the production. I worked on the design and searched for the best productive technology and the specific materials in order to guarantee a product easy to wash, reliable and cheap.

   

Then I worked on the logo and the launch of the product. Finally, I created specific marketing tools to communicate the product features most effectively. The final development is the mock-up which includes a lot of different prototypes, both in metal, aluminum and steel, and different types of plastics. The final product will be made of plastic suitable for food use with stainless steel for the point of the screw and the blade of the cutter. There will be three different colors to choose from: yellow, green and orange. If your favorite one is not on the list, you can help me to improve my offer by pointing it out on the blog.

Cococrack is a registered trademark and the idea is protected by patents for industrial invention and for industrial design.

Why spend your money for this project

Your sponsorship will be used to start the Cococrack set production and to cover the expenses needed for effective marketing. The most relevant expenses to start to market the Cococrack are related to molds and to web marketing activities. Through this campaign I hope to collect opinions and suggestions useful to improve this product, and to capture the interests of importers and distributors in all the countries where coconuts are consumed. 

Other ways you can help

If you like this project and you think that Cococrack is a good idea, please help me to spread the word! I would really appreciate if you share this idea to your friends on Facebook, you tell them about the Cococrack project or show them the video on Youtube! Thank you very much for your support!

product easy to wash, reliable and cheap.   
Then I worked on the logo and the launch of the
product. Finally, I created specific marketing tools to communicate the product
features most effectively. The final development is the mock-up which includes
a lot of different prototypes, both in metal, aluminum and steel, and different
types of plastics. The final product will be made of plastic suitable for food
use with stainless steel for the point of the screw and the blade of the cutter.
There will be three different colors to choose from: yellow, green and orange.
If your favorite one is not on the list, you can help me to improve my offer by
pointing it out on the blog.
Cococrack is a registered trademark and the idea is
protected by patents for industrial invention and for industrial design. 
Why spend your money for this project

Your sponsorship will be used
to start the Cococrack set production and to cover the expenses needed for effective
marketing. The most relevant
expenses to start to market the Cococrack are related to molds and to web marketing
activities.
Through this campaign I hope to collect opinions and suggestions
useful to improve this product, and to capture the interests of importers and
distributors in all the countries where coconuts are consumed. 
Other ways you can help
If you like
this project and you think that Cococrack is a good idea, please help me to
spread the word! I would really appreciate if you share this idea to your
friends on Facebook, you tell them about the Cococrack project or show them the video
on Youtube! Thank you very much for your support!

story:
Who are we?

“Promoting vitality and health through a loving connection to nature.”


Herb Haven is the beautiful land, medicinal herb garden and apothecary stewarded by Herbalist Suki Roth with the assistance of apprentices, interns and community members in the seat of the Haw River. There are over 100 medicinal plants in cultivation on this land. Here we are passionate about helping people incorporate herbal medicine into their daily lives and supporting people in growing their own medicine.

Suki Roth has over 20 years of experience cultivating medicinal plants in the NC piedmont and continues to enjoy sharing her love for the plants through classes, workshops, and growing medicinal plants for Herb Haven. She is a mother, a grandmother, a sister, a friend, a mentor, a healer, a counselor, an artist, a creator, and a community member deeply rooted in this place.

There has been a growing interest in medicinal plants and herbal medicine products in this area. Herb Haven offers not only raw medicinal herbs or finished herbal medicine products, but also a unique space to experience the full spectrum of herbal medicine making—from seed to bottle, plant to tea cup.


What are we doing?

We have 1 main goal - to make more medicine from plants on our land. Reaching this goal will be accomplished through two means - ensuring access to more water and creating more drying space for herbs.

Increasing our access to water through a rainwater catchment system will increase the space for cultivation at Herb Haven and will increase the amount of herbal products we can sell every season. There are many dried bulk herbs that we routinely run out of and must order from other growers in the winter because there wasn’t enough room to grow and preserve them during the growing season. 
Herb Haven has ample space to expand plant cultivation, but the limiting factors are access to water and space to dry the raw plants efficiently. 

We plan to set up a water catchment system to collect rainwater off the roof of the shed to irrigate the current farm and allow expansion of cultivation to a larger area—to lessen our dependence on a single well and increase the quantity of plants we can grow. We will also be doubling our drying space by adding onto an existing small herb drying facility.

Water Catchment

Since Suki's very first vision of what this garden could be it has grown beyond our expectations. An increased demand for Suki's Blends means we need to harvest a higher quantity of plants in our garden. Currently, we water from a private well, thus making the need for a water catchment system imperative to future sustainability of Herb Haven as we continue to meet the demands of our community.

We anticipate the water catchment system serving as an example of sustainable agriculture for the approximately 1,000 people that set foot on Herb Haven’s land in the course of a growing season. Ultimately, we want to give people a holistic experience to deepen their connection with this ecosystem and the plants that can sustain us physically, mentally, and emotionally.

Dryer

The quality of the herbal products that we cultivate, harvest, and dry for storage at Herb Haven is unique. The smell, flavor, and potency reflect the special love we put in and our slow-paced learning and teaching style as well as the individual attention we give each plant.  

An addition to our current herb dryer is necessary so that we can harvest and dry as much of our own herbs grown on the land as possible. Right now we have more herbs on the land than we can dry based on both the capacity of our current dryer and the amount of herbs we need to dry.
 

The water catchment system and dryer will contribute to an overarching goal of making Herb Haven more ecologically and financially sustainable.

The process

Water Catchment System

  • replace the roof shingles with tin

  • add gutters

  • set up the filtration and collection systems for the water catchment system (one on each corner of the house for 4 total)

  • each water tote collects approx. 275-325 gallons of water

  • connect solar pump that will allow ease of water distribution

  • install irrigation lines

We estimate that the total of  approximately 1,200 gallons of water should serve our irrigation needs for one growing season.


Herb Dryer

  • frame out dryer

  • install heater

  • dry herbs!


Where your money will help


Water Catchment System

Roof materials: $2, 000

Gutters: $200

Cisterns: $600

Catchment fittings: $100

Solar water pump: $800

Irrigation: $300

Labor: $4, 700


Herb Dryer

Wood and screens: $800

Heater: $200

Labor: $300


THANK YOU

We couldn't do this without you! We are excited to share some herbal gifts with you in gratitude for your support. Also, you're always welcome to come visit us in the garden!


FAQ

What is a water catchment system?

Read more here: http://www.arcsa.org/?page=195


What are the environmental benefits of water catchment?

https://www.bluebarrelsystems.com/why-harvest-rainwater/steward-the-environment/


Why do you need dry herbs instead of using them fresh?

Using dried herbs means that you can prolong their use. In the case of Herb Haven, it means using more of the herbs grown on the property.


How long does it take dry the herbs? What would happen if you didn’t have a dryer to dry them?

In the dryer herbs take anywhere from 10 - 48 hours depending on the water content in a given plant. With limited dryer space we have to place the plants outside on screens and run a high risk of introducing mold to the plants -  Y’all know what NC humidity is like!! To maintain the quality of the herbs, it’s vital to pick and dry them in the correct season.


Our volume of plants we are using for medicine continues to increase. For example, in the last 6 months, we went through 12.5 lbs. of Nettles for Detox Chai Tea and 8.5 lbs. of Yarrow for Cold and Flu Tea. We are growing fast and eager to continue to best serve the community!


What else happens at Herb Haven?

Please check us out on the web at www.herbhaven.com
Special thanks to Chelsea for doing the video work!

story:
Dear all, 
This is to help all those in Nepal who have been traumatized by recent earthquakes. Your support can go a long way in helping them emotionally, financially, and physically. 

Situation Analysis

  • More than a couple thousand Nepalese have been reported dead after a disastrous 7.9 magnitude earthquake hit Nepal on 25th April 
  • Nepal's deputy Prime Minister Bamdev Gautam has declared a state of emergency (source: The Guardian)
  • Indian Prime Minister has dispatched relief and medical teams to affected areas in Nepal 
  • A massive quake of magnitude 6.7, deemed an aftershock, hit the area again on 26th April; meteorological departments suspect that the underground activities are not stable yet

Call for Help - Our Promise

We understand that you might be unwilling to donate if you are unsure about your contribution reaching responsible hands; however, we assure you that every bit of your contributions will be directed to American Red Cross. (Employer Identification Number: 53-0196605)
Your generous donations are sure be used for a moral cause. If made possible, we would ask the concerned authorities to send you a receipt individually . 
Visit the link to get updates regarding the relief process by American Red Cross. 

Other Ways To Contribute

  • Uday Foundation is working with local organizations to ensure the urgent distribution of medical supplies. Click here to know more. (NDTV)
  • Global Giving - Nepal Earthquake Relief Fund.
  • List of charities and relief organizations recommended by The New York Times and CNN.

Even the smallest contribution counts. Thanks for all the support. Stay safe!

Respect & love,
