story:
About Microwave Meals Cookbook

Providing food education through cooking.

How do you create well-balanced meals with limited time, money, and access to food? At VittleWise, we focus on providing food education and access for those who want to learn how to cook but are limited. We work specifically with those who live in a transitional living period of becoming more self-reliant. Whether transitioning off the streets, out of prison, or from a dorm room, we all need help in learning how to cook healthy meals. 

Our focus is on SROs

Single room occupancy (SRO) units are low-income housing units that are government subsidized for people who struggle with homelessness and poverty. 

Residents of SROs only have a microwave for cooking a donated supply of mostly canned goods from local food banks. With limited cooking knowledge and limited resources, many struggle with malnutrition and much food becomes wasted.

Our solution to help prevent these issues is with the Microwave Meals Cookbook. We researched the commonly donated food items to make 21 meals using a microwave. We are looking to distribute these cookbooks and provide training for residents in SROs.

Microwave Meals educates and informs people how to use cheap, accessible ingredients to create well-balanced meals. Just check out the videos below to see how easy it is to create these meals. 


There are roughly 6,000 SRO units left in Chicago. We want to give each person who lives in these units an easier way to cook healthier meals.

What We Need

Here are what your donations go towards:

  • Goal 1: Print & distribute 6,000 cookbooks to each SRO unit in Chicago.
  • Goal 2: Provide training for cooking and preparing meals in SRO facilities. 


What You Get

  • Each person that donates will receive a complimentary digital copy of the Microwave Meals cookbook. (view preview sample)
  • You will also find a list of perks on the right-hand side of this page for how you will be recognized for your efforts. 

The Impact

  • This cookbook has fun recipes and food trivia to make cooking food more enjoyable.
  • This cookbook incorporates a wide variety of donated food groups for a well-rounded diet.
  • This cookbook can create community engagement among other SRO residents.
  • This cookbook provides educational and nutritional information to increase food education. 

We have already distributed more than 100 copies throughout Chicago with a growing need that reaches beyond our initial 6,000 goal. 

The Microwave Meals Cookbook is designed to make cooking easier among families and individuals who live in low-income housing. This cookbook educates and provides recipes that help a person begin to make healthier decisions about food.

Who Could Benefit From This Book?

  • Single Parents
  • SRO (single room occupancy) units
  • Assisted Living Facilities
  • Transitional Living Programs
  • School Lunch Menus
  • Child Welfare Programs
  • Recovery Houses
  • Micro Apartments
  • College Students
  • Food Pantries
  • Soup Kitchens
  • Donation Centers
  • SNAP/LINK/WIC members

Anyone who loves to cook can benefit from this cookbook. Below are some of the words that recipients had to say about this cookbook.

  • "This cookbook is essential for me to eat healthier on my small budget every month." -Sara, SRO resident 
  • "A life saver! I couldn't believe the amount of healthy meals I could create in a microwave." - Cynthia, SRO resident
  • "This cookbook is a survival guide for any family that needs help eating healthy food on a limited budget." -Shayne, Single Parent
  • "I am so thankful that this cookbook exists. I never thought I would be eating this healthy on basically no money." -Brenda, student


Risks & Challenges

A moratorium was created in August to preserve the remaining 6,000 SRO units left in Chicago. This moratorium placed a six month halt on the redevelopment of SRO units being turned into upscale "micro-apartments" or commercial spaces. The moratorium ended at the end of February and developers now have the right to evict residents living in SROs before redevelopment begins.

We want to provide this resource for residents as they relocate from one low-income housing unit to another. Research shows that people living in low-income areas throughout Chicago tend to have unhealthier eating habits due to food deserts or lack of access to proper nutrition. 

At VittleWise, we want to eliminate food insecurity by providing the resources necessary to help people eat healthier regardless of their present limitations. 


About VittleWise


At VittleWise, our mission is to empower people with food with each new program we develop. These programs put our values into action by providing food security through access and education. We believe that initiating subsidized CSA (Community Supported Agriculture) memberships can provide fresh produce to limited-income families living in food deserts. Simultaneously, we work to support the Chicago community by providing educational materials on how to eat healthy regardless of limitations.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are in the Chicago-area and would like to get involved, please contact Jessica Lee at jessica@vittlewise.com

story:
Crisis Center North

In 1978, thirteen women, joined forces with volunteers from the northern communities of Pittsburgh and coordinated their time, effort, and resources to establish the North Hills Women’s Center (NHWC).  NHWC developed a specialized program of intervention, support, and educational services.  In November of 1982, NHWC changed its name to Crisis Center North and became incorporated.

Today, Crisis Center North is a nonprofit counseling and educational resource center which serves victims of domestic violence, their children, and teens involved in violent dating relationships. CCN provides services to individuals regardless of race, age, gender, disability, economic status, or sexual orientation.

School-based Prevention Education Programming

Crisis Center North’s school-based educational programs made 19,809 contacts with youth in 2013-14, and 15,278 in 14-15, and WE AREN'T DONE YET!

School-Based Education encourages students to make healthy choices when dating; to resolve conflicts in their relationships; and to ask for help in unsafe situations.  Crisis Center North is the only documented non-profit in the country to implement optimistic bias (the belief that bad things happen to others rather than oneself) into its programming.  This innovative approach increases the chance that students will take self-protective measures, thus reducing the likelihood of victimization. 

Impact:

·  Crisis Center North’s provision of the Coaching Boys into Men program grew from three to five participating schools in its second year.  One hundred and twelve sessions were conducted with 160 unduplicated students. 

·  Participants demonstrated a significant knowledge gain regarding dating violence and the availability of community services for victims. Scores ranged from a 50% on the pre-test to a 91% on the post-test.

·  The quality of the presenter and programming were rated highly, averaging over 6.2 on a 7-point Likert scale. 

What We Need & What You Get

Evaluated Prevention Education programming is helpful to our communities, but it takes educators and resources to make it happen!

  • Why $6,000? Overall, $6,000 will fully fund programming in 2 schools, or Coaching Boys Into Men/Peer to Peer in 4 schools, assembly programs in 6 or more, etc. Each district chooses their programming, stretching your dollars even farther!
  • Does all of your money go to the program, or are we putting it in the bank? Here at CCN, we know you want your money to go where you tell us to put it. Whether $1 or $1,000, your funds will support our school based programming. CCN is proud to say, we are lean and mean, with .89 cents of every dollar (overall) that enters this agency goes directly towards programming.
  • What do you get? Each donor will receive a  Thank You on CCN's Facebook page. Pledge $25 or more and receive acknowledgement in the summer edition of our newsletter. Donate $500 or more and have your name or business name included on a "Purple Out" t-shirt this coming Fall. 

The Impact

Help us change culture in our schools and community at large. 

  • Reduce disrespectful and violent behaviors
  • Increase by-stander intervention
  • Build a safer environment for our young people
  • Provide funding for schools with tight budget constraints

Risks & Challenges

The end of the school year is near for this year's programming, and we are gearing up for next year as well.

  • While we are applying and looking for funds in other places as well, the number of students we reach is dependent upon the funds we have available by the end of our campaign
  • Dedicated grant funds are under review at local foundations to assist with programming

Other Ways You Can Help

SPREAD THE WORD!!!! With your help, we can get this campaign rocking!

  • Share on social media using #PackALunchToPreventViolence #LoseALatteFor CCN
  • Like and tag Crisis Center North on Facebook and follow and tweet @CrisisCenterNor on Twitter
  • Remember to use the awesome share tools provided by Indiegogo!

Each donor will receive a  Thank You on CCN's Facebook page. Pledge $25 or more and receive acknowledgement in the summer edition of our newsletter. Donate $500 or more and have your name or business name included on a "Purple Out" t-shirt this coming Fall.     The Impact Help us change culture in our schools and community at large.   Reduce disrespectful and violent behaviors Increase by-stander intervention Build a safer environment for our young people
Provide funding for schools with tight budget constraints    Risks & Challenges The end of the school year is near for this year's programming, and we are gearing up for next year as well.  While we are applying and looking for funds in other places as well, the number of students we reach is dependent upon the funds we have available by the end of our campaign Dedicated grant funds are under review at local foundations to assist with programming    Other Ways You Can Help SPREAD THE WORD!!!! With your help, we can get this campaign rocking!  Share on social media using #PackALunchToPreventViolence #LoseALatteFor CCN
Like and tag Crisis Center North on Facebook and follow and tweet @CrisisCenterNor on Twitter Remember to use the awesome share tools provided by Indiegogo!

story:
BACKGROUND

Yiakaki is a twelve year-old Maasai girl who lives in a secluded hillside village in Southwestern Kenya, also known as Maasailand. It is her task to fetch water for her entire family to drink, bathe and cook with. During the increasing periods of drought, Yiakaki and others like her walk long distances to fetch what water they are able, walking home for miles with water containers on their backs. This water is often contaminated. 

GOAL

There is a seasonal spring in Yiakaki’s village that we have been asked by community members to help tap and store the clean water for use during times of drought. For the cost of 8,000 USD we aim to construct a 50,000 litre (Almost 4,000 US gallons) stone and concrete water tank at the base of the spring.

IMPLEMENTATION TIMEFRAME

2015: The project should take two to three weeks from start to finish.

BENEFITS

Significant reduction in time it takes women and girls to fetch water during droughts - This allows mothers to spend more time with their children and girls to continue attending school.

Reduction in malnutrition and waterborne diseases - Without water food cannot be cooked. With the little water they do have during droughts, much of it is contaminated causing diarrhoea, a deadly symptom is young children. “Diarrhoea is a leading killer of children, accounting for 9 per cent of all deaths among children under age 5 worldwide.” – UNICEF

COSTS

47% -  Materials such as stone, cement, sand, loose gravel, rebar, pipes, timber, etc.

28% – Transport of materials and hired labor from outside the community. 

14% – Labor, meals for workers and tools.

4% – Construction of donkey carts.

0% – Donkeys to haul materials from drop off site down a ravine to the foot of the spring. 

6% - Fees incurred by Paypal and Indiegogo.

1% - Contingency

story:
Summary

I am fed up how small and medium sized business owners get taken. 

You know about Yellow Pages, Yelp, Web, Angie List, and others, expensive directory platforms. You possibly receive calls daily. We will prove to you, that Internet Directories with SEO, reviews, links, images and even video inclusion do not have to be that expensive, as other make you believe.

Support our expansion to deliver a less costly alternative to deliver Local Directory Listings for Local Business Owners without busting their marketing budget.

We added a super perk (limited time) for a funding of $12 you will receive a full directory listing for your business category (we will create the category if not yet listed). Even a $5 funding would support our efforts.

Every single month, there are on average 500k brand new businesses starting! These businesses know they MUST get listed on online directories or they will sink very quickly, because 80% of all sales today start with a local search!

And YES, I am fed up how business owners get taken. Paying $1,000's for websites and videos, and up to $300 to $500 per month for listings in directories.  The problem is, that some "Big Name" companies with Telemarketing groups charge the local business owner horrendous fees, telemarketers calling constantly with up-sells, statements to remove reviews, etc... mostly to pay huge commission and bonuses for the "headhunters".

During the last year, myself and two devoted business owners created a concept, to assist EVERY small/medium sized business to get their presence on the Internet. And it makes no difference if they have a website or don't. 

We offer three services to local businesses:

1. Directory listing in targeted Mobile Responsive Local Directories: - with complete business details, Google map, images and video placements (regular rate $1 per day)

2. Directory listing in targeted Mobile Responsive Local Directories, and creating a custom video for the business: - including business details, phone, email and website embedded into the video. Video will be placed on Youtube and a Video Marketing directory

3. Custom Website, mobile responsive, with custom video, directory listing, SEO, hosting, domain, updates in an "All-in-One" pack for a low monthly rental rate at $45 with a 1-time set-up fee.

All our services are based on quarterly or yearly rates. Full transparency, No Hidden charges or up-sells.  I dislike them also.

Our Directories are localized in Country, States, and Cities domain and websites, under our Brand Name: YelloDirect

We are preparing specific niche categories to give business even further exposure, like Restaurants and several other niche categories. 

All our Directories and Custom Websites are Mobile Responsive. Since Google changed how the analyze mobile responsive websites versus non-mobile sites, this has become a major impact how websites are found. 65%+ searches are done using mobile devices. 


What We Need & What You Get

Funds will be used to create added Local Directories. Each Directory has its own domain and fully functional Directory website. We will expand several more niche category directories (sorry - trade secret).  We maintain several hosting servers in different locations in U.S and Europe, and plan to activate two more servers in a short term. Our inventory of prepared videos for niches counts several hundreds and we will have the need to cover a few more selected niches.

Marketing and Perks

We added a super perk (limited time) for a funding of $12 you will receive a full directory listing for your business category (we will create the category if not yet listed). Even a $5 funding would support our efforts.

Marketing will be done through promotion via different social media platforms, targeted email campaign, press releases in local markets. we offer individuals the opportunity to get exclusive marketing for their local market, with a fair designed residual generating income plan.

We created the $3 Challenge to give Local Businesses the opportunity to get their listing in the YelloDirect Local Directories. All our rates have a two year price-lock guarantee. (The standard rate is $1 a day).

Our perks are based on our business and will reward you with the best. $30 funding gives you a 1 year listing in the YelloDirect Network or for $55 you lock your listing for two (2) years.

You will have complete access to all your information and can edit ALL details, including images and even add a video to your portfolio (cannot exceed 1 minute - sorry, we have to keep watch of our bandwidth too...  You can use the perk reward for your own business or enter a clients information as added incentive when you market websites/videos or other services.If your category is not listed, please let me know and I will add such business category

  • Our goal is to raise $4,500 plus, which would complete our planned expansion into all U.S. States, major cities, as well as several main cities in the countries we already established with Country Directories. Furthermore, creating 6 key niche market directories, which have been neglected by even the "Big Boys" companies.  
  • Our perks are the actual product. You will receive a login and password via email, to access the entry form and then can add Your Business information into that Directory. If we do not have a Local Directory established yet for your city, we will add your listing in the closest available to your location or a special niche category, as extra without charge. Additional perks are for a complete custom mobile friendly website with custom video and directory listing, hosting etc. all included, or (you have a website) you can get a custom video and directory listing, all valid for one year exposure.
  • Details about the YelloDirect Network, the custom websites and additional services - more business details on below links 
  • http://3dollarchallenge.com/   Client promo website
  • http://yellodirect.com/         Main Directory website
  • http://yellodirect.com/yellodirect-network-directories/  List of current established Local Directories (plan to add 5 to 7 per week)
  • http://rentalocalwebsite.com/   Custom Website presentation site
  • http://rentalocalwebsite.com/demo-websites/   available niche sites to be customized and video added to the "All-in-One" package
  • Over 500 niche videos prepared, which will be customized with clients details, an Intro & Outro sequence added
  • Watch a few sample videos at the "Gallery" button above


Challenges

Our challenge is to attract quality marketers, who do not want the hassle to create websites, videos  and maintain the back office work for directories, Who do not want the expenses for programs and hosting servers, who do not want to handle backups, updates and maintenance of websites. But rather focus on their ability to sell and market the complete package YelloDirect and RentalocalWebsite can offer. Receiving residual income and instant financial rewards is a huge advantage, and don't have to wait 30 days for a commission.

People value transparency. Our pricing is clearly stated on all websites, and we do NOT have any Hidden Charges, No Up-sells, No "harassing"  phone calls, "What they see is what They get."

Our management team are seasoned business people who have been in sales, in management with their own businesses, and understand and know how to train and guide a marketing force.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean that you can't help:

  • Ask friends, associates, business owners to take advantage of our Perks, and get the service they need anyhow at the most economical rate, get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Don't forget, you can use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • We appreciate your assistance and promise to deliver the best service to all our clients, friends, contributors worldwide.
We will personally contact you to make sure we deliver what we promise. 

And that's all there is to it. Can we count you in?

story:
Help us finish renovating our kitchen so that we can begin our Culinary Arts Program!

The Firehouse Community Arts Center is a safe space in Chicago's Lawndale neighborhood for youth to express their creativity using the arts as a tool of empowerment.

 Our 5 disciplines are: Visual Arts, Culinary, Dance, Technology, Audio Engineering.

story:
Intro

We are a small town specialty coffee roaster with a globally minded mission looking towards expansion of current operations as well as the addition of a coffee shop.  You can read more about our mission and need below.  Stay tuned to this page for updates about the shop.

Our Mission

A tree is a source of life in many ways.  By selling artisan roasted specialty coffee, Three Tree Coffee Roasters is a source of life in 3 ways: 1) empowering our farmers, 2) ending human trafficking and 3) engaging the community.  Visit our website (www.3treecoffeeroasters.com) to learn more or continue reading this section.

Empower the Farmer: 

Coffee farmers are one of the most exploited commodity farmers, sometimes earning less than $1 per pound for their product.  We take pride in making sure our farmers are well taken care of by pursuing sourcing avenues that provide higher wages, safe working conditions, and training on sustainable and quality practices that increase the value of their product.  We desire to form more direct trade relationships to ensure traceability and higher standards of living for our farmers.  Organizations we are currently partnering with include: Fair Trade USA, Thrive Farmers International, and The Cafe Femenino Foundation.



End Human Trafficking:

We partner with local and international organizations to end current day slave labor.  Whether it is through our purchasing habits, fundraisers, or events that bring awareness to this injustice, we want to play our part in seeing victims live in freedom.  We are pleased to have a direct influence in changing the future of labor trafficking victims by empowering our farmers in the coffee industry.  Organizations we have supported include: International Justice Mission and Rahab's Rope.



Engage the Community:

We are proud to represent Statesboro on a global scale and excited to serve our local community.  We partner with local organizations through fundraisers, volunteering and buying many business inputs locally.  Of course, we also provide delicious coffee!  Desiring for our community to join our mission and adopt our passions, we similarly desire to help our community thrive and prosper.  Organizations we have supported include: Fostering Bulloch and Boy Scouts of America.

Our Need

We are moving our roasting facilities in an expansion project which will include opening a coffee shop in Fall 2015.  The new coffee shop will be located at 441 South Main St., Suite A, Statesboro, GA 30458.



Why?

This new location will increase the reach of our mission in many ways. 

1) By serving coffee to the community, we will have more opportunities to share the problems we hope to address through our mission and initiatives, such as the many forms of human trafficking.  Our current lack of daily communication and visibility have kept many from hearing about the hope we offer coffee farmers and trafficking victims.

2) Our new location will provide an avenue to engage and serve our community directly; an aspect of our mission we have been wanting to participate more in.  Beyond providing friendly barista services through our coffee shop, we hope to offer our space to local non-profit organizations. 

3) The new coffee shop will give Three Tree Coffee Roasters another revenue stream, thus continuing to fuel a sustainable way to make a global impact.

Amount?

We need $33,333 to accomplish this next phase of Three Tree Coffee.  The $33,333 will be used for the following: equipment (50%), renovations (25%), signage (10%), starting inventory (10%) and other miscellaneous costs (5%).  Beyond the initial $33,333, we still need upfront capital and we welcome giving over $33,333.


How?

YOU!  We can accomplish more together, as a community of passionate individuals seeking to make a difference in the world, than by ourselves.  Please consider giving to this cause and making a global impact.

You

You can participate in our mission and campaign by:
- giving towards our cause and becoming a financial partner
- sharing this campaign with your friends through word of mouth and social media
- passing along our campaign to organizations with similar missions

More or Less

Any funds raised beyond the $33,333 goal will be applied towards upfront capital first and foremost.  Once we have 3 months worth of expenses covered, we could use excess funds towards the following:
- Establishing Direct Trade relationships with coffee farmers to ensure empowering wages, safe working conditions, highest quality, and sustainable practices. 
- Hosting more events to raise funds and awareness regarding human trafficking.
- Learning more about the coffee trade through expos and conventions, opening opportunities to network with fellow coffee nerds

All perks will still be honored whether we meet our goal or not.   


Gallery 

Check out the gallery for pics of our perks, team, facilities and boss (baby Abigail).

story:
"I used to be a lawyer. Today, I’m a victim." -Adisa Bašić, Bosnian poet  

Last year, catastrophic flooding and heavy rains destroyed the weaving center of The Association of Bosnian Family (BOSFAM), which has been a safe place for war-affected Bosnian women to come and earn an income for two decades. With your support, we can rebuild.

The Weavers

Meet Zifa, born in 1952 in a small Bosnian village who learned to weave beautiful Bosnian carpets (ćilimi) when she was just seven years old. Zifa became a wife and mother of two and lived a pleasant life until the attack on Srebrenica in 1995, when her family was separated and she fled to Tuzla with her daughter and young grandson.

As a refugee waiting in agony for the return of her husband, son, and son-in-law, Zifa wanted to earn an income to support her family and found BOSFAM, where she could continue doing what she was so good at: weaving. Not only did she earn money from her hard work, but she met other women in similarly devastating situations with whom she could relate and go to for emotional support.

Zifa was reunited with her husband in Tuzla where they waited for over a decade for their son. In 2007, Zifa's son, only in his twenties during the massacre, was identified and buried in Potočari as one of the over 8,000 victims of genocide. During the summer of 2015, twenty years after the fall of Srebrenica, her son-in-law was identified and laid to rest.

Zifa still works at BOSFAM as hard as ever, making large, intricate carpets to support her family, including her grandson's education. Despite seemingly never-ending tragedy, Zifa is often smiling and can be found at a BOSFAM loom in Tuzla nearly every day of the week, hard at work.

Unfortunately, the current condition of BOSFAM's workshop make it difficult for BOSFAM to accommodate more than three or four weavers at a time and Zifa's income, as well as that of the rest of the women of BOSFAM, is at risk of disappearing altogether.

The Project

Last year, the Balkans received a month's worth of rain in a matter of days, leading to the worst flooding in 120 years, the destruction of countless buildings, and the deaths of at least 40 people. The heavy rainfall destroyed BOSFAM's main workshop in Tuzla and has left hard-working women without a way to earn an income. At its peak, BOSFAM had a network of 300-400 women, supporting 25-30 in its workshop each day. Now, only 3-4 women can come to weave and the network of women is waiting to return. Without the workshop, BOSFAM’s very existence hangs in the balance.

We need to raise $10,000 to get our workshop back in operation before winter so BOSFAM can continue to function at full capacity. Here's how it breaks down:

  • $6,200 to construct two roofs over exposed areas of the workshop to prevent future water damage. You can view the details in our official estimate from a local contractor.
  • $1,300 to finish interior cosmetic repairs from water damage, including painting.
  • $1,500 for the costs of handicraft production.
  • $1,000 to cover our fundraising costs, including Indiegogo fees and payment processing.

We invite you to read our business plan for more details.

The Perks

When you invest in BOSFAM's workshop reconstruction, you have the opportunity to claim one of the following unique rewards:

*Shipping not included. Colors and sizes may vary. While supplies last.

The Impact

This opportunity is unique because it is not a handout. The women of BOSFAM are hard-working and want to earn their keep and after years of displacement and hardship are not seeking charity.

By investing in the reconstruction of the workshop, you will be supporting:

  • 15-20 women working in Tuzla workshop each day on a rotating schedule to accommodate a wide network of workers.
  • 20-25 women working in our Srebrenica center two days a week.
  • Wide network totaling 150 women workers.
  • Children, elderly parents, and other family members dependent upon women’s incomes.
  • Communities rebuilding socially and economically from Bosnian war.

The War

The horrors of the Bosnian war came to a head in July 1995 in the United Nations "safe zone" in Srebrenica. While children were given candy from the advancing Bosnian Serb Army and families were reassured of their safety, women were separated, and the men disappeared, never to be heard from again.

What is now known as the Srebrenica massacre resulted in the slaughter of over 8,000 Bosnian Muslim men and boys and was ruled a genocide in 2004. While the majority of victims in Srebrenica were men, the women were shouldered with the heavy burden of caring for their families while dealing with the unfathomable traumas of war, displacement, and "ethnic cleansing".

The Vision

BOSFAM, led by the tenacious Beba Hadžić, emerged from the ashes of the war in 1994 to support Bosnian women from all sides of the conflict, regardless of ethnicity or religion. BOSFAM sought to provide a way for women to earn a sustainable income with dignity, support one another emotionally, and advocate for the return of their missing family members.

For the last two decades, the women of BOSFAM have worked together, creating handwoven ćilimi (traditional Bosnian carpets) and other handcrafted goods to earn an income and lead by a strong example for Bosnian civil society as tensions between ethnic and religious groups continue.

Our Partner

In 1999, BOSFAM joined forces with the Washington, DC-based organization, The Advocacy Project (AP) with a mission to “help marginalized communities to tell their story, claim their rights, and produce social change.” AP began sending graduate student Peace Fellows to BOSFAM in 2003 and has sent a total of 15 Fellows to support BOSFAM and strengthen the partnership between the organizations. 

AP has advocated for BOSFAM through campaigns, fundraising, memorial quilt exhibitions, and training in technical skills to encourage BOSFAM's growth. AP has also shared BOSFAM's Srebrenica memorial quilt project with other grassroots organization around the world and inspired women in Peru to Vietnam to Palestine to Mali to engage in advocacy quilting to share their stories.

AP's current Peace Fellow, Sarah Reichenbach, as well as its Washington, DC team are amplifying BOSFAM's vision and supporting them tremendously throughout the duration of the workshop's reconstruction to ensure BOSFAM's continued success.
story_txt:
"I used to be a lawyer. Today, I’m a victim." -Adisa Bašić, Bosnian poet  Last year, catastrophic flooding and heavy rains destroyed the weaving center of The Association of Bosnian Family (BOSFAM), which has been a safe place for war-affected Bosnian women to come and earn an income for two decades. With your support, we can rebuild.


The WeaversMeet Zifa, born in 1952 in a small Bosnian village who learned to weave beautiful Bosnian carpets (ćilimi) when she was just seven years old. Zifa became a wife and mother of two and lived a pleasant life until the attack on Srebrenica in 1995, when her family was separated and she fled to Tuzla with her daughter and young grandson.As a refugee waiting in agony for the return of her husband, son, and son-in-law, Zifa wanted to earn an income to support her family and found BOSFAM, where she could continue doing what she was so good at: weaving. Not only did she earn money from her hard work, but she met other women in similarly devastating situations with whom she could relate and go to for emotional support.Zifa was reunited with her husband in Tuzla where they waited for over a decade for their son. In 2007, Zifa's son, only in his twenties during the massacre, was identified and buried in Potočari as one of the over 8,000 victims of genocide. During the summer of 2015, twenty years after the fall of Srebrenica, her son-in-law was identified and laid to rest.Zifa still works at BOSFAM as hard as ever, making large, intricate carpets to support her family, including her grandson's education. Despite seemingly never-ending tragedy, Zifa is often smiling and can be found at a BOSFAM loom in Tuzla nearly every day of the week, hard at work.Unfortunately, the current condition of BOSFAM's workshop make it difficult for BOSFAM to accommodate more than three or four weavers at a time and Zifa's income, as well as that of the rest of the women of BOSFAM, is at risk of disappearing altogether.The ProjectLast year, the Balkans received a month's worth of rain in a matter of days, leading to the worst flooding in 120 years, the destruction of countless buildings, and the deaths of at least 40 people. The heavy rainfall destroyed BOSFAM's main workshop in Tuzla and has left hard-working women without a way to earn an income. At its peak, BOSFAM had a network of 300-400 women, supporting 25-30 in its workshop each day. Now, only 3-4 women can come to weave and the network of women is waiting to return. Without the workshop, BOSFAM’s very existence hangs in the balance.We need to raise $10,000 to get our workshop back in operation before winter so BOSFAM can continue to function at full capacity. Here's how it breaks down:

$6,200 to construct two roofs over exposed areas of the workshop to prevent future water damage. You can view the details in our official estimate from a local contractor.


$1,300 to finish interior cosmetic repairs from water damage, including painting.


$1,500 for the costs of handicraft production.


$1,000 to cover our fundraising costs, including Indiegogo fees and payment processing.

We invite you to read our business plan for more details.
The PerksWhen you invest in BOSFAM's workshop reconstruction, you have the opportunity to claim one of the following unique rewards:*Shipping not included. Colors and sizes may vary. While supplies last.
The ImpactThis opportunity is unique because it is not a handout. The women of BOSFAM are hard-working and want to earn their keep and after years of displacement and hardship are not seeking charity.By investing in the reconstruction of the workshop, you will be supporting:

15-20 women working in Tuzla workshop each day on a rotating schedule to accommodate a wide network of workers.


20-25 women working in our Srebrenica center two days a week.


Wide network totaling 150 women workers.


Children, elderly parents, and other family members dependent upon women’s incomes.


Communities rebuilding socially and economically from Bosnian war.


The WarThe horrors of the Bosnian war came to a head in July 1995 in the United Nations "safe zone" in Srebrenica. While children were given candy from the advancing Bosnian Serb Army and families were reassured of their safety, women were separated, and the men disappeared, never to be heard from again.What is now known as the Srebrenica massacre resulted in the slaughter of over 8,000 Bosnian Muslim men and boys and was ruled a genocide in 2004. While the majority of victims in Srebrenica were men, the women were shouldered with the heavy burden of caring for their families while dealing with the unfathomable traumas of war, displacement, and "ethnic cleansing".The VisionBOSFAM, led by the tenacious Beba Hadžić, emerged from the ashes of the war in 1994 to support Bosnian women from all sides of the conflict, regardless of ethnicity or religion. BOSFAM sought to provide a way for women to earn a sustainable income with dignity, support one another emotionally, and advocate for the return of their missing family members.For the last two decades, the women of BOSFAM have worked together, creating handwoven ćilimi (traditional Bosnian carpets) and other handcrafted goods to earn an income and lead by a strong example for Bosnian civil society as tensions between ethnic and religious groups continue.Our PartnerIn 1999, BOSFAM joined forces with the Washington, DC-based organization, The Advocacy Project (AP) with a mission to “help marginalized communities to tell their story, claim their rights, and produce social change.” AP began sending graduate student Peace Fellows to BOSFAM in 2003 and has sent a total of 15 Fellows to support BOSFAM and strengthen the partnership between the organizations. AP has advocated for BOSFAM through campaigns, fundraising, memorial quilt exhibitions, and training in technical skills to encourage BOSFAM's growth. AP has also shared BOSFAM's Srebrenica memorial quilt project with other grassroots organization around the world and inspired women in Peru to Vietnam to Palestine to Mali to engage in advocacy quilting to share their stories.AP's current Peace Fellow, Sarah Reichenbach, as well as its Washington, DC team are amplifying BOSFAM's vision and supporting them tremendously throughout the duration of the workshop's reconstruction to ensure BOSFAM's continued success.

story:
Lovely people! A massive massive thank you to all your support, contributions and most of all, your amazing-out-of-this-world-positive-energy!!

You've probably already heard by now, Greece is in deep economic shiz. For this reason, the majority of my fellow Greek friends are unable to contribute and those who can, can't, as most online payments have been disabled for this week. Indeedy, I myself wanted to contribute to Tom Feeny's amazing gesture of solidarity and empathy 'Greek Bailout Fund' but transfers on my card are not allowed (hopefully this will be lifted from Sunday 5/7).  Which is also the day I fly out and officially begin the Warriors journey.

So, my lovely friends, keep sharing and spreading this page with your friends and family and anyone you think could donate to this cause, so I can raise the funds needed to pay the Instituto Elos, and learn the skills that will make the world a little bit of a better place.

Because building a world that we all want to live in, is in our hands. And we need to start planning, designing and materialising, now, more than ever.

***************************************************************************

Hello, γεια σας and olá! Welcome to my campaign page.

Let me introduce myself

My name is Georgina (you can call me Raz) and I am a citizen of the world. I was born in London, grew up in a wonderfully crazy Greek - Arabic household and now live in Athens, Greece.

I said YES to a challenge to build the world we dream of right now and I need your support. Please help me attend the Warriors Without Weapons training program and help transform people's lives, starting in Brazil!

  • Where: Santos, São Paulo, Brazil
  • When: July 6th to August 6th, 2015
  • I am the second Greek with the opportunity to attend the program, which has been running since 1999.

So what is Warriors Without Weapons?

Warriors Without Weapons is a 32-day international community and social entrepreneurship training program offered to youth, who want to change the world NOW.

The program offers a number of tools that facilitate collective decision-making and implementation of projects in communities in a challenging cultural and social environment.

60 young "warriors" from over 15 different countries come together and realise a collective dream with 3 underprivileged communities in Santos, Brazil!

Ok, you got my attention. How does it work?

Where others see scarcity, we see abundance! Using a methodology that teaches that every community is rich with resources (that when recognised encourage self-reliance and build confidence) the participants work hand in hand with the community to plan, design and materialise tangible things like parks, cultural centres or playgrounds; so tires are turned into swings and concrete blocks in to plant pots.

And this methodology emphasises that we can do it in a collective, pleasurable and fun way!


And what happens after the 32 days?

This is the best bit. Warriors Without Weapons is about materializing collective dreams, and actively changing people's lives, everywhere. Throughout the 32 day training period, participants are provided with the tools needed to transform lives anywhere in the world and within any community that faces daily struggles and social injustices. It starts local and goes global.


What about the participants’ own country? What about Greece?

When participants return to their country of residence, through an ongoing mentorship, they are actively encouraged to implement what they learned, in to their daily lives and help transform their community. 

Who runs the program?

For more info on the program check out my blog and the below links:

  • My blog: http://hopyourplanet.blogspot.gr/
  • Instituto Elos: http://institutoelos.org/en/
  • Warriors Without Weapons: https://warriorswithoutweapons.wordpress.com/
  • 10 minute video on program: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pstImQzgp5w

Costs

Program fee: The total cost for each warrior is R$12,000 (Brazilian real) and Instituto Elos covers half of this amount through fundraising and partnerships. The other half is the responsibility of each participant. That means, they rely on me to pay R$6,000, which corresponds to approximately €1,750. This fee includes the program’s running cost, accommodation, meals, and transportation in Santos.

Total: €1,984 (this also includes the indiegogo fee + currency rate)

Why do I want to go? 

I believe in positive change. And I believe in community. And when we combine positive action, with an empowered community, miracles can happen and dreams are constructed. What are the chances of making the world a better place, a fairer place and a place we all want to live in? With Warriors Without Weapons the chances are tipped in favor of collective positive change. Bringing this methodology back to Greece (at a time when it needs it the most), and the UK (who can pioneer such changes), is an invaluable opportunity, for both communities, and something I am passionate and excited about.

What can I do for you? 

Firstly, you have my deepest gratitude and eternal thanks!! Your support and generosity is not only helping 3 underprivileged communities in Brazil, it is also helping a young doer build the world we dream of right now. Wait!! There's more!! I've also created a set of fun perks for you to enjoy and to remember that you didn't just change this gal's life but the lives of whole communities in Brazil. PLUS the perks will include ridiculous facial expressions, awful dancing and general all round goofiness. Because who doesn't like laughing at their friend looking all silly and stuff??

Other ways you can help
Thank you for making it to the end of the campaign page! If you believe in this project as much as I do, you can help me spread the word and make some noise - please share my campaign link to all the dreamers, creators and doers you know! The time to change the world is now and, together, we can.

THANK YOU! SHUKRAN! ΕΥΧΑΡΙΣΤΩ! OBRIGADA!

story:
Sonoma Cellar wants to share California and Virginia wines with you in metro D.C. We need your help to finish the compliance remodels and upgrades of our tasting room’s historic King Street location.

Okay, I'm putting it out there. We have been overwhelmed with the cost of historic preservation for the building and we need money to bring the best wine into the shop and not spend the last of our moola on a building. We cannot let the lease be our stranglehold on stopping a dream. This has become a historical love affair with a location so ideal, so cool, that we cannot back down now. 

Our landlord is not a very nice guy and has not and will not maintain his building. In order to open and not let him win -- we need your donations and in return we will give you some awesome perks. This is a wine - wine (oops... win - win). And, the perks are wonderful! 

Come on and help us... Let everyone know and share the love of an old decrepit building and the love of wine. We can make this work - let's do it together!

We have scrimped and saved to open a wine tasting room that will exceed all expectations of what great wine and craft food should be. We have done our research and we are almost ready to open the doors. We are in serious need of your help and donations, otherwise we will be running seriously short on being able to finish our dream and have it be your reality.

What we did not expect was to be fully responsible for the historic preservation of an amazing building that has long been left to ruin. We are committed to bringing you an amazing experience in a fully restored historic 1810 building that meets current building codes. Not an easy task - especially when the last renovation took place like a gazillion years ago. Seriously, it was in the 1940's and 1980's.


Be part of Sonoma Cellar and enjoy "A Taste of California”

AND get a perk with your donation!

We want to do more than just pour and sell wine at Sonoma Cellar:  We want to share our passion for California and Virginia wines and offer a true “taste of California” with our selection of handpicked wines (650+) from over 170 wineries primarily from Sonoma County and Virginia and with great representation from Washington, Oregon and New York as the top five states. We are bringing an exclusive selection of wine from the Americas, with a sprinkling of wine from other far away places.

It’s all about your experience: wine tasting, hanging out, eating great food from the best and freshest sources, meeting new friends and sharing with family. That is life. 

(This is the ballroom - the bistro main dining - it is almost ready and beautiful.)


Read on to get to know us, what we bring to the table, and exactly what we need to do at our phenomenal location to give you an extraordinary experience.

Just who are these crazy wine people? 


Rick and Elizabeth are longtime wine lovers who believe that winemakers are artists who share their creative content in liquid form. Rick is a combat veteran who has been in the U.S. Navy and Reserve for more than 39 years. Elizabeth, the CEO of the organization, is turning their dream into reality.

The Myllenbeck’s met serendipitously at Fenestra Winery in Livermore, California (we’ll be offering their wines in Sonoma Cellar). As residents of Virginia for the past three years, Rick and Elizabeth have explored and tasted wine all across the state. Their experiences on both coasts make them passionate for all good things. 

They celebrate the wine tasting experience as one of the few lifestyle activities that appeals to all the senses -- simultaneously. They are excited to bring this passion and practice to Old Town and the metro Washington, D.C., area. By the way, the metro DC area is the largest consumers of wine in the nation. Perfect!

We need your help to build our community and fulfill a dream. Let’s discuss:

Our vision, our dream, and our location ROCK. We even have a backyard and it is our plan to turn that into a specialty wine garden and “chill zone”.


As you can imagine, this amazing, historic, beautiful building is a gem — yet it is in serious disrepair after years of neglect, and has given us a number of unexpected, nearly show-stopping challenges. 

What we need and what you get: You get AMAZING perks. Check them out and donate... You will be so happy!!

Why are we going to Indiegogo? Why do we seriously need your help? We are putting it out there – no monkey business:

1.  We need to replace the heating, ventilating and air conditioning system (or HVAC) that is 25 years old and condemned. The landlord will not replace it. He is not cool. 

$80K may seem like a bunch of money, but the price tag on the entire HVAC system is over $60,000. Special ordered just for historical buildings. We had no idea...

(Marine HVAC system - traditionally used for big boats is what we have to install.)

2.  We need a fantastic, yet practical, wine garden that wows while serving as the center of happiness. Think fire-pit, fountain and lots of fairy lights. Awesome! This is the magic place and a $10K renovation.

3.  We need to build a custom, industrial-strength kitchen ventilating hood that complies with the City of Alexandria’s Historic District. OMG - the requirements! No matter, we are committed to the historical needs of the building and we have no choice but to do what needs to be done. Oh yeah, this baby will cost us right at $28K. Not pretty, but the City will be happy and will keep our chefs nice and cool.

Our goal? $80,000

We are celebrating the historic provenance of the building while staying true to our vision. We are adding more power and upgrading the plumbing – which dates back to the 1920s. We are adding two ADA-compliant restrooms so we can comfortably host our disabled patrons and veterans.  We have the power (at $17K for the new upgraded electrical panel) and the potties handled (another $40K), but the rest – well, that's where we need your help. We will have put over $200,000 into the building - that was our budget to begin with for all things Sonoma Cellar... Things are VERY tight. We must prevail!


Why we need you (besides having more fun and meeting new friends): 

As a result, we are in need of your confidence and support in helping us complete the three remaining big ticket items. Now is the time for the final push to get us to our opening – and you can be a part of that. Did we also mention the great fun you will have being a vital part of Sonoma Cellar and part of the family.

Perks? Absolutely! 

At Sonoma Cellar, we are committed to bringing you a great wine tasting and food experience – with a unique ambience. With your contributions, you get even more, to include our heartfelt appreciation. So, please donate and grab a perk. 

Seriously, the perks are AMAZING. 

With Sonoma Cellar, it is all about you and creating value while giving you a fun and memorable experience. No matter what, your donation matters deeply.  Super deeply.

Your contribution really, really matters... You can read on - or go straight to the perks. Yep - they are that good. 

We are not your average wine bar, restaurant or gourmet food shop. Not even close. This is what sets us apart:

A hands-on, personal approach: We are offering fabulous wines — all of which are personally and individually hand-selected by the Myllenbeck’s. Many of the wines are unattainable here, and we have worked to bring exceptional and new wines from boutique wineries to the East Coast. 

(Rick visiting Lynmar Estates winery in Sonoma. Beautiful Rose'.)

Our business plan is solid: We have completed in-depth market research – from projected customers and expenditures to bringing in new wines, foods, and retail items to the area. We have crunched the numbers with the pros and made sure that the business is viable in multiple ways. 

We have created a solid roadmap that has considered all outside and inside forces that work for and against a small business. We have prepared, and we have an incredible advisory panel that has been and is our sounding board and our reality check. Net-net? LET’S DO THIS!

(Chef Bernard Henry's Shrimp with zucchini spaghetti - super yum.)

We are part of a bigger community: We have received tons of encouragement and moral support for our concept from all parties possible, but the community that we are most proud of joining is that of Virginia. 

We embrace the model of a benefit corporation by paying our employees top wages and caring for their wellbeing and futures. By being a green-labeled company, we are committed to caring for the environment responsibly and using the freshest, locally sourced foods possible through a commitment to local food artisans. 

We love people and helping the community – it is a result of our professions and who we are – deep down. This is all great stuff that you can be a part of. You can help us make it happen with your donation and getting a great perk too. 

(Remy, our wine dog loves to say hi! He cannot wait for Pinot and Pups night in the wine garden.)

Other ways you can help:

We realize that this may sound all great to you, but maybe you still cannot help financially. We ask that you share the opportunity with your friends: Use Indiegogo’s “share” tool; seek us out at www.mysonomacellar.com; visit us on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter; or just swing by Sonoma Cellar in Old Town to say hello and join us for a tasting – and tell your buddies.


* Does not include travel costs or accommodations.

of the few lifestyle activities that appeals to all the senses -- simultaneously.

Washington, D.C., area. By the way, the metro DC area is the largest consumers of wine in the nation. Perfect!
We need your help to build our community and
fulfill a dream. Let’s discuss:
Our vision, our dream, and our location ROCK. We even have a backyard and it is our plan to turn that into a specialty wine garden and “chill zone”.


As you can imagine, this amazing, historic, beautiful building
is a gem — yet it is in serious disrepair after years of neglect, and has given
us a number of unexpected, nearly show-stopping challenges. 
What we need and what you get: You get AMAZING perks. Check them out and donate... You will be so happy!!
Why are we going to Indiegogo? Why do we
seriously need your help? We are putting it out there – no monkey business:
1. 
We need to replace the heating, ventilating and air conditioning system (or HVAC) that is 25 years old and
condemned. The landlord will not replace it. He is not cool. 
$80K may seem like a bunch of money, but the price tag on the entire HVAC system is over $60,000. Special ordered just for historical buildings. We had no idea...







(Marine HVAC system - traditionally used for big boats is what we have to install.)
2. 
We need a fantastic, yet practical, wine garden that wows while serving as the center of happiness. Think fire-pit, fountain and lots of fairy lights. Awesome! This is the magic place and a $10K renovation.

3. 
We need to build a custom, industrial-strength kitchen ventilating hood that
complies with the City of Alexandria’s Historic District. OMG - the requirements! No matter, we are committed to the historical needs of the building and we have no choice but to do what needs to be done. Oh yeah, this baby will cost us right at $28K. Not pretty, but the City will be happy and will keep our chefs nice and cool.



Our goal? $80,000
We are celebrating the historic provenance of the building while
staying true to our vision. We are adding more power and upgrading the plumbing
– which dates back to the 1920s. We are adding two ADA-compliant restrooms so
we can comfortably host our disabled patrons and veterans.  We have the power (at $17K for the new upgraded electrical panel) and
the potties handled (another $40K), but the rest – well, that's where we need your help. We will have put over $200,000 into the building - that was our budget to begin with for all things Sonoma Cellar... Things are VERY tight. We must prevail!



Why we need you (besides having more fun and
meeting new friends): 
As a result, we are in need of your confidence and support in
helping us complete the three remaining big ticket items. Now is the time for the
final push to get us to our opening – and you can be a part of that. Did we
also mention the great fun you will have being a vital part of Sonoma Cellar and part of the family.
Perks? Absolutely! 
At Sonoma Cellar,
we are committed to bringing you a great wine tasting and food experience –
with a unique ambience. With your contributions, you get even more, to include
our heartfelt appreciation. So, please donate and grab a perk. 
Seriously, the perks are AMAZING. 
With Sonoma
Cellar, it is all about you and creating value while giving you a fun
and memorable experience. No matter what, your donation matters deeply.  Super deeply.
Your contribution really, really matters... You can read on - or go straight to the perks. Yep - they are that good. 
We are not your average wine bar, restaurant or gourmet food
shop. Not even close. This is what sets us apart:
A hands-on, personal approach: We are offering fabulous wines — all of which are
personally and individually hand-selected by the Myllenbeck’s. Many of the
wines are unattainable here, and we have worked to bring exceptional and new
wines from boutique wineries to the East Coast. 


(Rick visiting Lynmar Estates winery in Sonoma. Beautiful Rose'.)
Our business plan is solid: We have completed in-depth market research – from
projected customers and expenditures to bringing in new wines, foods, and
retail items to the area. We have crunched the numbers with the pros and made
sure that the business is viable in multiple ways. 
We have created a solid
roadmap that has considered all outside and inside forces that work for and
against a small business. We have prepared, and we have an incredible advisory
panel that has been and is our sounding board and our reality check. Net-net? LET’S
DO THIS!

(Chef Bernard Henry's Shrimp with zucchini spaghetti - super yum.)
We are part of a bigger
community: We
have received tons of encouragement and moral support for our concept from all
parties possible, but the community that we are most proud of joining is that
of Virginia. 
We embrace the model of a benefit corporation by paying our
employees top wages and caring for their wellbeing and futures. By being a
green-labeled company, we are committed to caring for the environment
responsibly and using the freshest, locally sourced foods possible through a commitment
to local food artisans. 
We love people and helping the community – it is a
result of our professions and who we are – deep down. This is all great stuff that you can be a part of. You can help us make it happen with your donation and getting a great perk too. 

(Remy, our wine dog loves to say hi! He cannot wait for Pinot and Pups night in the wine garden.)
Other ways you can help:
We realize that this may sound all great to you, but maybe you
still cannot help financially. We ask that you share the opportunity with your friends: Use
Indiegogo’s “share” tool; seek us out at www.mysonomacellar.com; visit
us on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter; or just swing by Sonoma Cellar in Old Town to say
hello and join us for a tasting – and tell your buddies.




* Does not include travel costs or
accommodations.

story:
Our goal is to prepare Veterans for employment opportunities in Security Services by providing the necessary training, certifications and assistance to begin a new career. The funds raised through this program will be used to provide the state mandated training to qualify Veterans for the Florida Unarmed Security Guard license.

Upon completion of the 40 hour curriculum, GPPS will assist the Veteran in completing the Florida State application and guide them through the licensing process. In addition, GPPS will pay all fees charged by the State for application processing, finger printing and background checks enabling the Veteran to obtain this license at no personal cost.

Once the Veteran is licensed to work as a Security Professional, GPPS will provide a Veteran’s Preference for all positions within our company and will provide ongoing career guidance and placement assistance at no cost to the Veteran.

Our mission is to serve those who served. Whether they served on the front lines in combat or in a support role in some remote corner of the world, our Veterans have all made significant sacrifices so that we can enjoy our everyday freedoms. Returning to civilian occupations and earning a sustainable income can be a difficult challenge for these individuals and we need your help to assist these heroes.

The Impact

Even a small donation can help us change the life of a Veteran. The cost of training, support and licensing will be $350 for each Veteran. The funding goal of this program is designed to help a minimum of 50 Veterans but combining even the smallest contribution with those of other grateful participants can help us repay these brave men and women for their service.

Training can begin as each $350 plateau is reached. This can have an immediate effect on our Veterans and their families by providing an industry recognized credential and opening doors for employment.

The Security Field is a growth industry offering opportunities not only for employment but for career growth. At GPPS we are Veterans and ex-Law Enforcement professionals who recognize and value the service of our military. Our program is designed to provide the training and skills employers are currently seeking based on real world experience. In addition, GPPS will provide ongoing career guidance at no cost to the Veteran and will offer opportunities to attain additional certifications to help them advance.

Risks & Challenges

The Security Field is not for everyone. It requires a unique blend of knowledge, skills and commitment. Our Veterans have demonstrated the courage and personal attributes essential to succeed in this challenging profession and our program is designed to provide the necessary knowledge and skills to enter this field.

Since these services are provided one Veteran at a time, failure to reach our full funding objective will slow our success but will not stop us from helping Veterans. Each $350 increment means we can help a Veteran and his or her family.

Other Ways You Can Help

Our primary goal is to raise funds through financial contributions. However, sharing this program with your personal and professional network will enable us to reach more like minded individuals and possibly expand this program to impact even more lives. Sustainable employment is the greatest challenge facing our Veterans as they transition back to civilian life. Our goal is to provide Vets with the training and support necessary to gain meaningful employment and create a career.

We appreciate any help or support you can provide.

story:
For my safety, I cannot provide many details, but chances are that you've been directed to this page by someone you know and trust who knows me and knows the reality of my situation.

I fled from an extremely abusive household several weeks ago. In addition to the abuse, I remain in the closet about the fact that I no longer share the same religious beliefs as them because openly stating this to them would result in certain violence.

My family managed to track me and find me where I was staying through a bank account of mine (they were not authorized users of the account, but I suspect that they enlisted the help of one of several tellers who are friends of my family). I have since relocated and am staying somewhere else temporarily.

I would like to close the bank account (which I have stopped using entirely since) that they managed to gain access to in order to reduce my trail and prevent being tracked by them again. However, I cannot do so until the outstanding loan amount on the account is paid off.

I have created this campaign in order to seek assistance with paying off that loan amount to help me pay it off and further distance myself from my abusive upbringing.  The short, 15 day deadline is set because of my need to get this done as soon as possible.

I ask you to help me clear debt so that I can have a reset in life and live free of constant fears for my safety and well-being.

Again, I am aware that you may feel natural skepticism, but as I said, you've likely been directed to this page by a friend you know and trust who's aware of the reality of my situation.

Thank you for your time and for anything you contribute.

"It's always the darkest before the dawn."

story:
The Inaugural Pumpkin Mash Dash

Keep Colleyville Beautiful (http://www.keepcolleyvillebeautiful.com/) is a community based non-profit organization focused on bettering the lives of Colleyville residents. Colleyville’s current recycling program is a reflection of KCB members’ efforts. Additionally, KCB administers Colleyville’s Adopt-A-Street program and participates in the annual city wide Clean Sweep event. KCB would like to expand its efforts to include such things as a community garden and more community events. To help achieve this goal KCB has decided to start a new tradition in Colleyville, with the inaugural Pumpkin Mash Dash on November 7th, 2015 at the Pleasant Run Soccer Complex, 6700 Pleasant Run, Colleyville, Texas.

The Pumpkin Mash Dash will be an annual late-afternoon fun run/walk and timed 5K/10K race along the beautiful Cotton Belt Trail in Colleyville, Texas. Additionally, after the race there will be a community Lighted Bicycle Parade for all ages. The hope is that this event will help raise money for KCB, raise community awareness of KCB, and be a chance for people to come together and enjoy Colleyville’s portion of the Cotton Belt Trail with a run and a unique parade. At the event KCB also hopes to educate the public on recycling, litter control, beautification, the environment and health.

Why Indiegogo for fundraising?

Through Indiegogo as a non-profit, all donations will be tax deductible. Additionally, by having our fundraising effort on Indiegogo, supporters can pay by credit card. We can also reach a large group of supporters we may not even know. KCB is a volunteer, non-profit organization which only receives funding from grants and donations. A race has lots of expenses, and we expect the Pumpkin Mash Dash at a minimum to cost $4000 at a minimum to put on. This will drain a large portion of our limited funding. With 300-400 runners and their associated registration fees, the Pumpkin Mash Dash is expected to just break even. Since this is the first time KCB has put on such an event there is a great unknown around how many participants there will be and a chance for unplanned expenses. We have teamed with a great race organizer, PlayTri, who has donated their skills and expertise to help us put on the Pumpkin Mash Dash. We have also consulted with other non-profit groups who put on races. We feel prepared, but there still are risks. By raising funds through Indiegogo, these risks can be offset and more of the registration fees can be used by KCB for its efforts. All the funds raised here will go directly to putting on the Pumpkin Mash Dash and Lighted Bicycle Parade. If we exceed our goals, those proceeds will go to making the race and parade even better next year.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk and challenge is Keep Colleyville Beautiful has never done an event like this before. Even with the help we are receiving from PlayTri and other non-profits, something could happen we haven’t planned for.

Where can I register for the race?

www.playtri.com/pumpkinmashdash

What is a Lighted Bicycle Parade?

The Lighted Bicycle Parade is a community event where participants will ride their bicycles on a short course around the Colleyville Pleasant Run Soccer Complex. At a minimum bicycles will need headlights, but riders are encouraged to decorate their bicycles as brightly and colorfully as they can. Registration for the parade is free and open to all ages who can operate a bike by headlight, at dusk, at slow speeds, safely. Bike-pulled trailers will be allowed as long as they are securely attached to the bicycle and have a breakaway cable/device. Open flames and throwing items from bicycles such as candy isprohibited due to insurance reasons.

Where can I register for the Lighted Bicycle Parade?

www.playtri.com/pumpkinmashdash

What happens if you don’t meet your fundraising goal?

The race and parade will still go on. Every dollar we raise will help us, but if we come up short in fundraising, it will make it extremely difficult to do all the things KCB currently does and would like to do in the future.

Can the race be cancelled?

The race would only be cancelled due to extreme weather or other catastrophe. A cancelled race will not be rescheduled. Registration for runners is non-refundable. Runners will still get a race shirt, and Indiegogo supporters will get their rewards. “Get A Booth” supporters will get refunds if they desire. If you have further questions please contact this campaign’s organizer before donating.

I have a question I can’t find an answer for?

Please contact the campaign organizer with any questions. We’ll as quickly as possible address your question because… we are sure others have the same question.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways other than donating where you can help. A race and parade like this need lots of volunteers before, during, after and the day after the event. If you are interested, please contact this campaign’s organizer. Additionally, please tell everyone you know to register for the race or donate. The more people who hear about the Pumpkin Mash Dash and this fundraising campaign, the more likely Keep Colleyville Beautiful is to have a successful race and meet our fundraising goal.

Please follow us on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/KeepColleyvilleBeautiful/

story:
I am raising the money for the purchase of building to then refurbish them into comfortable homes for homeless ex servicemen. This would give them a fixed address so it is more likely that they will be able to have a comfortable bed to sleep in every night to being able to get an appointment at the local GP and more likely to get help from local government.

The money will be used accordingly where £5000 would be used for travelling expenses for the ex servicemen to travel to their new homes after the refurbishment. With help from local volunteers and local and national charities we can organise a refurbishment with the rest of the money. All the refurbishment will be updated regularly on the Facebook group so people can offer support and get involved.

I will work with two local charities so we can find the homeless ex servicemen. The money will be used to refurbish at least two properties. Raised funds will go straight into an account that will go straight into funding where it will take the approval of three people to pay for anything! 

If this is successful then I will raise more funds to have individual/families that are homeless.

story:
Alaska has only just allowed legal private use of marijuana starting on Feb 24 2015.  

The Higher Calling will provide a safe private place for cannabis enthusiasts to celebrate cannabis culture in a relaxed atmosphere. Members can meet and share growing tips, information, attend seminars, and smoke marijuana with their friends. We will provide a coffee shop, snacks and sandwiches, a lounge area, hookas for rent, and many other services. We will also sell clothing merchandise with the club logos and books on marijuana cultivation.

We intend to attract daily and casual smokers, and even those who do not smoke but wish to grow. Alaska has only just recently legalized private personal use of marijuana and growing of cannabis. This has created a large market for this type of club.

We want to start small with a large building. First will be a cafe called The Higher Ground and lounges, and as our clientele grows we will expand into the space. This will include a lounge with video games and TV, a projector area to show movies, a concert area that can also be used for seminars, competitions, and private events.

The Higher ground will provide the following services

  • Daily, Monthly and Annual memberships

  • Provide a safe secure private place for cannabis users to celebrate cannabis culture

  • Full service coffee and sandwich shop

  • Eventually, a aull service restaurant

  • Lounge with tables, chairs, and couches

  • Free candy and brewed coffee for members

  • A private space to rent for special events

  • A stage for seminars and concerts

  • A projector for films, sports, and TV events

  • Small baked goods, deli style sandwiches, and other assorted snacks

  • T-shirts, promotional clothing items, and other promotional goods

  • Books on marijuana cultivation and culture
